About the opportunity  The Research Reporting, Analysis, Data and Systems team is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join their team. As the Research Data Scientist, you will provide conceptualisation, visualisation and production of high quality analysis and reports in order to support operational and strategic decision making around a range of topics such as grant funds, investments, recruitment and business cases. This position will see you take on a range of responsibilities including, but not limited to; 

designing, developing and maintaining business intelligence, reporting and analytics solutions
mentoring and providing  guidance  to peers in terms of  visualisation  and reporting
providing timely and effective analysis, reporting and visualisations for dissemination to faculty and senior executive stakeholders
Performing data extraction, data cleansing and data modelling.

 About you The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance of recruiting talent aligned to these values and are looking for a Research Data Scientist who can demonstrate:  

superior analytical, visualisation and problem solving skills and capacity to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
extensive skills in data visualisation and data management tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, Shiny, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), R, Python, SQL and Microsoft Office) and the ability to learn relevant packages and systems quickly
story-telling, high-level analytical, visualisation and problem solving skills and capacity to meet deadlines.

Desirable – 

experience in network graph visualization (such as Gephi, Graphviz).
capability in web technologies (such as HTML, CSS, Javascript, JQuery, PHP, d3).

 About us The position will be located within the Research Reporting, Analysis, Data and Systems (RRADS) group, one  of five groups within the Research Portfolio that currently support the DVCR and researchers to achieve the  University’s goals. The RRADS group is responsible for providing University wide reports and strategic  information on  research and research performance, managing government required reporting programmes  (ERA, HERDC, SRE), managing data acquisition, and coordinating application and system development to  support business processes and requirements. This is achieved by developing and managing the data  collection, analysis and reporting of the University’s research performance, including external obligations and  internal absolute research performance reporting for the Faculty funding model, and coordinating development  of business systems to support business requirements. The Analytics Research and Development team within  RRADS is responsible for high-level analysis, strategic optioning, interpretation, scenario modelling and  reporting on data pertaining to research performance, including comparisons against national and international  benchmarks in order to support strategic decision making. Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion, and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We’re Australias first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence.  Across our campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 60,000 students. We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us. How to apply For more information on the position and University, please view the candidate information pack available from the job’s listing on the University of Sydney careers website. All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.  Visit sydney.edu.au/recruitment and search by the reference number 656/0319C to apply. Closing date: 11:30pm, 21 May 2019 The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. © The University of Sydney The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.

The opportunity.In this newly created role you will be responsible for driving our data vision, working with stakeholders to accurately capture complex business and technical information on how Employsure currently uses it's data across systems and processes. This role is pivotal to driving a more governed approach to how we develop data and leverage its value by leading and engaging the business on all aspects of Data Governance.  You will have full cycle Data Governance experience so opportunities for improvement can be identified, understood, prioritised and implemented. Supported by our Business Intelligence team, you will be translating business needs, ensuring all metadata for models are captured correctly, including data definitions, business rules and data quality requirements. You will develop, manage and maintain data standards, policies and ensure data tools and templates are fit for business needs and comply with regulations. The role requires you to be the point of contact for group data-related tasks, queries around data models, and for leading solution-based discussions to mitigate risks and resolve issues. You will be an advocate for data and will be able to influence business leaders on the data journey. This is an incredible opportunity to work in a truly data focused organisation, driving internal discussions and data maximisation across Employsure.Employsure's people are at the core of its business with benefits including a company bonus scheme, state of the art offices in prime location, every day breakfasts, a very active social committee, additional leave entitlements, and much more. Key accountabilities.  Elicit and document existing business processes, data, systems, issues and risks related to data integrity and quality Be proactive and perform analysis to find out where there are missing links in the data processes  Analyse and recommend business process and data management/governance improvement opportunities Strengthen data integrity, quality and availability across the organisation Identifying and documenting system and process efficiencies and opportunities for reuse of data models in new solutions and environments Identifying and documenting opportunities to reduce data redundancy and data movement across systems Ensure roles and responsibilities on data management are clearly defined Establish and maintain policies & standards for end-to-end data governance Maintain metrics on compliance for policies & standards for publication to the Data Council Manage data quality through implementation of appropriate metrics, monitoring and reporting mechanism Drive the data vision and actively ensure all operations (i.e. data assurance, meta data maintenance, data linage etc.) are being followed The right person will have:  extensive experience with data governance standards and practices strong record with monitoring adoption, communication and overseeing compliance with data governance across an organisation business and systems requirements elicitation, investigation and analysis data design best practices and process improvement initiatives excellent spoken and written communication skills to work with stakeholders at all levels of technical / non technical knowledge and experience good experience across data modelling, data analysis, data governance, data management Big Data Technologies such as Cloudera, Python, SQL, Data manipulation exposure working within an Agile environment able to influence senior stakeholders knowledge of Data Governance software would be advantageous Why join Employsure?Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. Employsure works directly with small businesses to ensure they stay on top of rapidly changing legislation. Whether it be dealing with a difficult employee, facing a claim or reviewing health and safety, our clients can rest assured we have them covered.The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your ambitions, we want to hear from you.With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.  Become a part of our exciting journey. Apply now.

job_description: Manager, Data GovernanceClerk Grade 11/12Temporary Full Time - up to 12 months with possibility of extensionTheir Futures Matter Location: Strawberry Hills, NSWSalary Range: Clerk Grade 11/12 - ($124,965 - $144,521 pa), plus employer?s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.  Contact: Paula Cheng on (02) 9377 6562 or paula.cheng@theirfuturesmatter.nsw.gov.au  Closing Date: 11:59pm on Sunday, 19 May 2019 Responsible for developing and implementing data governance policies, practices, procedures and systems that will ensure TFM meets its legislative and compliance obligationsThis is a temporary full time 12 month position with possibility of extension in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013.Redfern location close to Central and Redfern stations About usThis is an exciting time to join the Their Futures Matter (TFM), which leads a NSW Government landmark reform to deliver improved outcomes for vulnerable children, young people and their families.  Our vision is to create a service system that delivers coordinated, wrap-around and evidence-based supports for children and families to transform their life outcomes.  Central to this vision is our investment approach that will direct and prioritise whole-of-government funding to deliver targeted solutions that achieve measurable and meaningful outcomes.    For more information on the work we do at TFM, go to www.theirfuturesmatter.nsw.gov.au/about-their-futures-matter  About the Role The Manager, Data Governance is responsible for developing and implementing policies, practices, procedures and systems that will ensure TFM complies with the Privacy and Personal Information Protection Act 1998 (NSW)(PPIP Act) and Health Records and Information Privacy Act 2002 (NSW)(HRIP ACT).   Reporting to the Director, Investment Modelling, Research and Evaluation, the incumbent will serve as the key contact for all data privacy and security advice, enquiries and complaints relating to TFM. The Manager, Data Governance will be supported by a Senior Data Governance Officer.  To be successful in this role the ideal candidate will have:Demonstrated strong experience in data governance, data management or data privacy and securityGood knowledge of NSW privacy legislation and information security policies Good knowledge of and experience in compliance Good knowledge of and experience in process managementDemonstrated highly developed project management and organisational skills, including monitoring and reporting on project plans, milestones and deliverables, budget and resource allocation.Experience in managing and mentoring peopleAbility to handle multiple tasks, with proven self-initiative and problem solving abilitiesProven track record of quality performance in highly pressured environmentsExcellent presentation and communication skills both written and verbalHighly developed interpersonal skills with experience of working in an agile team environment where working collaboratively, effectively and efficiently is critical to successTertiary qualification in information management, business administration, law or other related disciplines is preferable.Click here to download a generic role description and supplementary information about the position. Please refer to generic role description for focus capabilities for this position.To see the supplementary job notes for more information on specific role qualification requirements and relevant experience please click here.A Recruitment Pool may be created to fill similar roles for both ongoing and temporary opportunities if and as they arise.Applying for the Role Please submit a current resume (no more than five pages) and a cover letter (no more than two pages) describing how your qualification, knowledge, skills and experience will make you a great fit for the job. You should also include in your application the names and contact details of two referees who could reasonably comment on your capabilities required for this position. Applications Close: 11:59PM on Sunday, 19 May 2019.Contact: Paula Cheng, Director Investment Modelling, Research and Evaluation Ph: (02) 9377 6562 or E: paula.cheng@theirfuturesmatter.nsw.gov.au Our office is an agile working environment, with a mix of spaces to foster collaboration or support focused work, according to individual and project needs.Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion TFM is committed to building a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion. We actively promote the employment of people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and other diversity groups.TFM encourages applications from people with disability and will provide reasonable adjustments in our recruitment processes and in the workplace.If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person listed below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.Thank you for your interest in this position. We look forward to receiving your application.

The Opportunity:  An experienced Senior Big Data Engineer you will be responsible for developing and driving the overall strategy and vision for data.  Hands on Big Data Engineer will be responsible for data pipeline architecture and Data Analysis.  About you:  • The Big Data Engineer will expand and optimise our clients’ data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimise their data flow and collection for cross functional teams.  • Ideal candidate would have a started their career working in Data Warehousing technologies and later moving into Big Data Technologies with good exposure to Data Analysis and Architecture.  • Hands on experience working with Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, Python and Scala.  • Must have at least 3 years of experience with ETL, Data Ingestion, Data Modelling, Data Solution, Data Warehousing and Data Analysis some experience with visualisation tools such as Tableau or Spotfire.  •Build robust, efficient and reliable data pipelines consisting of diverse data sources to ingest and process data into cloud platform.  • Hands on experience working with Advanced SQL, Java, Python and other Scripting languages.  • Should have good stakeholder management and communications skills will allow you to successfully keep the team updated on deliverables and ensure key project stakeholders are aware of progress against project milestones.  • Experience working with different business units to support the execution of machine learning, AI and analytics to solve real-world business problems  • Provide thought leadership in support of design and implementation of a big-data platform. Lead in the transformation from structured to unstructured data, evaluating new technologies and approaches leading to scalable, Big Data platforms. The opportunity.In this newly created role you will be responsible for driving our data vision, working with stakeholders to accurately capture complex business and technical information on how Employsure currently uses it's data across systems and processes. This role is pivotal to driving a more governed approach to how we develop data and leverage its value by leading and engaging the business on all aspects of Data Governance.   You will have full cycle Data Governance experience so opportunities for improvement can be identified, understood, prioritised and implemented. Supported by our Business Intelligence team, you will be translating business needs, ensuring all metadata for models are captured correctly, including data definitions, business rules and data quality requirements. You will develop, manage and maintain data standards, policies and ensure data tools and templates are fit for business needs and comply with regulations. The role requires you to be the point of contact for group data-related tasks, queries around data models, and for leading solution-based discussions to mitigate risks and resolve issues. You will be an advocate for data and will be able to influence business leaders on the data journey. This is an incredible opportunity to work in a truly data focused organisation, driving internal discussions and data maximisation across Employsure.Employsure's people are at the core of its business with benefits including a company bonus scheme, state of the art offices in prime location, every day breakfasts, a very active social committee, additional leave entitlements, and much more.Key accountabilities.  Elicit and document existing business processes, data, systems, issues and risks related to data integrity and quality Be proactive and perform analysis to find out where there are missing links in the data processes  Analyse and recommend business process and data management/governance improvement opportunities Strengthen data integrity, quality and availability across the organisation Identifying and documenting system and process efficiencies and opportunities for reuse of data models in new solutions and environments Identifying and documenting opportunities to reduce data redundancy and data movement across systems Ensure roles and responsibilities on data management are clearly defined Establish and maintain policies & standards for end-to-end data governance Maintain metrics on compliance for policies & standards for publication to the Data Council Manage data quality through implementation of appropriate metrics, monitoring and reporting mechanism Drive the data vision and actively ensure all operations (i.e. data assurance, meta data maintenance, data linage etc.) are being followed  The right person will have:  extensive experience with data governance standards and practices strong record with monitoring adoption, communication and overseeing compliance with data governance across an organisation business and systems requirements elicitation, investigation and analysis data design best practices and process improvement initiatives excellent spoken and written communication skills to work with stakeholders at all levels of technical / non technical knowledge and experience good experience across data modelling, data analysis, data governance, data management Big Data Technologies such as Cloudera, Python, SQL, Data manipulation exposure working within an Agile environment able to influence senior stakeholders knowledge of Data Governance software would be advantageous  Why join Employsure?Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. Employsure works directly with small businesses to ensure they stay on top of rapidly changing legislation. Whether it be dealing with a difficult employee, facing a claim or reviewing health and safety, our clients can rest assured we have them covered.The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your ambitions, we want to hear from you.With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.  Become a part of our exciting journey. Apply now.

QBE is one of the top 20 global general insurers and is recognised as Australia's largest international insurance and reinsurance Company, with operations in 37 countries around the world. Reporting to the Group Head of Capital Modelling, the role of Senior Capital Modelling Analyst will assist in the provision of high-impact actuarial services within QBE’s Group Capital Modelling function.    With demonstrated knowledge and experience in actuarial analysis and modelling, you will be given a fantastic opportunity contribute to a wide range of capital modelling activities, with an additional focus on developing and improving modelling processes to promote the use of economic capital modelling across the wider business. The Opportunity:  Own the calibration and documentation of the Economic Scenario Generator and Asset Model, including providing the necessary support to all QBE divisions and external regulators. Support business decision-making processes such as, but not limited to, capital management, risk management, reinsurance, catastrophe aggregations, reserving and asset liability management. Support the development and maintenance of the global capital model, including prioritisation and implementation of proposed model developments, and management of model releases. Perform analysis to determine the capital needs of the business. Contribute to the use of the model for capital allocation, risk appetite monitoring, operational risk modelling, reserving variability analysis, and analysing reinsurance options. Performing validation and ensuring appropriate checks are performed within processes to minimise inaccuracies. Crafting reports and presentations for internal management and regulators. Network with QBE Actuarial, Risk, Reinsurance and Exposure Management functions globally, so as to enable appropriate consistency of process, and encourage the sharing and adoption of standard methodologies. What does success look like?  Relevant qualifications (Actuarial Institute or equivalent body). Asset management / modelling experience is essential. General insurance experience (within Capital, Pricing or Reserving) is advantageous, but other actuarial backgrounds will be considered. Strong understanding of industry best practice in actuarial analysis and modelling. Strong VBA, Access, Excel and SQL proficiency. Knowledge of Igloo would also be advantageous. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Ability to produce reports and data for technical audiences and senior management. Highly developed communication and negotiation skills. What’s in it for you? You will be provided with a competitive salary package and benefits, in an environment that offers support, and encourages career development and learning. QBE recognises the value of diversity in the workplace and supports a range of flexible work arrangements to promote a better family/life/work balance. Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment. If you are a QBE employee, please inform your Manager before applying.  For more information, click the APPLY button to submit your details.

Competent with data visualisation tools in a business environment, to distil insights from complex data sets Strong quantitative and analytical skills. $180-200,000 package per annum + benefits Manage a High Performing team of Software Architects & Engineers Promote cutting edge technologies and capitalise on 600+ Active Customers  About the company At AC3, our purpose is to make technology real, and as the leaders in secure multi-cloud solutions, we get to do this for our customers every day. We are an Australian owned ICT MSP, with offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Auckland, servicing over 50% of the NSW State Government and over 700 enterprise customers. We are a growing business with a focus on three technology areas – cloud and infrastructure, cyber security. and software and data integration. We support our customers at every step of their technology journey, from consult, to procure and build, to run and optimise and talent management. We’re a company that believes in doing the right thing by our customers and each other, and delivering on our promises. Beyond getting to work with cool tech and cool clients, you’ll also find real recognition and flexible work that works for you. About the roleJoining our Professional Services team, you will be providing guidance and bring your technical expertise across all things Software & Data Integration related and promote our capability both internally and externally. This is a Strategic area of our business. You will manage the Software & Data Integration Practice, team members, growth and profitability.Some of your key responsibilities will be:   Promote AC3 through Thought Leadership: through webinars, blogs, social media posts, presentations at meetups and Customer events Become a trusted advisor within key customer accounts and assist them with their Cloud journey Build consultancy offerings and delivery model, ensuring it is aligned with Industry and vendor best practice methodology Drive technical qualification, scoping, estimation, design and architecture of new or existing opportunities Work with projects team to deliver successful customer outcomes Manage, lead and develop a high performing team: Software & Data Integration Architects and Engineers, Application Support Engineers, Business & Quality Assurance Analysts, and Agile Project Managers.  Collaborate with higher Management to develop financial forecasts and budgets for the P&L Develop technical designs that challenge the status-quo and support customer innovation  Skills & experienceThe ideal candidate will be highly motivated, solution-oriented, collaborative and approachable with a focus on best practice:  Experience and confidence in a customer facing role or consultative pre-sales role Experience in software development and leadership, in addition to experience in software consulting Experience managing multiple tasks in a busy environment and ability to work under pressure Demonstrated experience managing and leading people Creative, Strategic and thoughtful "hands-on" leader with "can-do" leadership approach Strong customer focused problem solving skills Expertise working with cloud-native architectures, including public cloud PaaS / IaaS, REST API, micro-services architectures, open source platforms  Exceptional oral and written communication skills, with proven document/report writing ability Expertise in multiple programming and development frameworks such as Java, Spring boot, Spring MVC, NodeJS, OAS 2.0+, Python, etc. Excellent knowledge of automated testing frameworks and tools for Software & Data Integration projects such as Mockito, Selenium, JMeter, Postman etc. Expertise in multiple relational and non-relational databases (e.g. Oracle, mysql, PostgreSQL, Redshift, MongoDB etc.) and open-source big data processing frameworks (e.g. Apache Hadoop, Spark, Storm, Cassandra, Impala etc.) Expert-level DevOps knowledge working with :  Source Version Control tools (Git, Subversion, TFS, Bitbucket, etc.) Containerisation technologies (Docker) Orchestration engines (Kubernetes / OpenShift/ Rancher / Swarm, Jenkins CI/CD, Octopus, etc.)    Culture As number 28 on Australia’s Great Places to Work list, it’s clear that culture is a top priority at AC3. We approach business with family values, which means people here have real relationships that go beyond work. We believe it’s important that everyone is heard and treated with respect, whether you have the next big idea or simply a question. We keep it simple and live by our fours ways of being:  Own It: If I say I’m going to do it, I do it. And I give it my all. Better It: I take the current status quo and make it better. Brave It: I listen, say what needs to be said, and do the right thing. Especially when it’s tough. Enjoy It: I take my work seriously, but don’t take myself too seriously.   We’d love for you to experience the AC3 way for yourself! Benefits  Work for a genuine leader in the Public Cloud arena Work with the best Cloud Experts in Australia Endless opportunities to learn & develop  Flourish as a thought leader in the Industry and collaborate with key innovators in the Industry Manage and grow an already high performing team Capitalise on 600+ current active Customers  Genuine flexibility in the workplace  Convenient Sydney CBD location $180-200,000 package per annum + benefits  If you are interested in this position and believe that your experience is closely aligned with the requirements listed, then please forward your application via the APPLY Button.All positions at AC3 must undergo a criminal background check.

Children’s Medical Research Institute (CMRI) was Australia’s first dedicated paediatric research facility and is now one of the world’s most highly regarded independent medical research centres.  Our research focuses on the areas of embryonic development and birth defects, cancer, neuroscience and gene therapy and we have a strong international reputation based on our research outcomes.  It is also home to the world-first proteomics project, ProCan, which is changing the way cancer is diagnosed and treated. CMRI’s research programs are supported by state of the art facilities and committed research and support staff. Our achievements are made possible by a loyal network of community supporters, highly engaged donors and the very successful Jeans for Genes® fundraising campaign.    A data scientist position is available in the ProCan Cancer Data Science Group, led by Dr. Qing Zhong. ProCan (the ACRF International Centre for the Proteome of Human Cancer) is a world-first initiative developed and launched in September 2016 by Professors Phil Robinson and Roger Reddel, and established with a $10 million grant from the Australian Cancer Research Foundation (ACRF). Equipped with six SCIEX mass spectrometers and a super computer (800TB / 480 cores), ProCan processes tumour samples through a proteomic method, SWATH-MS, which allows fast mass spectrometric conversion of small amounts of tissue (biopsy level) into a single, permanent digital file representing the quantitative proteome of the sample. One of the goals of ProCan is to measure thousands of proteins in about 70,000 cancers of all types with known treatment outcome and correlate tumour proteotypes with clinical phenotypes. The Cancer Data Science Group aims to develop novel computational tools and sophisticated machine learning algorithms to achieve this goal. Other major focuses of the group are 1) big proteogenomic data mining and management, 2) the genome-proteome association analysis and multi-omic data integration for studying cancer, 3) development of advanced statistical tools to account for batch effects caused by large-scale, high throughput proteomics, and 4) implementation of big data-driven, evidence-based computational tools to achieve predictive, preventive, personalized medicine. We invite applications from PhD scientists to join our group. Applicants should have a high degree of motivation in academic research, an excellent record of scientific accomplishments with publications in peer-reviewed journals, and the ability to work independently with outstanding communication and writing skills. Candidates should have a strong background in bioinformatics, biostatistics or machine learning. Strong programming skills in R and Python are required. Previous experience in proteomics is essential. You will be responsible for conducting biostatistical analysis, performing scientific data visualization, developing solutions to proteomics research and cancer biomarker discovery. You will be provided with a competitive remuneration package in accordance with qualifications and experience. Additional benefits include the provision of a Public Benevolent Institution salary packaging scheme and participation in an employer-contributed superannuation fund. First and co-first author publications on high impact journals can be expected. This is a full-time position for three years with the possibility of extension. Applications should include:  A cover letter (citing PV1915) with statement of motivation and a detailed description of the qualifications described above, A curriculum vitae including a chronological list of publications Contact details (phone/email) of three professional referees             and be forwarded to  recruitment@cmri.org.au  Applications will remain open until filled, however we encourage you to submit your application by Friday 17th May as we will interview suitable candidates from that date onwards - We reserve the right to withdraw this ad prior to the closing date.

Paula ChengClosing Date: 11:59pm on Sunday, 19^th May 2019.  Responsible for the day-to-day activities for the development and implementation of data governance policies, practices, procedures and systems that will ensure TFM meets its legislative and compliance obligationsFull-time, temporary 12-month position with possibility for extension in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013.Redfern location close to Redfern and Central stationsAbout us This is an exciting time to join the Their Futures Matter (TFM), which leads a NSW Government landmark reform to deliver improved outcomes for vulnerable children, young people and their families. Our vision is to create a service system that delivers coordinated, wrap-around and evidence-based supports for children and families to transform their life outcomes.  Central to this vision is our investment approach that will direct and prioritise whole-of-government funding to deliver targeted solutions that achieve measurable and meaningful outcomes. For more information on the work we do at TFM, go to www.theirfuturesmatter.nsw.gov.au/about-their-futures-matter  About the RolesThe Senior Data Governance Officer is responsible for the day-to-day activities for the development and implementation of data governance policies, practices, procedures and systems that will ensure TFM complies with the Privacy and Personal Information Protection Act 1998 (NSW)(PPIP Act) and Health Records and Information Privacy Act 2002 (NSW)(HRIP ACT).  Reporting to the Manager, Data Governance, the incumbent will prepare data privacy and security advice and guidance and provide support to TFM staff and executives. In addition, the Senior Data Governance Office will work with external privacy and security specialists, and liaise with external and internal stakeholders in the conduct of data privacy and security activities. To be successful in this role the ideal candidate will have:   Demonstrated experience in data governance, data management or data privacy and securityGood knowledge of NSW privacy legislation and information security policiesGood knowledge of and experience in compliance Good knowledge of and experience in process managementDemonstrated strong project management and organisational skills, including monitoring and reporting on project plans, milestones and deliverables.Ability to handle multiple tasks, with proven self-initiative and problem solving abilitiesProven track record of quality performance in highly pressured environments Good presentation and communication skills both written and verbal  Strong interpersonal skills with experience of working in an agile team environment where working collaboratively, effectively and efficiently is critical to success Tertiary qualification in information management, business administration, law or other related disciplines is preferable.Click here to download the role description and supplementary information about the position. Please refer to role description for focus capabilities for this position. A Recruitment Pool may be created to fill similar roles for both ongoing and temporary opportunities if and as they arise.  Applying for the RolePlease submit a current resume (no more than five pages) and a cover letter (no more than two pages) describing how your qualification, knowledge, skills and experience will make you a great fit for the job. You should also include in your application the names and contact details of two referees who could reasonably comment on your capabilities required for this position. Closing Date: 11:59pm on Sunday, 19^th May 2019.Contact: Paula Cheng, Director Investment Modelling, Research and Evaluation P: (02) 9377 6562 or E: paula.cheng@theirfuturesmatter.nsw.gov.au  Our office is an agile working environment, with a mix of spaces to foster collaboration or support focused work, according to individual and project needs.Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion TFM is committed to building a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion. We actively promote the employment of people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and other diversity groups.TFM encourages applications from people with disability and will provide reasonable adjustments in our recruitment processes and in the workplace.If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person listed below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.Thank you for your interest in this position. We look forward to receiving your application.

job_description: Our Exclusive and Innovative Client is currently looking for a Data Analytics & Insights Delivery Manager to focus on a number of key elements, including, the tactical execution and delivery of projects, along with a key contribution to the high-level strategy to develop new data initiatives. Ideally, you will possess an excellent understanding and experience of the data-driven customer marketplace.     As we stated in our job title, Mandarin language is essential for this role, as you will be engaging with clients across China. Travel will be required, however, you will also be working at our clients Sydney office.   A minimum of 3-5 years experience leading Data Analytics & Insights projects or teams along with a technical understanding of data tools. An ability to drive outcomes in the Data Services team to deliver optimal results for business stakeholders and customers. Completing projects on schedule, within budget, and with the desired results by clarifying project goals, specifying the needed resources, scheduling the project and assigning responsibility for completing all tasks; Monitoring and modifying the project during implementation and evaluating the success of the project. Strong Agile and Sprint methodologies would be an advantage. The long-term goal is to build a progressive advanced analytical team and introduce data science capabilities over time. Strong engagement with stakeholders, be able to deliver requirements along with the ability to drive and influence change around data analytics and find data-driven ROI opportunities for the organisation and their customers. Undertake presentations that provide insights to clients, including strategic recommendations. Identify outcomes, innovations and new products that will enhance our customer data insights product offerings. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts in a marketing framework.     I am keen to have a confidential phone or coffee catch up to discuss this role in further detail. This is a very important role for the business, so let's start the conversation...    If you have made a positive commitment to further your career and you possess the above attributes then please apply to this role,  if you require further information on this then please contact  Gino Lancaster on 0401 735 235 for a confidential chat. Data Talent is exclusively focused on Data Analytics, Insights & Data Engineering Recruitment across Australia.

The position will collaboratively support the design, development and delivery of business intelligence solutions in response to University needs, using data from operational systems, files, staging areas and the data warehouse. 
North Sydney or Brisbane 
Fixed term, full time appointment (12 months)

Australian Catholic University (ACU) is an inclusive community which welcomes students and staff of all beliefs. ACU has over 2,500 staff supporting more than 34,000 students across seven campuses – Adelaide, Ballarat, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne, North Sydney and Strathfield.
As valued members of our community, all staff members are expected to have an understanding of ACU’s mission and values and to demonstrate an active contribution to them.
The Office of Planning and Strategic Management (OPSM)assists the University to achieve its Mission and Vision through evidence-based decision-making and a strategic approach to planning, quality, risk and management.
The Business Intelligence (BI) was created to lead the implementation and support of an Enterprise Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence Solution. Servicing all the university portfolios, the OPSM is positioned as a vital source of business intelligence and strategic partner in planning, quality and risk and recognised as a collaborative, agile and high-performing team, within a culture of Service Excellence.
The advertised position will collaboratively support the design, development and delivery of business intelligence solutions in response to University needs, using data from operational systems, files, staging area and data warehouse. As well as be responsible to provide technical support for the effective and continued operation of the Enterprise Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence Solution.
You will:

Design, develop, implement, document and support the University’s Business Intelligence program.  Design, develop, and implement data models for enterprise-level applications and systems. Transition previously developed and legacy reports and dashboards to the Operations & Support team.
Develop and deploy ETL job workflow with reliable error/exception handling and rollback framework.
Contribute to recommendations and the design of the new data warehouse and ongoing extensions and improvements to its capacity for delivering effective business intelligence to the University.
Document the ETL detailed design and test results and assist the various business system groups when necessary on ad-hoc or systemic queries for analysis for executive level staff, and senior management across various business units.

In this role you will be required to collaborate with subject matters experts and key stakeholders regarding the development, execution and maintenance of warehouse and technical activities. To be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate:

relevant postgraduate qualifications and/or professional accreditation
extensive expertise in the delivery of a data warehouse and business intelligence solutions.
high level technical competency: ability to script and read MS SQL for design phase, query analysis, and support for end users; advanced knowledge of Microsoft BI suite of products, including experience in designing dashboards in Power BI.
evidence of ability to show commitment with integrity to the Catholic Identity, Mission and ethos of the University

The University pursues an excellence agenda and offers an environment where staff are welcomed and safe and valued through development, participation and involvement.
How to Apply: Obtain the detailed Position Description  BI Developer.pdf. Applicants are expected to address all selection criteria listed in the position description. To apply for this role click the "Apply" link below. Visit Hints and Tips on how to apply.
Total remuneration valued to $112,762 - $126,069 pa, including salary component $95,285 - $106,530 pa (Higher Education Worker Level 8), employer contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.
General enquiries can be directed to Mr Lester D’Souza, National Manager, Business Intelligence on 02 9701 4447.
Only candidates with the right to work in Australia may apply for this position.
ACU is committed to diversity and social inclusion in its employment practices. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people from culturally diverse groups are encouraged.
Equal Opportunity and Privacy of personal information is University policy. For more details visit www.acu.edu.au/careers.
APPLICATIONS CLOSE: 27 May 2019 at 11.55pm.

job_title: Associate Director, Workforce Information and Reporting
job_description:
About the opportunity    We are in a period of exciting and significant investment in our Human Resources division and in order to deliver on the University’s ambitious strategic plan, we are looking for an experienced Associate Director of Workforce Information and Reporting to provide leadership and focus on strategic information services.   As the Associate Director, you will manage the workforce information and reporting functions across HR. You will be responsible for leading 2 teams; One team comprises of analysts and administrators whose focus is to extract insight from data through workforce reporting and data management. The other team is the Systems Management team which ensures that data is reliable and appropriately controlled. This position also has oversight over HR system configuration, maintenance and enhancements from a user perspective, with ICT providing the technical support.    Your duties will include:

managing the workforce information and reporting functions to ensure the ongoing development and sophistication of workforce reporting and analysis
HR technology management
reporting standards and dashboards
servicing client HR data needs
team leadership

   About you The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance of recruiting talent aligned to these values and are looking for an Associate Director, Workforce Information and Reporting who has  

previously led a team across Workforce Reporting and HR Systems and understands contemporary HR Analytical practices. Able to develop a team to one of high performance
highly developed critical thinking skills with the ability to provide structure and clarity to abstract concepts/ideas.
extensive hands-on knowledge of information management and reporting systems – ServiceNow and Workday desirable but not essential
extensive experience in extracting data from multiple and not necessarily connected systems including large enterprise wide systems to smaller customised single purpose systems to deliver meaningful insight to clients to support evidence-based decision making
excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to liaise and influence effectively at all levels and communicate technical and business concepts to a broad range of users.
high level analytical ability and proactive style in problem solving and reporting
demonstrated understanding and application of project management competencies

   About us The Human Resources function provides human resource management related advice, support and services across the university. There are three parts to the HR operating model; the HR Shared Services; HR Centres of Expertise (COE) and HR Partnering and Advisory teams. There are several Centres of Expertise designed to provide strategic design and consultative services necessary to execute HR initiatives identified in the Strategic Plan. The HR Service Experience function provides strategic guidance to a portfolio of client groups across key aspects that relate to organisational and HR strategy. The incumbent will play a key role in the facilitation of workforce strategy and optimising the HR service delivery model. The HR services team are responsible for functions such as HR Business Partnering, Recruitment Operations and Appointments and On boarding. The role will also play a key role in ensuring HR’s alignment and integration with the university wide shared services centre and associated HR enquiries function.  The Associate Director will apply and lead a consultative approach and utilise considerable knowledge and business acumen to liaise with appropriate stakeholders in the timely delivery and effective use of workforce reporting and data management.   Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We’re Australias first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence.  Across our campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 60,000 students.   We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us.How to apply For more information on the position and University, please view the candidate information pack available from the job’s listing on the University of Sydney careers website. All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.  Visit sydney.edu.au/recruitment and search by the reference number 772/0419C to apply. Closing date: 11.30pm, Sunday 12 May 2019 The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. An understanding of CRM, Data and AI would also be advantageous.     This is an excellent opportunity to be a part of a well-recognised and award-winning company during a significant growth phase. You will need to be motivated and eager to succeed whilst being supported and surrounded by passionate technical capability.    This role will enable you to be exposed to many and various businesses and you will be given the opportunity to succeed without boundaries. Reporting directly to the Sales Director, located in Melbourne, you will be supported in all aspects to enable success.     Operational Duties:  Build and maintain great relationships internally and with technology partners. Prospect, consult and sell business solutions and services to prospective customers and existing clients. Manage, qualify and prioritise sales opportunities Engage with prospective clients to position the company’s capabilities via electronic and face-to-face customer meetings Develop strategic sales plans to target and sign new business. Prepare and submit proposals and tender responses Identify and manage client issues and risks. Work constructively with our internal technical team to deliver winning project proposals from a commercial perspective Manage accounts to ensure client satisfaction and develop new opportunities for growth  Your personal attributes  Outcome and Solutions focused Tenacious Excellent interpersonal skills Genuine and likeable Highly energised Solid presentation skills Excellent problem-solving skill. Ability to communicate well to Executive level, Directors, CEO, CIO etc  Next steps If you want to be part of a growing Management and IT Consultancy where you are appreciated, work with like-minded peers and continue to grow your skills and learn, then please do get in touch for a confidential discussion. As we continue to scale up, we are careful to maintain the flexibility and innovative culture of a start-up. This energy and agility, combined with the scale, depth of capability and market credibility of an established player, allows us to attract both the best talent in the industry and the leading adopters of Microsoft technology.

A bit about us BizCover is the leading Insurtech platform in Australia and arguably the world.  It simplifies comparing and buying business insurance cover, so small businesses can benefit from transparent pricing, a fast hassle-free experience, and the right cover. It has been recognised in Deloitte Technology Fast 50 as one of the fastest growing technology companies and by Westpac as one of the Top 20 Business of Tomorrow. The role We are seeking a talented individual who is passionate about marketing analytics and ideally has been involved in campaign creation/analysis and attribution modelling.  This is a opportunity to be part of BizCover's Analytical journey as you assist us to drive marketing decisions, optimise spend and resources, maximise ROI, maximise lead generation, optimise CPL (cost per lead) and CPA (cost per acquisition) and improve the quality of leads/clients. Here are some of the exciting projects you will lead in your first 6 months -   Work with the Head of Marketing to understand the current view of our short-, medium- and long-term marketing strategies Work with Digital Marketing manager to understand SEM campaigns, Google Analytics, Adwords, etc. Work with Head of Marketing and external media agency to understand our current traditional marketing strategies (including TV, radio, magazine, postcard drops, etc) Work with Partner Relationship manager to understand the Partner Channel in more detail Understand our data architecture and sources of data Understand our existing campaign analysis model to be able to run results weekly, and over time work to enhance/replace this model Understand our existing cost allocation model to be able to run results weekly, and over time work to enhance/replace this model Take over the responsibility for running monthly management reports and over time working with IT or independently to automate these reports Understand the existing SQL marketing data mart with the view of enhancing it over time, and to be able to manipulate and extract this data to find new opportunities and insights Whilst the first 6 months involves a big element of learning what is currently in place, there is a large amount of freedom thereafter to use prior experience and knowledge of this field to enhance and change these processes, and to add new dimensions to this area.  You will have an opportunity to really mould the Marketing Analytics function at BizCover. About you:  3-5 years’ experience in a marketing analytics role 2-3 years’ experience with SQL coding, data manipulation and analytics packages (R is ideal but not essential, a good grasp of different modelling techniques is required) Experience in multi-channel campaign analysis and cost attribution using machine learning techniques Experience in predictive/statistical modelling (GBM, Random Forest, Logistic, linear methods, etc) Experience in dealing with marketing campaign/attribution tools such as Google Analytics and Adwords is essential. Exposure to other tools such as Kissmetrics, VWO, FoneDynamic or similar is advantageous. Exposure to Customer Segmentation methodologies and tools (such as Adobe Audience Manager, SalesForce Krux or Google Audience 360) is advantageous. Experience with financial services, particularly insurance, is advantageous. Strong reporting skills - Visualization, Dashboard and Story Telling Tertiary qualification in relevant discipline (statistics, maths, computer science, etc) Strong problem-solving ability Innovative Able to work with different areas in the business and communicate effectively with them Results focused Good time management skills Independent and able to work independently with a fierce focus on delivering actionable outcomes for the business Please apply using the link below or if you would like to have a confidential chat about this opportunity, then please email nazranaa@bizcover.com.au  Thanks in advance for taking the time to apply and my apologies, only successful candidates will be contacted Please no recruiters

job_title: Inside Sales Representative - Data Protection @ Quest Software

Quest is an award-winning IT management software provider offering a broad selection of solutions that solve some of the most common and most challenging IT problems. Since 1987, we’ve been reducing the time and money our customers spend on IT administration, so they can invest more on business innovation. Change people’s lives and love what you do!  Cochlear develops world-leading medical devices that help people hear. As a top 100 medical device company and the market-leader in implantable hearing devices, more people choose a Cochlear-branded cochlear implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people’s lives.
This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Senior Solution Architect to work in our IT Architecture team at our Cochlear Global HQ. You will work closely with project managers, agile delivery teams and business partners to define solutions and guide their implementation.
Key Responsibilities 
The Senior Solution Architect role provides technical direction for projects from concept to completion along with input to strategic architecture roadmaps and reference architectures.
In order to be a successful candidate for this role you need to have a passion for technology and experience in modern cloud data solutions. Your previous designs are elegant in their simplicity and have enabled others to build upon the foundations you laid. You understand modern architectures and the rationale behind those architectures. You are also prepared to design solutions involving legacy systems too.
You have experience with waterfall and agile delivery methodologies and understand how to work in either. In your previous roles you have advocated test and deployment automation. You have also had some exposure in operational roles and understand why it is important to do the job properly
You are not afraid to challenge the status quo but understand the balance between perfection and practicality. You understand your audience and can communicate potentially complex solutions to a wide range of stakeholders.
In this role you will be responsible for:

Developing Reference Architectures for architectural domains
Lead the definition of the Solution Architecture and deliver conceptual and detailed designs to resolve the business requirement.
Close collaboration on project implementation with project managers, business stakeholders and delivery teams
Constantly look for opportunities to leverage and reuse existing IT capabilities, Services and Solutions where appropriate
Identify and investigate opportunities to utilize and integrate emerging technologies to provide cost effective flexible solutions.
Assist the IT Broker team and associated Business Stakeholders in the development of business cases and value propositions to support the proposed solutions
Wherever possible, advocate the architecture services, processes across the global Information Technology teams and business functions by means of sharing documentation, providing advice or impromptu education
Contribute ideas on systems and process methods to improve Information Technology products and services

The successful candidate will have the unique opportunity to shape Cochlear’s flagship business. You will have the benefit of working across multiple interesting and innovative projects, with significant career development avenues for the right person. Cochlear offers a supportive and collaborative working environment with ample opportunity to progress.
 
Key Requirements 

A Bachelor’s degree in Computing or Engineering
Demonstrated experience as a Senior Solution Architect

Demonstrated experience in identifying, researching, evaluating and recommending new
and emerging technologies

Strong enterprise applications background, with an ability to grasp the big picture
Project planning and specification skills, together with problem solving and analysis

Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact professionally
with executives, managers and subject matter experts


Desired Requirements

Post Graduate qualification
Architecture certification such as TOGAF
Demonstrated 3-5 years experience as a Senior Solution Architect
Previous experience in project teams using agile and waterfall delivery methodologies.
Strong technical background in any of the following:

- Cloud Data Platforms (SnowFlake, Redshift, BigQuery)
- Data Science Platforms (Spark, R, Jupyter Notebooks)
- DevOps (CI/CD Pipelines, Immutable architecture, DevSecOps )

- Test Automation

- Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence
- Cloud/Networking/Infrastructure automation (AWS and on premise)
 
Cochlear Summary
Cochlear’s mission is to help people hear and be heard. Around the world, more people chose a Cochlear-branded hearing implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people’s lives. Learn and grow with us as we tackle the most complex challenges in helping people to Hear Now. And Always. Cochlear is the global market leader in implantable hearing solutions including cochlear implant systems (CI) and bone anchored hearing aids (Baha™).
If you feel that you have the skills and experience to be successful in this role and take on new challenges to build your career with Cochlear, please start your application by clicking the apply button below.

Macquarie Park - Sydney - Australia Enjoy work life balance with flex working, leave options and various programs     Be a part of something big. With 40,000+ employees in 100 countries, Nielsen is one of the world’s biggest data measurement companies, and we pride ourselves on providing our people with endless possibilities and paths to grow their careers.   Simply put, we do two things at Nielsen. We measure performance for our clients and we use analytics to help our clients grow their business. At Nielsen we make a difference by partnering with our clients and using our data to explain what is happening with their brands and what they should do to improve business performance.    About your role:   The Senior Statistical Operations Executive will be involved in the setup of Nielsen’s inaugural Beauty Panel and once setup, will primarily be responsible for the timeliness and accuracy of Nielsen’s Beauty Panel data, resolving ad-hoc queries and undertaking special projects which involve different levels of statistical analysis, sample design and calculations of standard error and sample size.   Main responsibilities include:  Assuming the role of local statistical operations delivery lead to ensure accurate and timely delivery of regular and ad hoc tasks that are fit for purpose. We sway against micromanagement, enabling our associates engage, include and decide in order to move swiftly and boldly, while keeping our clients at the heart of everything we do.   But wait, there’s more! (Benefits)   We believe in a good work/life balance and offer an extensive range of flexible working options for all associates. We also provide range of programs and activities for associates to join year-round that encourage good health, wellbeing, networking and community engagement!   All of our Nielsen employees get access to corporate discounts with companies such as Bupa, Sunsuper, and HSBC, and, we also offer a generous yearly study allowance for those wishing to further their education in a field related to their role or our company.   If you feel like this is the right fit, click apply and tell us all about you!

Australian Banking Association With the active participation of 23 member banks in Australia, the Australian Banking Association (ABA) provides analysis, advice and advocacy for the banking industry and contributes to the development of public policy on banking and other financial services. The ABA works with government, regulators, community groups and other stakeholders to improve public awareness and understanding of the industry’s contribution to the economy and the broader community. The ABA works to ensure Australia’s banking customers continue to benefit from a stable, competitive and accessible banking industry. The Australian banking industry is currently going through a challenging period of strategic and structural change. The ABA is a dynamic and innovative organisation that works collaboratively as a whole and in partnership with our member banks. The role  The Director – Research & Data Management provides statistical, analytical and research support that contributes to the ABA’s work to enhance public understanding of the role of banks and the banking industry in the community, and the contribution of banks and the banking industry to the economy more broadly. Collaborating with members of the ABA team, to develop and communicate insights on issues of relevance to the banking industry, and communicate those through traditional channels such as submissions, speeches, research papers and other media as required. Develop and maintain a growing database of relevant statistical and other information pertinent to the banking industry, in partnership with the ABA team, regulators and other stakeholders. Skills & Experience  Tertiary qualified, with 3-5 years’ experience within the public or private sectors. Proven analytical expertise, including the ability to develop, extract and manipulate a range of different datasets, to support the development of policy. Experience tailoring information and delivering insights across a wide range of audiences. Experience from within the financial sector, or dealing with macroeconomic and industry statistics, is desirable. What’s on offer  Great opportunity for a curious and diligent self-starter to join our agile flexible team. Work across a wide range of policy and economic issues impacting Australia’s financial sector, and the broader Australian economy. Exposure to, and opportunity to influence, decision makers across industry, regulators and government. Outstanding culture, flexible working conditions, and opportunities for the right candidate to make a mark in an industry central to enabling the potential of Australia’s communities.   How to apply Does this sound like you? Please click the ‘Apply’ button below or email reception@ausbanking.org.au

Why Deliveroo? When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour.  Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us. It began with our founder Will, arriving in London over 5 years ago and finding it almost impossible to order great food, despite the wealth of incredible restaurants in the city.  Fast forward 5 years and we operate in 13 countries with over 50,000 riders who deliver orders from 50,000 restaurants in over 200 cities worldwide. We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We are providing people with limitless access to different cuisines and restaurants, turning cooking from a chore to a choice, and giving people the freedom to eat what they want, when they want, where they want it. We work with riders, restaurants and consumers. We operate one of the most complex three sided marketplaces in the world and we do this in real time. Millions of customers and thousands of restaurants and riders rely on us to match them within milliseconds. The algorithms behind that marketplace are the secret sauce that allow us to deliver our orders in under 30 minutes. And we’re just getting started The scale of the opportunity ahead of us is immense. The global food market is valued at £7.7 trillion but only 1% of it is currently online. Contrast that with the digital disruption of countless other industries - from banking and travel to retail and communications - it’s clear that our journey in the food sector has only just begun. We are already a multi-billion dollar company that is more than doubling in size every year.  Deliveroo came top in the FT’s’ list of Europe’s fastest growing 1000 companies in 2018, and we were the first company ever to win Deloitte’s ‘UK Top 50’ two years in a row. Yet most of the extraordinary value this company will generate lies ahead of us. The Role  We are looking for a field based Business Development Manager. This is a rare opportunity to become a founding and critical member of a rapidly growing, well-funded startup. You'll be liaising with Sydney's most premium and highly regarded restaurants. As a member of the local sales team, your role will include developing new relationships with restaurants as well cultivating existing ones. This is a role for an intelligent, motivated, self starter to develop their sales career for a leading company within its market sector. You will be tasked with signing up Sydney's best restaurants. More specifically, you will:  Map and target restaurants across Sydney in a very methodical and organised fashion Communicate (physical visits, email, calls, social media) with restaurants to demonstrate Deliveroo technology Sample food from a variety of high quality establishments Attend restaurant and food meet ups Requirements  You must be comfortable with targeting new business and have proven Sales Experience The job requires great communication skills whether it be face to face, through phone or email Ability to persuasively demonstrate product and industry knowledge to clients is a must Knowledge of the restaurant industry is a significant plus You will need to be tenacious and self motivated Benefits   Become one of the key employees of a fast-growing, exciting startup changing the food delivery landscape Open, respectful and fun company culture BIG Friday lunches – Deliveroo'd to the office of course! Weekly Exercise class to counteract all the amazing food! Have a real impact on the company's growth and evolution Work with people who love what they do every day Life at Deliveroo We are a growing team, with very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, we’re always looking for new ideas and we’re very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them. There are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven’t even encountered. How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.

The above list is not exhaustive, and the role may change to meet the overall objectives of the company Measurements Annual revenue divided into quarterly and monthly targets (post strategy development period) Sales pipeline constant development New products / services development Other Duties Fulfil other duties as required by management and other department personnel as requested/required. Required qualities Proven sales track record in new technologies business development / product development (preferable in drone, and photovoltaic panel sectors) Start – up ecosystem development / own start – up experience (preferable) Ability to run a few projects simultaneously Strong planning and execution skills Creative approach in solving problems Ability to work remotely with European part of the company Openness for new projects allocation Computer literacy Professional approach. Organisational and time management skills. Excellent attention to detail. Workplace location  Geelong Head Office or remote work from home (Melbourne, or Sydney area) with regular visits to Geelong office. 30-50% of working time: traveling across Australia and incidental traveling to Europe will be required. Experience min. 5 years of experience in business development/ product development in new technologies Skills & competencies Customer service focused: committed to providing exceptional customer service across all channels – written, phone and face to face.     Communication: the ability to communicate clearly and concisely, varying communication style depending upon the audience. Attention to detail: excellent attention to detail and written skills when communicating with others, both internally and externally. Commerciality: ability to apply knowledge in a practical, commercial manner. Teamwork: willingness to assist and support others as required and get on with team members. Time management/organisation: accomplish objectives effectively within time frame given and carry out administrative duties within portfolio in an efficient and timely manner.   If this is a position you think you are suitable for please click "APPLY FOR THIS JOB" and attach your CV For any queries please call Marcin +61 429 007 552 or Rafal +61 417 252 188

About the business and the role  AVANSER is an established company that provides call intelligence solutions & analytics direct to business and to resellers. We provide awesome telco tech that enables medium to large businesses. We have grown rapidly with offices now situated throughout Australia, New Zealand, Malaysia & Singapore; and provide services in 60 countries.  We are the Company to join if you want to develop & progress your career. Our Solution is a sophisticated and flexible technical product that empowers businesses to focus on their key drivers for growth. Joining an existing team, you will drive sales activities and the acquisition of new business by locating, developing, negotiating, and closing business relationships with SME's and more ideally, referring partners.  You will work with an Account Management Team, who will manage the ongoing client relationship to keep you free to hunt for new business. To be successful in this role you must understand marketing drivers for businesses in both the SME space, as well as the professional services agencies that support them. Our offering helps businesses track the source of leads & enquiries, and allows them to assign a true ROI to their advertising and marketing efforts. AVANSER brings very cool tech solutions that provide insight into Call Intelligence and Analytics for businesses of all sizes.    Skills and experience  Your duties will include: Close Inbound Leads, provided by us!Utilise your existing network or create a new one to bring in new Call Intelligence & Tracking Solutions PartnersDevelop and sell call tracking solutions to marketing professionals, SME's and CEO'sFace to Face presentation of our cloud solutionDeveloping multi product solutions to grow revenue from your existing client base as their needs mature Essential Skills: You are a Hunter!  You need a passion for sales, and the discipline to drive results  Activity Orientated.  You should know how to do the work that brings in businessA minimum of 2 years' experience in a New Business Sales Role.The willingness to learn and implement best practice sales solutionsStrong presentation and communication skills to all levels of management & decision makersTelco or Tech Solutions Sales experience would be an added bonus but is not a requirement.  Job benefits and perks  Salary and Uncapped Commission. Dynamic and Energetic Environment with ongoing mentoring from very experienced sales professionals. Parking Provided
