job_title: Business Development Manager: Data Centre Equipment
job_description: Our client specialise in manufacturing Commercial Data Centre Equipment and Systems (racking – caging, cables etc) Enjoying a buoyant market, they have seen steady growth in recent years and are considered to be a premium supplier in their industry. As a result of expansion, they are looking to recruit a specialist sales professional to focus on the Commercial Data-Centre sector in Melbourne. This is a senior role and has a genuine avenue to people management and business unit management in the future. You will be specifying these systems to both Consulting Engineers, Tier 1 & 2 Contractors and End Users. The sales cycles can be long ranging from 3 months up to 2 years and typical project values to our client range from $250k into the millions. As a senior team member in Melbourne, you will be comfortable working autonomously to exceed your targets.  You will be immaculately presented, a strong networker and you will thrive in an autonomous role where you will be given free rein to strategically plan and implement a go-to-market strategy. Ideally, you will have senior sales experience within the Data Centre, Building Services, Electrical or HVAC industry, although specific product training will be provided. You will be a strong communicator, hardworking and career minded, looking to take the next step in your career towards a management role.

About Infosys:Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 45 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.  Role Description: In a Data Architect Role, you will produce efficient and optimized solutions to mine, extract, desensitize (i.e. Data masking) the data stored across multiple database technologies. You will lead a technical team for implementing the designed architecture and help them deliver smart data centric solutions. Responsibilities:You will be working closely with various project stakeholders to understand their data needs. You will use your advanced database knowledge and skills to define solutions to mine, extract and desensitize (data masking) data spread across databases of various technology types inclusive of but not limited to Oracle, SQL Server, Files, Mainframe. You will design effective solution to process very large volumes of data within acceptable SLA timeframe. You will also need to support the technical team who will be implementing the solution. You will engage into discussions with various application teams and other architects to evaluate the best possible solution amongst the viable options available. You will produce architecture/High Level Design documents. You will be required to do technical assessment of new scope for data masking and produce effort estimates. Skill/Competency Requirements:   At least 12 yrs of IT experience with at least 6 yrs in Architecture and Design with a key focus on data centric solution design Strong experience in data analysis, data alignment across multiple applications, heterogeneous data identification, data masking/transformation, data mining activities Experience in managing multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with managing resources split across multiple projects simultaneously Strong skills in Oracle, SQL, PL-SQL databases. Any knowledge of mainframe DB is a bonus Strong skills in Unix Scripting, Powershell scripting Strong understanding of database concepts such as referential integrity and data alignment, table partitions, data import-export mechanisms, data transfer mechanisms, data encryption & decryption Strong understanding of table structures, schema, users and grants Strong skills in designing optimized solutions to process TBs of data. Knowledge of Oracle query optimization techniques Knowledge of Python, JAVA will be a plus Knowledge of AWS services and any data centric operations on AWS will be a plus Experience in performing technical assessment and producing estimates for new scope  EOE/Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin

About Capgemini
A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients' opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company with 200,000 team members in over 40 countries. In 2017 the Group achieved €12.8 billion in revenue. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com
 
About Our Team
Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people.
Due to continued growth within Capgemini's Insights & Data practice we intend to recruit a number of Informatica Data Quality Consultants with relevant consulting and communication skills and with a proven track record of delivery within the Enterprise Information Management arena. If you are already working in a consultancy role, or have excellent client-facing skills gained within large organizations, we would like to discuss our consultant opportunities with you.
 
About The Role
The is a subject matter expert in their field of excellence. The role of the Data Quality Analyst involves leading the project, ensuring high quality and timely delivery and providing quality assurance. This role is expected to influence team members and act as a knowledge source. Key responsibilities of this role includes:

Strong customer/client focus, with the ability to manage expectations appropriately, to provide a superior customer/client experience
Guide the team across all steps in the Data Quality assessment process i.e. Data Standardisation, Cleanse, transform and parsing data using DQ transformations such as the Case Converter, Merge, Labeler, Standardiser, Parser.
Design, develop and implement solutions to address customer's organisational problems
Provide high quality service delivery on engagements
Actively manage client relationships
Identifying and satisfy resource needs
Provides high quality outcome on deliverables.
Support the design and development DQ and MDM solutions
Build and configure the IDQ mapping to standardize, cleanse and enhance the quality of data and push it to the staging area
Build and configure mappings to carry out activities related to matching and merging of data
Support the design and development DQ and MDM solutions
Build and configure the IDQ mapping to standardize, cleanse and enhance the quality of data and push it to the staging area
Build and configure mappings to carry out activities related to matching and merging of data

About you

Minimum of 5 years' experience working on Informatica Data Quality (Informatica specialist in Data Quality certification is mandatory)
Must have clear understanding of Data Quality, Data Governance, Data Lakes and Master Data Management concepts.    
Understanding of software life cycle processes, experience of working in a large-scale program in Australia.
Informatica Data Quality and Informatica Master Data Management version 9.x, 10.x
Data Modelling, Advanced PL/SQL, Java SDK
Personal attributes: Problem solving skills, Team Spirit, Accountability and Responsibility
Other beneficial skills: Strong development and design background and people management.
Informatica Data Quality (IDQ) Tool knowledge is a must
Expertise in IDQ tool, profiling, cleansing and matching
Expertise in IDQ tool to build scripts for data quality related solutions/activities
Proficient in writing SQL queries for performing unit testing
Familiar with Data Integration through Informatica Cloud
Knowledge on other INFA tools is an advantage
Understanding of software life cycle processes, experience of working in a large-scale program, Data warehouse and ETL development

 
How to apply
Interested?  We invite you to join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. Not only will you work alongside inspiring colleagues with a world of experience, but you'll also have access to great benefits including, salary continuance insurance, paid parental leave, education assistance, salary packaging, the ability to purchase additional leave, as well as, discounts on entertainment, financial and wellbeing services, travel and shopping.  Ranked among Ethisphere's 2015 Most Ethical Companies in the Word. Our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty.  If you believe you have "La Niaque" to go the extra mile, then apply online today.
Capgemini is a proud to be Equal Opportunity Employer and all applicants must be legally entitled to work in the country the role is based out of, unless otherwise stated within the job advertisement.  Proof of work entitlements and visa status will be required prior to and/or at time of offer. Successful applicants will be required to complete a security and reference checks prior to commencement of employment.
Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

job_title: Python / PHP Full Stack Software Engineer / Developer for Big Data Automation
job_description: We're looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer (x2) with both PHP and Python and a strength in either to join a Big Data orientated team... building out tools with automation to make configuration and integration better, faster, easier. We have been doing this a while now and it has grown with some significance, largely due to the huge amounts of data involved, i.e. thousands of objects/schemas, growing rapidly as the network is delivered. Constant hourly, daily and per request dataloads. We’re building really useful tools for the data lake, produced from 100’s of different data sources that have been pooled together (involving hundreds of billions of rows). As the programme plugs into more systems, new functionality and tools need to be custom built to increase the usability of all the pieces of information and bits of science. This involves automating tasks to massively boost productivity and create efficiencies… so, for example, and it has been measured, 1 person's job can become 10x more productive. ...this is who you’d be rubbing shoulders with.... Our small Agile teams of people undertaking this work are not only strong dev engineers but collectively very knowledgeable in general across Big Data, Machine Learning, AI, scientific programming, statistical analysis and the like. Herein lies the opportunity to join our band on contractors who have been enjoying 6m rolling contracts for quite some time. This is going into 2020 and beyond. FYI: the base platform is a scalable and distributed data warehouse stack comprised of Mesos, Spark, Presto and Hive. So lots of Open Source and moving to Microservices wherever possible… making tools to automate, automate, automate – here's some of the potential exposure on offer – Microservices, Docker, Jenkins, AWS/Cloud, Spark, Kafka, Mesos, Airflow, NiFi, PHP, SOAP, REST, FED React, JIRA, Confluence. Essential skills required:  Combined 5+ years recent commercial experience on PHP and Python on large systems JavaScript development experience. SQL development experience. Strong communication skills Quick on the uptake A blend of the following would be fab:   React / JS Experience of building PHP applications using Zend Framework (or similar) and Doctrine. Agile experience – advocate for working in small agile teams CI/CD experience would also be a big plus (containerised deployment - Docker, Jenkins) Exposure to testing tools/processes (automated tools would be an advantage) Flexible approach to work and willingness to learn new things Willingness to share knowledge and coach other developers Willingness to learn and adapt to changing priorities (i.e. test or develop as the team needs) If this sounds like You or Someone you know... please get in touch:  john.knight@saltworth.com.au 0402 234813 www.saltworth.com.au - are you worth your salt?

About Us
At Coles, the Finance team is not only looking at today but the future as well. By working cross functionally with all teams, we evaluate the performance of the business, provide actionable insights and support strategic business decisions. We ensure Coles is set up for success, making life easier for our customers and our teams.
The role
Reporting the Finance Manager – Meat Production, you will be responsible for leading a team in the preparation of financial and non-financial information whilst continually looking for improvement opportunities.
Responsibilities include:

lead the Meat Production team to deliver results and insightful reporting each week
Provide commercial analysis and support to the Meat BU and senior Coles finance personnel to achieve strategic objectives
facilitate improvement of financial accounting processes into a system environment, whilst maintaining full visibility of results
initiate & manage tools for improved metrics reporting in line with global best practices
set up and maintenance of appropriate internal controls
lead, mentor and develop other finance staff as appropriate
identify opportunities to improve or streamline existing manual business processes
review & implement Financial Policy relevant to the business & consistent with group policy
investigate & resolution of both internal and external stakeholder’s queries

To be successful, you’ll have:

a CA/CPA qualification or equivalent
proven proficiency in successfully leading a team
experience of working with non-financial stakeholders
experience in identification, implementation and application of appropriate internal controls
the ability to analyse both financial and non-financial data to provide insightful commercial analysis and support
proven ability to challenge & influence key business stakeholders and processes to develop ‘win win’ solutions
superior time management, with the ability to prioritise tasks within a challenging environment
strong time management skills, with an ability to work within a team, and independently, and prioritise tasks appropriately
strong communication skills, both verbal and written
strong attention to detail, with strong analytical and problem solving skills

Benefits
Our commitment of making good things happen at Coles starts with our people. It is important for us to celebrate our wins and develop our people. In addition to a competitive salary, the other good things include:

Receiving a team member discount and exclusive team member offers;
Sampling new products and flavours before they hit the shelves;
12 weeks of paid parental leave for primary care givers and 1 week of paid leave for secondary care givers;
Access to an onsite childcare School Holiday Program; 
Access to a Fitness Centre and Body Therapy Clinic; and 
Being part of a fun and inclusive culture where you can learn and develop your skills through our excellent ongoing training and development

Culture
At Coles, we are all about our people. As a top-30 ASX listed company, we are a dynamic, empowering and collaborative organisation that is focused on ensuring a positive, inclusive work environment for all team members. We believe in energising everyone by having you become part of a more purposeful work life. At Coles, we believe we are better together when team members can perform at their best and will support you in bringing your best self every day. So, how will you make good things happen at Coles?
 
At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.

About your environment Since our establishment in 1936,  Cancer Council Victoria has developed an international reputation for our innovative work in cancer research, prevention and support. As an independent, not-for-profit organisation, we play a leading role in reducing the impact of all cancers on all people. The purpose of the  Cancer Epidemiology Division (CED) is to progress the cancer control objectives of the Cancer Council by developing and maintaining high quality resources for epidemiological research and to maintain national and international recognition for excellence in epidemiological research and scholarship. About your opportunity We are seeking a Senior Research Officer – Statistician to join the Cancer Epidemiology Division. Reporting to the Team Leader, Statistical Analysis Cluster, your role is to:  Analyse existing data from programs and studies and contribute to the writing of scientific papers for publication in peer reviewed journals and grant applications Provide technical reports to senior staff and external collaborators and stakeholders, and deliver sound technical advice on statistical methods All about you We are looking for someone with:  Master’s Degree in biostatistics or epidemiology or in a related discipline and demonstrated experience in carrying out statistical analysis in relevant areas  A proven record of achievement in scholarly research with an ability to perform appropriate statistical analyses for epidemiological research projects and write scientific reports, papers and grant applications Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with other researchers as part of a team What we can offer you This full-time permanent position which provides a salary within range $70,593 - $79,370 pa plus superannuation, annual leave loading and the benefits of not-for-profit salary packaging, novated leasing and a meal entertainment card. We also offer a flexible and friendly work environment, social and wellbeing activities and a location close to public transport. To apply and for more info Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply. Culturally and linguistically diverse applicants are encouraged to apply.  To apply for this opportunity visit  http://www.cancervic.org.au/about/careers/job-opportunities to download a Position Description and the Key Selection Criteria and forward your full application (cover letter, resume and completed Key Selection Criteria document) to hr@cancervic.org.au. For more information contact Julie Bassett on (03) 9514 6244. Cancer Council will only make contact with applicants that are shortlisted for interview. We are also unable to respond to recruitment agency enquiries. All offers of employment will be made subject to satisfactory completion of employment checks including evidence of right to work in Australia, and a National Police Check  Applications close 16th May 2019

At Kmart, families come first for the lowest prices on everyday items. Our vision is to make everyday living brighter for all of our customers, every time, everywhere they shop with us. 
As Australia’s brightest retail star, we have experienced great success in recent times. For Kmart this is just the beginning of our exciting journey ahead! We have big plans in place to ensure we deliver our vision and significantly expand our business. With another 40 new stores opening across Australia and New Zealand, the growth of our online business and expansion into new markets, we are on a mission to improve the Kmart shopping experience for all our customers, who are at the heart of everything we do. There has never been a more irresistible time to join Kmart!  
Kmart is prioritising its analytical capabilities and due to our exciting transformation journey, we are looking for a Business / Data Analytics Communicator to join our team.   
Utilising your Business /Data Analytics Communication capabilities, background in statistics, machine learning, data mining and regression, clustering and decision trees, you will bridge the gap between the broader data engineering/data science team and the business to further develop the analytics strategy, develop use cases, end to end scoping, development and delivery of solutions into production to realise strategic business value for Kmart.
Your proven stakeholder management and collaboration skills, experience leading projects and most importantly your ability to translate analytics output into meaningful insightful business value, are essential to your success in this role.
Specifically you will be responsible for the following:

The execution of analytics use cases – translate business and commercial challenges into analytics use cases working between the business and the analytics translated business problem statements into agreed scoping, analytical approach and technical requirements.
Delivery and implementation of use cases back into the business function
Analytics Roadmap – as part of the team, define, scope and determine the business need, analytical and data engineering approach to deliver strategic analytics use cases; understand the needs of the business and translate into new use cases.

This unique opportunity will see you working with Kmart to ensure its ongoing success.
At Kmart, we recognise the value in promoting a flexible work environment and are happy to consider applicants seeking a variety of arrangements. If flexibility is important to you please outline your individual requirements on the Flexible Work Arrangements section on the application form.
You will benefit from joining an amazing business and a dynamic team who are all committed to the success of Kmart and providing our customers with a great shopping experience. Our values – Think Customer, Take Care, Live Integrity, Grow Together and Reach Higher will resonate with you deeply and you’ll enjoy being part of a growing, iconic Australian business that has a fantastic culture that is non-hierarchical, diverse and inclusive. Your work environment will be highly collaborative, fast-paced and progressive, with no two days the same!
You will be afforded autonomy and accountability in your role and have access to development opportunities across both Kmart and the Wesfarmers Group, excellent remuneration, an uncapped bonus scheme & access to Wesfarmers share plan (both for eligible team members), free parking and benefits program including a discount card for Kmart, Coles, Target and Officeworks.
At Kmart we aim to ensure our teams reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate.
Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.

Develop recommendations based on industry best practice, organisational structure, existing workflows, and internal data to meet business financial targets   Implement the risk management procedures and risk processes to manage sportsbook customers and profitability effectively.   Help to develop strategies for new market entries through analysis of existing customer base, prospective target markets, and research-based competitor profiles.   Establish status as subject matter expert within the business for questions around the product & issues.   Proactively engage with Content, CRM, Marketing, Insights on regular bases to help them improve the acquisition, retention and in general, all promotional activities related to the Sportsbook.   Research, define, recommend and implement digital-specific innovation across the   Sportsbook customer experience seeking input from external and internal stakeholders and keeping abreast of industry and sector best practices.   Document and record operating procedures and make recommendations to management on improvements   Constant communication and training to company live support team regarding   Sportsbook best practices and problems.    Salary   $100-110,000 + Superannuation.   Skills/Qualifications required     +5 years of experience working in online Sportsbook companies either supplying software or operating them.   Sportsbook trading experience is a must.   Excellent communication skills.   Experience in international sportsbooks is a bonus.   Australian work rights preferred.

We are currently looking for an experienced Inventory Manager Business Analyst to join the Consumer Brands team based at our Camberwell Support Office. The Opportunity to Make a Difference:
The Business Analyst (Field Impact) role exists to provide the Director, Performance and Planning with analytical and problem-solving support to input into the optimisation of strategy and plans and manage business unit performance.
This requires a focus on stakeholder management, financial analysis and special projects.
This role seeks to understand the link between financial and non-financial metrics and works closely with other analysts to ensure a holistic view is being formed. 
This role is expected to lead financial process improvement projects and is therefore required to bring a high degree of commercial acumen, problem solving, self-motivation and stakeholder management skills.   
 
A day in the life of WVA’s Finance Business Analyst includes:
The role is accountable day to day to support the Director Performance and Planning to effectively monitor group level performance and enable strategy achievement.
Day-to-day this includes:

development of performance reporting including drawing insights from data,
financial and non-financial analysis to drive discussion and decision making with senior leadership,
partnering with managers to support budget management and identifying continuous improvement opportunities,
input into strategy and planning processes and development of tools and processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

 
Who are you?
A Business Analyst that demonstrates high commercial acumen, a service focus and an approach to processes and practices with a continuous improvement mindset; you will also possess the following skills, experience & qualifications:

Tertiary qualifications in Business, Finance or other relevant discipline.
Knowledge of regulatory and compliance environment for charities.
Minimum of 4 years experience in budget management, strategic planning, financial and non-financial analysis
Stakeholder engagement and negotiation at senior levels
Interpreting and presenting information and facilitating decision making processes with senior /executive leaders
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills

 
What you need to know
This role is a permanent contract operating in a full-time capacity and will be based at our head office in Burwood East, Victoria.
For your information, the role may be filled before the closing date.
 
What does success look like?
First and foremost, you will be a leader in every aspect of your life and line of work, irrespective of your level of expertise. You excel working in an ever-changing environment and you love forming strong relationships, which lets you effectively engage with stakeholders and to perform at your peak.
Having a proactive and fresh approach, you are ready to collaborate and overcome any obstacles that may come your way. Your energy is infectious, showcasing the passion you can bring to our organisation.
 
Why Should You Apply?

We collaborate in a high performing and professional culture, committed to one common goal; the fight against global poverty, its causes and making a real difference in the world
We build brighter futures for vulnerable children and seeking to empower the world's poorest people.
Our people have access to professional development programs that include on-the-job learning, e-learning, workshops, forums, leadership development and internal mobility
Competitive salary and flexible salary packaging scheme

 
Why World Vision?
World Vision is a worldwide community development organisation that provides short-term and long-term assistance to 100 million people worldwide (including 2.4 million children).
We have more than 45,000 staff members working in 96 countries. For six decades, World Vision has been engaging people to work towards eliminating poverty and its causes.
Our vision for every child: Life in all its fullness. Our prayer for every heart: the will to make it so

job_title: Front End Developer, React.js Javascript ES6 machine learning / automation / AI
salary: Target is $130k plus super.. open to senior $150k+
job_description: Front End Dev needed with React in Melb on machine learning / smart comms AI automation products - data analytics/predictive algorithms We are looking for 2x Front-End Devs with React.js and associated skills. Salary-wise we can go up to the $150k+ level and we can also hire a mid-level at the $100k - $120k mark. Now to put some meat to the bone... This is a top FED job in Melbourne working on machine learning / smart communications products using advanced data analytics and predictive intent algorithms.   Tech-Deep Machine Learning / AI Platform Predictive Intelligence / Algorithms Fully Automated CRM & Advanced Data Analytics React.js SPA on Rails API & associated tech Long-term career growth (see prospects below) / training Dive right into the codebase and start shipping quality code Significantly contribute to machine-driven campaign and audience automated compilation solutions that take prop-tech marketing automation to the next level. There are many exciting new features planned on the product roadmap (two-years’ worth and counting) …and we need help in driving implementation with best practices in modern front-end development. The firm is well established (global presence $70m) with a Tech-First ethos. They WANT you to research better ways of working, identify new tools, prototype and implement them. “We want an experienced Front End Developer who knows that they’re good. We want the confidence as well as a healthy slice of humility to share visions for the platform. Essentially, someone who invests intellectually and emotionally in the business.”  Required skills and experience ● React & Redux ● Typescript & ES6 ● CSS & CSS Modules ● At least one frontend testing framework (Mocha, Jest, Cypress, etc) ● Modern frontend tooling (NPM, Webpack, RequireJS, etc) Desirable skills (nice to have / exposure to be gained) ● NodeJS ● GraphQL ● Working with / building design libraries ● CI/CD pipelines ● Docker, Kubernetes, AWS …Experience in other languages is a plus, you may need to dive in to our Ruby or Golang codebases on occasion. Prospects… yes, they’re real: “We have historically trained the right people in not only progressing their current role (some just want to be really good devs), move horizontally into different roles to learn new skills (e.g from dev to product or advocate roles) or vertically into management. We rotate our engineers around our various teams to ensure they are exposed to all parts of our stack.” Your strengths and interests will ultimately dictate the direction you would like to take and which projects you work on. “We're solving a lot of hard problems at the moment to do with scalability, but also have exciting product related features to build. Our developers often get to learn new and cutting-edge technologies, if the tool is right for the job, we will use it.” If this sounds like YOU or someone you know. Please email them / email me… EOI's and resumes to: john.knight@saltworth.com.au  Or click on APPLY below. A quick turnaround can be facilitated if necessary.

We are on a mission to be Australia’s leading agency for community engagement, helping people and stakeholders shape decisions about how our cities and regions work. As we grow to a state of eight million people and deliver one of Victoria’s largest infrastructure programs in history, community engagement is essential to making the right decisions about our future transport network.    About the Role (2 positions available) Join an outcome driven engagement team, that focuses on connecting communities to the way we design and deliver roads, cycling and pedestrian paths, support the freight industry and deliver registration and licensing services.    The Strategic Engagement team are responsible for the: • Development and implementation of systems, tools and resources for VicRoads to undertake genuine and purposeful stakeholder and community engagement. • Monitoring and reporting of the organisations engagement activities and providing opportunities and recommendations on continuous improvement, risk management and better practice processes. • Capturing and analysing the data of community and stakeholders to improve the way we engage with them to improve various projects and programs across Victoria  We’re looking for two Stakeholder Data and Administration superstars who are enthusiastic and passionate about implementing systems to help the organisation report on and shape decisions. Join a team of great engagers and communicators, who have worked with different communities and interest groups and know how to deliver engagement programs and systems that make a difference.   These are 12-month limited tenure roles based in the CBD with the requirement to undertake regular travel and overnights stays to all our regional centres, namely Benalla, Bendigo, Ballarat, Traralgon and Geelong.  The role will: • Undertake a customised, two-hour in-house eLearning package, on Consultation Manager, the system you will be using. You will share your experience of this training with colleagues to professionally develop their user ability and support for the programs purpose and value. • Work with engineers, policy and planning specialists, and a variety of business teams to ensure that their stakeholders’ data is captured and loaded into the Consultation Manager system appropriately. • Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders to collate and enter engagement  activity data across the five Regional Roads Victoria (RRV) regions for the entire financial year so as to facilitate reporting and continuous improvement planning. • Exercise independent judgement to manage the prescribed methods of data entry and where identified, correct data relationship errors in the Consultation Manager system. • Input all regional based stakeholder engagement data for the entire financial year to  facilitate reporting and continuous improvement planning • Exercise professional independent judgement in complying with specific procedures in the entry of data and seeking clarification from the Stakeholder Management Systems Coordinator when necessary.  Skills and experience required:  • Ability to quickly learn and become adept with a new system and its associated processes, to accurately and consistently enter data in a prescribed manner, into the VicRoads stakeholder management system. • Proficient verbal and written communication skills. • Ability to accurately recognise data entry errors across a large, complex database and liaising with the Stakeholder Management Systems Coordinator when necessary, to appropriately resolve any anomalies or uncertainties under broad supervision. • Ability to understand and follow confidentiality protocols and processes under broad supervision. • Exercise professional judgement to effectively manage one’s own time and the time of others and maintain high levels of confidentiality and performance with a complex and demanding work environment. • Promote and guide staff in the use of the selected stakeholder data base systems – Consultation Manager to improve support and reporting capability for projects and programs For more information or a Job No.: 591958
Location: Clayton campus
Employment Type: Full-time 
Duration: 12 month fixed-term appointment
Remuneration: $62,701 - $67,068 pa HEW Level 04 (plus 9.5% employer superannuation)

Be inspired, every day
Take your career in exciting, rewarding directions
Be a part of an inclusive, collaborative community

There’s a certain feeling you get from working at Monash University. It’s the feeling that you’re a part of something special. Something significant. And that’s because you’re not just starting your career, or taking on a bigger challenge. You’re making a real contribution – surrounded by energetic, inspiring people who are driven to make a difference as well. Monash is a place where you’ll be able to develop your career in exciting, sometimes unexpected ways – putting you in the best possible position for a rewarding future.
The Opportunity
Bring your expertise and experience in computer modelling of urban water systems to support the Tools and Products sub-program of the CRC for Water Sensitive Cities (CRCWSC). As an integral part of an interdisciplinary research team you will work with the CRCWSC and industry stakeholders and provide computation modelling support for flood, environmental and integrated water management solutions for cities in Australia and Internationally.
Working under the leadership of Dr Christian Urich from the Monash University Department of Civil Engineering you will use your analytical, technical, data analysis and research skills to apply and develop innovative modelling solutions for integrated urban water management. Also, as part of the CRCWCS’s Tool and Products sub program, you will provide support to adoption projects and associated activities in cities in Australia and overseas, including India and China.
In particular, as part of the RISE (Revitalising Informal Settlements and Their Environments) project, you will also design urban flood solutions for informal settlements in Fiji and Indonesia.
Your professional technical and modelling services will support the activities of the CRC for Water Sensitive Cities while you coordinate modelling activities and provide research support, project administration, and industry reporting in support of the strategic research positioning of the CRCWSC.
As you will often be the first point of contact for enquiries you will provide sound and timely advice to support all stakeholders appropriate to your level of experience and qualifications.
The Research Officer will be employed by Monash University and seconded to the CRCWSC for the duration of the contract; both appointments will end simultaneously.
If this sounds like a position that suits your current career focus we look forward to hearing from you.This role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.
At Monash University, we are committed to being a Child Safe organisation. Some positions at the University will require the incumbent to hold a valid Working with Children Check.
Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to "How to apply for Monash Jobs".
Enquiries
Mr Ben Furmage, Chief Operating Officer, CRC fro Water Sensitive Cities, +61 3 9902 0542
Position Description
Research Officer - Urban Modelling
Closing Date
Friday 10 May 2019, 11:55 pm AEST

Technical Business Analyst
Business Analyst in Digital Content
700 Bourke street location

At NAB, it's all about our people reaching their full potential.
Calling all Business Analysts!
Do you want to help gather quality requirements in an Agile environment to enable components to be built that will be used to extend the NAB.com.au website – one of the top 50 most visited sites in Australia? 
Do you love technology and have a desire to learn more?  Are you looking to be part of a multi-skilled team that has wonderful opportunities to not only apply your current skills, but learn more – a lot more?  Do you want to work for a company where you are respected and work/life balance actually means something?
What you would be doing.
We are seeking an experienced Technical Business Analyst who is a passionate, results focused individual to take accountability for delivering quality requirements in Agile environment within our Digital Content team.
This involves working closely with a variety of stakeholders - product owners, solution designers, developers, testers, and a variety of SME’s from analytics, accessibility and personalisation SME’s in an Agile environment to create great applications.
The work our teams do revolves heavily around building out componentry to be used within AEM that our Content Authoring team leverages to create web pages primarily for the NAB.com.au site and other NAB group companies.  There is also the opportunity to design and build single page applications used across the site.
Main Activities

Creating user stories, helping to manage and prioritise a release backlog of user stories, participating in iterations, daily stand ups and retrospectives, etc.
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand business priorities and business requirements
Engaging with stakeholders to ensure all processes, requirements and business rules are documented and included in the solution
Documenting business requirements (functional and non-functional) as well as delivering high level/detailed requirements through use cases, process flows and maps etc.
Effective use of data and process modelling tools (including, but not limited to, process mapping, business, object and dataflow modelling) to analyse and represent information in an effective form, in order to translate business requirements into meaningful statements of work
Identification of risks, issues and dependencies. Assisting with the resolution of risks and issues, which arise during the project lifecycle. Raise and provide input to the Leads and PMs of additional risks and issues resulting from the scope change or during the development cycle. Additionally, provide input to any change requests that may arise
Providing functional expertise (on assigned functional areas) to solution designers, developers, testers, and business groups as needed to facilitate development, testing, training, and review client and internal communications ensuring detailed business requirements are accurately covered in the overall solution.
Providing test support (SME assistance) in reviewing test cases whilst validating and assessing requirements including defects during test preparation, SIT, UAT and BVT cycles
Continuous innovation in BA practices and team processes
Contributing to a BA community of practice to help uplift our platform knowledge and capability

Key Skills

The successful candidate will have at least 3-4 years of experience as a Technical BA, and a minimum of 2 years working within in an agile environment.
Ability to engage and influence stakeholders
Ability to draw out necessary information and utilise agile delivery techniques to ensure speed to market is maintained to drive a first-class customer experience
Exceptionally strong written and verbal communication skills, fantastic facilitation skills as well as good interpersonal and organizational skills
Strong delivery focus with an active approach to quality, with an enthusiasm for technology and solving problems.
Working knowledge and experience in scrum/agile ceremonies (backlog/sprint grooming, inception, PI planning) and the Atlassian toolset (JIRA, Confluence)
Technical understanding of various digital technology concepts would be highly regarded i.e. HTML, CSS, JAVA, JS, AWS
Working knowledge of AEM is preferable

What’s in it for you?
A role in a wonderful team of professionals. You’ll be working on highly visible changes that you’ll be able to point out to your friends and say, ‘I worked on that’.  You’ll be supported in your professional development – we want to help you become better than the superstar you already are.  You’ll have access to flexible working arrangements, because we understand you have a life outside work.
The work will be challenging – but rewarding. Always dictated by doing what’s right by our customers, no matter what.  We offer an exciting opportunity for anyone looking to take that next big career step in one of Australia’s big 4 banks.
If you think this sounds like it could be for you, then send us your application, we’d love to hear from you.

job_title: PEGA Senior Business Analyst / Lead Business Analyst / Business Architect
job_description: Lead Business Analyst Job DescriptionThe Lead Business Analyst provides strategic business analysis services to business partners. This role will be key to understanding the documenting capabilities needed to address business challenges.The Lead Business Analyst is responsible for reviewing assigned business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial and technological risks. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency. Responsibilities will include a full range of activities from leading small to mid-size projects to assisting other project managers on larger more complex projects related to operational business functions that affect team members and providers at the market level.Responsibilities:• Must to have Pega Application Experience and good to have CPBA certification• Demonstrate up-to-date expertise in Information Systems and apply this to the development, execution and improvement of action plans by providing advice and guidance to others in the application of information and best practices• Support and align efforts to meet customer and business needs• Manage customer relationships and expectations by developing a communication process to keep others up-to-date on project results• Stay current with customer needs and strategies; utilizing formal and informal written communication methods (for example, emails, newsletters, PowerPoint presentations, executive updates, task lists, updates) to communicate updates and findings; and facilitating project meetings and presentations to all types of diverse audiences (for example, senior management, Customers, technical staff)• Lead or participate in multiple projects by completing and updating project documentation; managing project scope; adjusting schedules when necessary; determining daily priorities; ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; following proper escalation paths; and managing customer and supplier relationships• Provide leadership to team members and peers by collaborating with others; articulating ideas and viewpoints to senior management, peers and others; identifying and initiating projects; managing resources; driving the resolution of issues; and holding self and team accountable for results• Identify, create and facilitate process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex level; focusing on quality improvement and data management; ensuring data is reliable and valid; developing process improvements or re-engineering and recommending elimination; integrating new systems and processes with existing ones; and partnering with internal and external customers to ensure systems provided meet the long-term business strategies• Provide and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilities• Provide project level analysis – producing required project analysis documentation (business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, UAT plan)• Collaborate closely with developers to implement the requirements, provide necessary guidance to testers during QA process• Identify improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive)• Elicit and clearly document business and systems requirements• Assess business process and system inefficiencies• Identify ways to increase adoption and customer satisfaction• Demonstrated fluency in business processes and process differentiation• Ability to analyze and synthesize business requirements, including recognizing patterns and conceptualizing processes• Understand and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders• Serve as a liaison between Operations and IT to assist or gather business requirements needed for system modifications, enhancement and implementations• Assist with and test implementation for all payer and vendor relationships to ensure data transfer collection, quality and reporting relationships are working appropriately down to the market level to ensure market team member and provider experience is appropriate• Create and maintain issue logs, meeting minutes, meeting schedules, project summaries and updates.• Create and maintain project schedules by developing project plans and specifications, estimating time and resources, monitoring milestone completion, tracking all phases of the project lifecycle, providing timely reporting of issues that impact project progress, coordinating actions and resolving conflicts• Meet with project team regularly to review project deliverables and deadlines• Develop and execute test plans• Support system conversions, upgrades, enhancements

Company Overview: EduCo International is a diversified, post-secondary education company dedicated to helping international students achieve their academic and career goals. EduCo owns and operates colleges and partners with public and not-for-profit universities in growing the student community and delivering specialised on-campus pathway programs in Australia, Canada, Ireland and the United States. Marketing and Recruitment is a primary area of emphasis for EduCo, and the global Recruitment team, comprised of over 90 staff based in 21 countries, is a key driver of EduCo’s success. EduCo’s offshore Recruitment, Conversion and MarComms teams are a shared service that support all EduCo destinations with an end to end student recruitment solution. Although large and geographically distributed, the team prides itself on being dynamic, ‘easy to work with’ and above all, consistently performing well above industry benchmarks. The team market and promote EduCo institutions, manage a network of several thousand distributors, generate applications from tens of thousands of students each year and then convert these into new enrolments to meet new student recruitment budgets. The Position:  The position of Reporting Manager offers the opportunity for an experienced professional to build their career in this dynamic division with an exciting global education group. Based in EduCo’s Melbourne head office and interacting regularly with the Exec team and EduCo’s global teams, this role is responsible for overseeing the data collection, reporting and analysis of the activities and budgets of the Marketing team’s activities. The primary purpose of the Reporting Manager role is to support the global Marketing, Recruitment and Conversion teams by providing high level reporting and data to enhance the management of the team and maximise their performance. Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities:  Manage the annual budgeting process for allocation and tracking of expenditure across the team Coordinate the new student recruitment budget and target process, track performance and provide regular reports Development and maintenance of ongoing data dashboards, compiling industry data and reconciling data with other EduCo teams Updating and recording all organizational changes and business development initiatives within the Marketing team Manage the Management/Executive reporting cycle with and from stakeholders of relevant EduCo entities and departments Preparation of Exco reports Preparation of data tables for reporting key measures Progress tracking for OGSM goals and measures Clerical Administration and project management support Note taking, preparation of Minutes, Action Items etc. Formatting and presentation responsibility Project management for regular report submissions Coordination & scheduling of meetings and presentations to track OGSM measures/goals Maintaining the current filing and database system, and looking for ways to improve current systems Undertaking administrative approvals on behalf of the SVP Marketing including timesheets and various HR duties Qualifications, Experience & Technical Skills:  Proven experience as an administration/ reporting manager Strong command of English (written and verbal) Experience extracting reports from multiple systems, analysing data and presenting reports Strong numeracy skills and experience working with financial and budget files An understanding of project management principles Tertiary qualifications in Finance/Commerce would be highly regarded Proficient in Microsoft Office suite skills (Word, Excel, PPT, Visio) Ability to analyse and assess information / issues: Process and analyse information, as well as take a series of instructions and create efficient actions. Experience with business writing including reporting, presentations and business cases. Individual Capabilities/Competencies:  Personal effectiveness Excellent time management skills Attention to detail and accuracy Negotiation skills and the ability to influence others to achieve timelines and objectives. Great verbal and written communication skills: an ability to clearly convey and receive messages to meet the needs of all. This involves listening, interpreting and delivering verbal, non-verbal, written and electronic messages. Excellent organizational and multi-tasking abilities: Effective management, organization, and prioritisation of office functions as well as management of internal and external stake-holders. Interpersonal: Working cooperatively and productively with others to achieve objectives Team player with leadership skills who also has the ability to work autonomously and show initiative to drive outcomes Professional discretion In return we offer a range of great benefits, including work variety, workplace flexibility and leave options, learning and development opportunities, and study support. EduCo prides itself on being a great place to work.   Only people with the right to work in Australia may apply for this position. If you are looking for an exciting and challenging role as a Reporting Manager, please submit your resume and cover letter as soon as possible.  As an equal opportunity employer, EduCo values employee diversity and we are committed to building a more inclusive workplace. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community. Due to high volume of applications only a handful of selected applicants will be contacted for interviews.

Greenfield position to shape and own Work with global counterparts to support local teams Clayton, Melbourne based position This is your perfect opportunity to apply your expertise as an SAP (FICO) BA  in an exciting global environment. Lockheed Martin is a dynamic, growing, and energetic organisation offering stimulating, challenging work at the forefront of technology. Lockheed Martin is a leader in Australia’s National Security, and our collaboration with Australian industry spans the Aeronautics, Maritime, Surveillance and Defence domains. We employ approximately 100,000 staff worldwide, and over 1000 staff in Australia across multiple locations. This is a newly created position for our Australian business designed to mirror our US counterparts in providing on the ground support to multiple SAP Finance instances. The position will be based in Clayton, reporting to the IT Program Manager whilst interacting with the Global Financial Services team and business area functional users. As the SAP Financial BA, you will support the identification of issues and risks whilst ensuring day to day customer support for financial reporting, audit, problem analysis and resolution. This role will also own the prioritisation of fix incidents – testing, documentation and training updates. Working collaboratively with other business and technical personnel, you will ensure integration with interfacing systems and processes as needed. If you have a passion for fast paced environments and ability to work multiple tasks simultaneously whilst learning new functionalities quickly, this might be the role for you!! To be considered, you must demonstrate experience in SAP ECC 6 or SAP S/4 HANA system configuration and sustainment. Integral to your success in delivering to this role will be your hands-on knowledge of SAP Financials and focus in Accounting processes (i.e. financial reporting, asset management, billing, periodic closing, project systems) including SAP Configuration experience in multiple modules: FI/CO, PS, SD, AM. Our ideal candidate has experience in analysis using Accounting rules/practices (i.e. GL, Balance Sheet, month-end processing). You enjoy building and owning relationships, possess strong skills in data analytics and financial reporting with proven ability to work with virtual teams. As there is potential for occasional travel internationally your willingness to do so from the get go will be an important criterion in your selection.  You describe yourself as a proactive and self-motivated person who continues to set the bar high for themselves. What we offer you: From competitive salary packages and benefits to training and development opportunities we show our appreciation for your skills, ambitions and potential. Lockheed Martin Australia supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in Workplace. Applicants are required to be Australian Citizens and be eligible CoA Defence clearance. Employment may be contingent on the satisfactory result of criminal and/or other background screens, which require the collection and transfer of personal information. Lockheed Martin supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, harassment free, diverse, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. Diversity and inclusion are the foundation of our culture and reflect our values of doing what’s right, respecting others and performing with excellence. By leveraging our employees unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

job_title: Dev Ops Engineer Big Data Cloud AWS
job_description: We are looking for a DevOps engineer to work with an established data and analytics and cloud practice  across a number of projects and who will be responsible for building, improving and maintaining the cloud and big data  infrastructure, enabling their services to be deployed, run and operated from development to production. You will have the chance to work on a variety of cloud and big data projects with highly robust and scalable infrastructure, and some of the most cutting-edge systems and tools, including AWS, Terraform, and Docker. Essential Skills and Experience  Expert skills in Amazon Web Services (EC2, S3, EMR, ELB, Elastic Beanstalk, VPC, Kinesis, Route 53, security groups) Solid background in DevOps engineering (load testing, continuous integration, change management, application monitoring, production support) Strong experience in orchestration tools (Jenkins, Ansible, Chef) Experience with scripting languages (Python, Scala, Go) Expert skills in UNIX Good understanding of networks and information security Ability to manage and work in fast-paced, dynamic work environment Any Data Warehousing, Big Data or Data Analytics experience is a huge bonus, but not essential. Our Consultants are experts in big data, data engineering and connected cloud systems, all of whom possess excellent high level consulting skills combined with an ability to understand a client's business problem, the ability to design solutions, and guide the implementation of these solutions. If you are interested in gaining experience working on leading edge Cloud and Analytics projects or would like to know more about the work we do at Infoready, please apply online, including your resume, and we will be in contact to discuss your application.

About Us CPA Australia is one of the world’s leading member service organisations, with over 163,000 members across 125 countries. Our core services to members include education, training, technical support and advocacy. Our core services to members include education, training, technical support and advocacy. Employees and members work together with local and international bodies to represent the views and concerns of the profession to governments, regulators, industries, academia and the general public.     About the Role?    Reporting to the Manager – Business Intelligence, this role is responsible for; Using data and a deep understanding of the business to understand and communicate industry and business insights to increase profits and efficiency.    Define, develop and monitor the organisations key performance indicators Partnering with the business to provide analytical insight for product and process performance information to stakeholders Work with key business decision makers in leveraging information to enable better informed decisions Assist users in how to leverage the BI environment to improve self-service capabilities Leverage data and analytic skills/tools to advance business insights and opportunities Provide modelling and forecasting capabilities as requested by key stakeholders Act as a data steward to develop and oversee the implementation of initiatives which lead to increased data integrity Lead and oversee the validation of business process improvements Scan and retain external market information to compliment internal data and analysis Build and augment BI and analytic skills in-line with technology changes and improvements   Please note we have contract and permanent options avaialable.    About You – You will have:   SQL querying skills Knowledge and experience in using BI Tools and techniques Advanced MS Excel, including use of PowerPivot, PowerQuery, Power BI, MS PowerPoint & Word Excellent analytical skills and business acumen Ability to synthesise structured and unstructured data and present sound recommendations based on analysis Able to work in a team environment and individually   What’s in it for me?   At CPA Australia people are at the heart of what we do. We promote and encourage an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone can be their best. Flexible working hours Paid parental, volunteer and study leave Annual incentive scheme Discounts on health insurance, phone plans, fuel, banking and many more Convenient Southbank location Learning & Professional Development opportunities Become part of a well-known global brand and make global connections within a collaborative environment       How do I Apply?   Click Apply Now to submit your application for this opportunity! Should you require more information on the role, feel free to contact the Recruitment Team on employment@cpaaustralia.com.au To learn more about CPA Australia and other opportunities, please visit our Careers page at https://www.cpaaustralia.com.au/about-us/careers

job_description: About Us: Established in 1991, DWS is an ASX listed professional Technology Consultancy with offices across Australia. DWS are UNABLE to sponsor visas. Ready for a new challenge? Click APPLY now! www.dws.com.au

This is an outstanding opportunity to join one of Australia’s premier Banking groups.  The position sits within the Group Regulatory Reporting team and will play a critical role in overseeing the accurate delivery of new suite of APRA/regulatory reporting requirements within defined timeframes. Transfit Australia brings together the best of Technology and Management Consulting, providing true "end to end" digital transformation services to our clients. We understand that transformation can't be achieved through technology alone, but requires a human centric approach focused on bringing the best of people, processes and technology.  We have some of the most talented consultants in the business as part of our team. Each of them brings a wealth of experience, having worked across a broad range industry sectors, as well as prominent local and global brands.   From short sharp consulting advice to long term bespoke project delivery; Transfit’s, focus is to provide agile, transparent, and sustainable engagements.   About the role: As we enter our growth stage, we’re looking for a strong sales specialist to join our team creating a pipeline of opportunities within mid-market and enterprise level accounts. With a background in solutions and IT services sales, you’ll that understands the business value around cloud, bespoke software development, enterprise applications and data driven insights. Most importantly, you’ll appreciate that sustainable solutions require more then just technology and articulate the benefits of a people centric approach; encompassing a well-defined strategy and strong delivery methodology.   About you:  Having performed in a similar role driving sales in mid-market and enterprise level accounts, you will have the following skills and experience,  A strong background in solution and services sales  A strong existing Australian network  A solid understanding of Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure and GCP), Enterprise Application, Software Development, Data and Insights Solutions Strong commercial acumen  The ability to connect and drive results driven communication with key decision makers  A good understanding of the competitive landscape  Demonstrated ability to work as the lead for large complex RFP’s and RFI’s  Proven negotiation skills  The ability to work with presales consultants An active team player Proven experience generating new business/financial models and negotiating contracts (in selected cases) The ability to identify opportunities for business improvement and strategic new business opportunities Comfortable managing multiple strategic initiatives simultaneously, interacting with a diverse set of Principal Consultants  Why Transfit? In addition to inspiring leadership and very competitive remuneration, we provide regular annual increases, a generous tool kit allowance (to keep you up to date with all the cool gadgets), and a minimum of 20 days of dedicated learning time. More importantly, we’re just a great place to work with flexible work hours and a culture that values what you bring as an individual, one that is inclusive, values diversity and puts our employees first.

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate. We’re a Fortune 500 company. We work across 80 countries, in 280 different offices, with a team of over 77,000 individuals. And we look after a property portfolio of over 4bn square feet, all on behalf of our clients. What this job involves With your team based in Brisbane, Canberra, Sydney & Melbourne You will lead a team and facilitate the delivery of BI, analytics and technology solutions using design thinking and agile delivery methods. You will create business value, ensuring work delivered aligns with our four strategic objectives: improve compliance, reduce cost, increase productivity and drive revenue. You will be accountable to ensure all technology used is compliant with information security (InfoSec) and any other compliance requirements of JLL clients. Sound like you?  This is what we’re looking for: You’ll hold an Advanced Diploma, Degree or equivalent in technology, business technology, project or evidence of rockstar skill in BI, data science, computer science, econometrics, operations research, statistics, Information Management, or related analytical field highly regarded Working knowledge of BI tools (Tableau preferred), querying databases (SQL) and ETL tools (e.g. Alteryx,  SSIS , Informatica) and data manipulation is desirable.. You’ll have the ability to influence & develop relationships with stakeholders and have the desire to achieve exceptional results. Your communication & negotiation skills ensure that you build rapport quickly and in return can easily understand & interpret your stakeholders needs This is an outstanding opportunity to lead a great team and make your mark within this challenging, and excellent environment. It is a requirement that candidates are Australian Citizens and able to get an appropriate baseline security clearance.  What can you expect from us? You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where the best inspire the best. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sight and imagine where JLL can take you... JLL is committed to developing and maintaining a diverse workforce. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. Interested candidates, please apply following the link below-quoting job reference number FOREQ52157

Your Experience will also include:Tertiary qualification in a Business or Information Technology discipline.Min 3 years of experience managing a team of Business Analysts.Working to tight timelines in an often pressurised environment.Working with development teams on web-based projects.An ability to translate business needs into technical requirements.A strategic thinker with exceptional analytical and problem solving skills.An end-to-end approach to your work.Experience working within small project teams .Ability to design and produce process maps (as is, to be) .A strong understanding of established business analysis methodologies.Some exposure to Marketing and campaign-based projects.Familiarity with preparing requirement analysis and documentation.Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Excellent verbal and written communication skills including a high level of emotional intelligence.Capable scrum master with and an ability to lead an organizational agile transformation.Confidence in running workshops as and when required. Report directly to the Regional Manager and receive the support you need to lead and manage your team.  This position will be based at our Heidelberg site. What APM can offer you?  Benefits associated with joining APM include but are not limited to, being awarded an attractive salary with uncapped performances incentives, working in a culture that promotes development and inclusion, achievable bonuses, career progression opportunities, vehicle salary sacrifice options and personal use of smart phone. APM has a national footprint – we have more than 1000 staff in over 400 different locations in all states and territories of Australia A day in the life of a Business Manager  Empower and motivate a team of Employment Consultants to meet individual and team KPI’s Develop and implement strategies to deliver on performance expectations Provide training and mentoring to your team Provide tailored employment services to a small number of jobseekers What we need from you  Experience in, or strong understanding of employment services, disability services or similar Demonstrated ability to motivate, direct and support teams Competitive approach, drive to exceed personal and professional goals Passionate, committed and ethical approach to placing people into work Excellent time management skills Proven experience in delivering on set targets and KPIs Ability to interpret data, identify actions and implement improvement strategies Forward planning ability with a keen eye for detail Resilient demeanour with a positive outlook Customer-focused approach to assisting  your team with strategies for marketing jobseekers into sustainable employment and effective post-placement support Essential requirements  Eligible to work in Australia Current driver's licence Access to a comprehensively insured vehicle for work purposes Criminal history check Working with Children Check (depending on State legislation) If you have the energy and passion for this exciting role, join us on our journey and make a positive difference! Indigenous people, people of culturally diverse backgrounds and people with disability are encouraged to apply.

job_title: BUSINESS SYSTEMS MANAGER - Industry leader in licensed merchandise!

and requirements to Leadership Team Execute implementation plan effectively to timelines and budget Successfully manage transitional phase to minimise impact and disruption to business operations processes and procedures across various Departments Ensure all EDI trading partners and B2B processes are actively and effectively working Regularly liaise and manage external ERP Software, Hardware and eCommerce providers Implement required changes to optimise efficiency and accuracy in system data Review, recommend, implement and monitor integration points and system improvements to drive accuracy, stability and efficiency Produce, manage and review internal documentation requirements for processes and staff training Ensure data integrity and accuracy around product timeline cut off points Act as project lead where required on new initiatives Skills and Experience Required: You will be an advanced Apparel 21 ERP professional with full system exposure in a multi-entity AP21 Who is Sidekicker Sidekicker is one of Australia’s most exciting home-grown startups. Launched in 2013, and backed by SEEK with 6 offices across Australia and New Zealand, Sidekicker is now Australia and New Zealand’s largest online staffing platform, using technology to radically improve how businesses hire and manage casual, temporary and contract staff. Sidekicker employs over 10,000 casual staff, or Sidekicks, seamlessly connecting them with businesses hiring staff across hospitality, events, office admin, industrial and promotions. Being a Business Development Manager at Sidekicker As a Business Development Manager you are responsible for successfully selling the Sidekicker value proposition to our target market. Working closely with the Head of Sales, your territory will be the Australian mid-market and enterprise space in the Industrial vertical.  You will be focused on acquisition; identifying, closing and implementing new business opportunities (deal size $50k - $500k). Your leads will be primarily self-sourced, Significant growth and promotion opportunities exist for the right person.   What you’ll do   Identifying business/sales opportunities and prospects and presenting solutions in a knowledgeable and professional manner   General hustle; every day will be different. You will be doing whatever it takes to help us grow and run the Sidekicker Platform in your city   Increase sales pipeline and customer base on a monthly basis above quota   Attend industry events - we want you to be well-known in your industries   Service existing customer base and generate repeat sales on a monthly basis to help achieve a collective goal    Who you are   A problem solver; You embrace challenges and stop at nothing to create solutions. Whether it be implementing short term workarounds or implementing longer-term process improvements.   Commercially astute: You can combine data, metrics and commercial acumen to make smart decisions with (often) imperfect information   You're curious: You love learning and understanding why things are done a certain way and you're not afraid to offer ideas and solutions to problems.   A natural communicator: You will be responsible for “pitching” Sidekicker to senior decision-makers, and moving deals through customer buying processes    Qualifications   A friendly, outgoing personality   3 - 5 years in a sales role, ideally in the recruitment or temping space   A passion to get into a success driven entrepreneurial startup environment.   Natural hustling instinct and the ability to communicate logically and succinctly.   Calm and focused under pressure and highly organized.   Grit: Determined, hands-on, team player for whom no task is too big or too small    What you'll love about working at SIdekicker   Highly motivated, hard-working and talented co-workers in a fun office environment   An empowered culture where you can drive and implement change   Ground floor opportunity in a fast growing, well funded, innovative startup   Friday drinks - fully stocked fridge with a spread of delicious nibbles   Flexible working arrangements   Continuing self-development assistance program   Breakfast supplied + weekly fresh fruit   Work with a fun team that's here to help you!    Apply Today!  If you are interested, please apply by submitting your CV and cover letter.
