Nearmap provides a virtual model of the real world – at a scale and detail that hasn’t been done before. We change the way people view the world, so they can profoundly change the way they work. At Nearmap, we have an appetite for high performing individuals and we are currently on the hunt for a Business Analyst/Data Architect. The Business Analyst/ Data Architect will be gathering, integrating and developing logistical and internal data models that will be deployed for modelling. The analyst will be responsible for creating and architecting internal views into operational, budgetary and external metrics to support business objectives. A bit more about the culture… At Nearmap, every opinion matters, our business model partnered with our open-door management style gives you the opportunity to make an impact. Our Nearmappers see the world differently and are intently focused on delivering the best location content in the world. Having a shared goal and a lot of fun reaching it is how our Nearmappers truly flourish at their home away from home. We're all super down-to-earth - except when we're in the sky capturing fresh imagery! The Day to Day...  Develop plans and analysis solution frameworks to solve business problems Understand and be able to build logistics and spatial models Clearly define the assumptions, requirements, expectations and end results Architect and deploy data stores and views Act as technical point of contact and data acquisition lead while being able to communicate requirements Acquire accurate and sufficient data from resources, internal and external required to solve the business problem Perform data gap analysis and recommend additional sources of data Enhance understanding of business data with operational and statistical analysis of data Develop advanced statistical models that highlight meaningful business drivers Employ data mining techniques to discover unknown process dependencies Analyse unstructured data (e.g. text) to further understand customer content usage and process dependencies Validate existing and develop new business hypotheses via a broad spectrum of data science techniques Convey meaningful insights via effective display of data analysis outcomes Leverage existing tools to allow us to explore data in new ways Able to present and communicate the technical results to non-technical and other internal stakeholders using presentation tools e.g. PowerPoint etc. Complies with responsibilities of working for a public company. Complies with all local legislative requirements. Adheres to company guidelines and the corporate Code of Conduct. Where appropriate keeps up to date with legislative requirements. Acts in an ethical way when dealing with company assets and other people. What We’re Looking for…  2-4 years relevant industry experience, focusing on advanced analytics focused programming and scripting Preferred experience with spatial data, logistics, commodities, stakeholder interaction and management Business and Data Analysis Data Mining: e.g. Decision trees, Burndowns, Dimension reduction (FA, PCA, …) etc. Statistics techniques: e.g. Clustering, Regression, Discriminant analysis, SEM etc. Geospatial Data: PostGres/ Postgis/ SQL spatial statistics and related tools – FME ESRI Familiarity with a broad base of analytics tools & languages: - Data management: e.g. SQL, PostgreSQL, RedShift, etc. - Data visualization: e.g. Looker, Tableau, RShiny, Grafana etc. - Optimization: Open Solver Text mining & unstructured data analytics - Programming and/or scripting experience a plus: e.g. Python, C#, Perl, SQL - Application development a plus (VBA, .net, Java) - Web app development a plus (ASP, .net, Javascript) - D3 libraries a plus Excellent written, visual and verbal presentation skills A team player, someone who values a great team culture Analytical Undergraduate degree in a field linked to statistics, data mining, applied mathematics, business analytics, engineering, computing or related field Why you’ll want to work at Nearmap…  We have an inclusive and high-performing culture here! Ask us about our values: Work It. Love It. Tell It. Risk It. Own It. Competitive pay Flexible working environment, work life balance is a necessity.   Opportunities for continued career growth and development. Ergonomic workstations with sit stand desks. Fortnightly massages. Free healthy breakfast, snacks & lunches available in our kitchen with water views. An allowance to help you focus on your well-being.  If you think you tick all the boxes and could see yourself working at Nearmap, we invite you to come and make a difference! Check out our video below to see what a day in the life at Nearmap looks like!

advertiser: Pettit Pharma & Device Search Pty Ltd
job_description: THE COMPANY YOU WOULD BE JOINING  This organisation is a global medical device & technology company that develops and markets surgical products and services. Their products allow their customers to deliver high quality care to deliver enhanced clinical outcomes for their patients. Their broad portfolio focuses on the needs and wants of specific medical specialties to offer their customers the power of choice and convenience.  THE BENEFITS  This company is committed to the growth and development of its employees. The tenure of their employees is long as they are very happy with this high-performance culture and the opportunities that are available to them. Be nurtured and empowered and have a voice. Strong diversity and inclusion practices. Do you want to join a passionate and collaborative culture that makes a difference to patients’ lives?  WHAT YOU WILL LEAD AND GROW  This position acts as the manager and lead resource for; Pricing Control Contract Management Salesforce.com Tenders, pricing and submissions (liaising with the Business Unit Director and Business Development Manager). Leadership of day to day management of Salesforce.com including daily sales update loads, control of the pricing matrix and delivery of metric led dashboard reporting to the ANZ business. Management of the Australian business’ customer price lists including ensuring that all price SKUs held within the business’ ERP have been signed off in compliance with requirements. Management and control of the tender offer process for all product lines to all Australian state public health bodies. Development of ad hoc sales reporting as required using sales cube, Salesforce.com or other relevant systems. This position will manage 1 – 2 direct reports.  WHAT QUALS, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS WILL YOU NEED TO GET THE JOB?  5+ years’ work experience in a commercial/business analyst role within a commercial/contract management function. Advanced Excel skills. Oracle ERP including sales cube reporting. Sales and/or marketing field background. Experience with Salesforce.com or similar CRM. Proven experience of commercial negotiations within private and/or public health industry space. Elementary understanding of US GAAP and SOX compliance processes. Medical technology, FMCG or other high-volume sales environment experience. Staff management experience.  Interested? Please 'apply now' or call Scott Della-Pietra on 02.9817.0599, quoting reference number 2752. Please note, your details/resume will not be sent anywhere without a formal interview and, if successful, your subsequent prior permission. Personal information provided will be used for recruitment purposes only and be treated in the strictest confidence. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

As part of an overall ICT and Digital Strategy, our government client is transforming their technology landscape. The role enables a mature environment for mentoring and knowledge sharing. Working in the high-profile government space can facilitate long-standing relationships to ensure a constant stream of dynamic opportunities for the successful individual.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst - Clinical Systems / Healthcare industry
job_description: This highly rewarding career opportunity is available for an experienced Senior Business Analyst to play an important role for a new systems upgrade and implementation project that will be transformational for the organisation embarking on a significant period of business change along with modernisation to their core IT systems.    As the Business Analyst on this new high visibility project, you will be involved in the day to day functions of gathering, capturing and identifying key business requirements as well as technical system requirements for both “existing” and “future state” systems analysis, data mapping, stakeholder management, change management, process improvement, bespoke reporting tasks, developing systems wire-frames and diagrams, and supporting new implementations and project initiatives.    Prior experience working with Laboratory Information Systems (LIS) and Pathology would propel your success in this role, or other domain experience and knowledge working within Health care and medical industries will also strongly support your overall success and impact.    Responsibilities include:  Gain a sound understanding of business practices, processes and systems by liaising with users and stakeholders from all levels to enable successful partnership of the new LIS system delivery. Creation of user stories, gap analysis and process mapping documentation, diagrams and wireframes. Stakeholder and external vendor management. Supporting the traceability of business requirements from the initial design, through to the build and testing stages. Determine and develop the technical and the non-functional requirements, and then develop systems integrations diagrams and workflows for future state architecture. Work across multiple business steams to determine and drive the best approach to achieve the desired outcomes from a Business Analysis task perspective. Provide ongoing BA support to the project team (PMO) for ongoing arising needs and project requirements, along with supporting business SME’s and stakeholders. Identifying of continuous improvement within your areas of responsibility.  Skills & Experience required for this position:  A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Business domains or I.T 5 + Years Business Analysis experience covering gap analysis, “As Is” - “To Be”, process mapping / improvement, systems analysis, impact analysis, stakeholder / vendor management, workshop facilitation etc.. Industry experience working within the Health Care and Medical domains. Exceptional presentation skills in line with working in Enterprise level corporate environments. Experience working with VISIO and JIRA.  Experience working with Microsoft Office products. High level communication, negotiation and influencing skills with the ability to forge strong working relationships with colleagues, stakeholders and senior management and Executives. Business Analysis certifications such as BABOK will be an added advantage. Previous or current experience and knowledge working with Pathology or LIS Systems will be highly regarded.   Please feel free to contact Matt Moran if you’re keen to have a chat and learn more about this rewarding career opportunity on (02) 9199 5602 or matthew.moran@alcami.com

Working for AMP 
Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration and promotes innovation.  It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities for professional growth. We’re flexible enough to allow you to make the most of your life, both professionally and personally.
We are looking for those that have the courage and agility to navigate changing and complex environments so that we can deliver the best solutions for our customers. We value people with integrity, an innate willingness to help others and an eagerness to perform to the best of their abilities. 
About the role
The purpose of the role is to provide systems support for existing processes and to develop new reporting functions within the Group Treasury unit to ensure compliance and meet business needs.  The team is currently undertaking a significant project to upgrade existing treasury systems.  This role is required to support business as usual activities as well as being involved with the design of new systems.
Group Treasury activities include front office (dealing), securitisation, middle and back office (settlement and reporting).  Group Treasury is responsible for managing the liquid asset portfolio of AMP Bank, short and long-term wholesale funding including the residential mortgage backed securitisation programme, managing market risk and capital management.
Main focus areas 

Design and implement treasury middle office reports
Maintain reporting databases across Treasury
Monitor system performance and resolve issues
Assist in Treasury systems upgrade project and implementation
Assist in regulatory reporting
Input into Group Treasury policies and procedures
Production of management information and internal reports on a monthly basis or when required.
Assist with regulatory reporting:

Experience required 

Advanced Knoeldge of VBA , SQL and Treasury Systems
Advanced Excel and Access
Understanding of debt capital markets , FX , interest rates and derivatives

 Wellbeing & Benefits 
As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.
Inclusion & Diversity
AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP.

Become part of a team that is devoted to making the world a mentally healthier place Design, implement and manage systems to enable collection, analysis and reporting of data to determine outcomes for multiple large-scale implementation studies Full-time contract for 2 years About the Institute: The Black Dog Institute is a Medical Research Institute and a global leader in translational mental health research. We harness the latest technology and other tools to quickly turn our world-class research findings into clinical services, education and e-health products that improve the lives of people with mental illness and the wider community.  We pride ourselves on translating our own world leading Workplace Mental Health research into an award-winning culture that encompasses a holistic view of wellbeing. We aim to create a positive, mentally healthy workplace that recognises the importance of meaningful work, balanced lifestyles, psychological well-being and continual learning whilst being guided by our core values - Collaboration, Compassion, Excellence, Innovation and Respect. We offer:   Competitive salaries Salary packaging Commitment to Learning and Development Flexible working hours and work-life balance Generous parental leave policy Pet friendly office Social and team events About the Role: The Research Data Manager will be responsible for creating unified study databases combining data from existing, ongoing data collections managed by internal and external project partners and establishing a reporting platform allowing for routine access by project investigators, and visualisation of research outcomes for a range of audiences. The position works collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams across Discovery, Innovation and Corporate Services. It will require an understanding of the research environment, along with core expertise in data management, including data security, data governance and in the development of data protocols and procedures. Key responsibilities: Develop the data plan for research studies, including recommendations for technologies, formats, operating models and decisioning platforms. Develop protocols, processes and dictionaries to support data management and access across studies, considering data security, data governance and broader research ethics requirements. Manage the collection and integration of data from a range of data providers, including setting up and implementing systems and procedures for quality assurance (quality control, data checking and cleaning large datasets), as well as data extraction for analysis. Manage the study databases to enable researchers to generate insights into study progress and recommendations for improvements to study data collection procedures. Ensure that database development and management will integrate with ongoing data collection processes. Internal and external liaison, consultation and knowledge exchange with stakeholders including data custodians. Provide accurate and timely data to support research reporting as requested and contribute to the dissemination of results. Develop database systems and architecture using specialised fit-for-purpose software such as SAS. Selection Criteria: Essential:  Tertiary qualification in information technology, health information management or a relevant scientific discipline. Demonstrated experience in establishing and managing SQL-Server based database systems for large-scale health projects. Demonstrated experience in SAS or similar software for data management, analysis and reporting. Demonstrated experience in quality control, data checking and cleaning of large-scale datasets, including data manipulation and extraction. Experience in the development of documented data management plans and data governance processes.   Demonstrated ability to manage a variety of internal and external stakeholders, using excellent consultation and negotiation skills to produce positive project outcomes. Demonstrated ability to manage large projects to time and on budget. Proven ability to work flexibly and adapt as necessary to the demands of multiple projects. Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills, with an outstanding level of attention to detail. A knowledge of EEO principles and WH&S responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant WH&S training. Desirable:  Experience in data management for health research. Experience in mental health research highly desirable. Experience of working within a research ethics governance framework. Proven experience with linkage of health service data. Proven experience with visual analytics tools, e.g. SAS. Previous experience working in the not-for-profit sector. To apply: If you’re interested or want to find out more, we’d love to hear from you. Drop us a line at recruitment@blackdog.org.au, using the subject line: Research Data Manager with your CV and cover letter addressing the selection criteria.   Applications close: 15 May 2019 The Black Dog Institute is an EEO Employer. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.  Download the position description: https://www.blackdoginstitute.org.au/docs/default-source/job-position-descriptions/research-data-manager-position-description-final-march-2019.pdf?sfvrsn=0

AMCS Group is a global leader in business operational optimisation software and vehicle technology for the recycling and waste management industry. AMCS’ software is managing over €3bn worth of transactions annually, over 14,000 vehicles and in excess of 3,000 sites. Employing over 500 people, we have operations in Ireland, UK, Denmark, Netherlands, Sweden, US, Australia and New Zealand. To support the continued growth of the business, we currently have a requirement for a Business Analyst within the ANZ/Asia Region. We are actively seeking an experienced Business Analyst who could work collaboratively with ANZ/Global technical delivery teams to successfully deliver projects in Australia and internationally within the region. This role will report into the Head of Services & Delivery ANZ.  Our ideal candidate is a team player who is enthusiastic about delivering complex business solutions, comfortable challenging the status-quo with a constant appetite for new knowledge and skill accumulation. Requirements & Responsibilities: ·      Showcase and foster AMCS core values - Innovation, Dedication and Loyalty. ·      Strong requirements gathering and workshop facilitation skills. ·      Communicate effectively with internal/customer stakeholders across geographies at all levels. ·      Ability to organise and conduct effective meetings internally and customer environments. ·      High energy work ethic with a never say die attitude. ·      Effective written and verbal communication skills, including ability to influence and negotiate. ·      Ability to run product demos to the customer. ·      Comfortable working actively towards achieving personal KPIs based on billability and revenue targets. ·      Prior technical experience as a developer or a DBA would certainly come in handy. ·      Be expected to work with product and industry subject matter experts in order to understand, propose, educate and help implement new business processes. ·      Understand customers' needs, determine solutions to meet those needs, and document these solutions in the form of user stories, use cases and technical specifications that can be implemented by the delivery team. ·      Develop and recommend solutions and strategies, based on the analysis of customer business goals, objectives, and needs. ·      Carryout scope verification and Internal Acceptance Testing (IAT) which includes developing test cases and test strategy documentation.  Good grasp of solutions modelling through UML and a broad toolkit of analysis methods/artefacts. ·      Work closely with the implementation, development, product, DevOps and VTech teams to address questions and provide clarification on requirements during delivery of projects. ·      Prepare detailed Requirement Specification documentation with use cases, presentations, and other documents to explain requirements internally and externally. ·      Ensure all reported data and information are accurate, consistent, relevant and timely. ·      Elicit, evaluate, prioritise, analyse, and document client's business needs and requirements. ·      Excellent analysis and problem-solving skills.  This role would primarily be based in Sydney with occasional work duties from customer offices locally and overseas as the need arises. Occasional Interstate / international travel might be required at a short notice. Qualifications, Experience, Knowledge and Skills: ·           3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst ·           5+ years of experience in the software industry, preferably working for CRM or ERP vendors. ·           Degree in computer science or related field is strongly desired. ·           Industry-recognised qualification such as IIBA-CCBA or CBAP or other equivalent would be beneficial. ·           Experience in MS office and Visio or similar tools. ·           Understanding of IT infrastructure and enterprise solution concepts.

NSW Government Consulting opportunity - Manager
Data Engineer / Data Analyst /Information Management 
Flexible working options available

KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.
You will work in a rapidly growing part of KPMG’s Management Consulting Practice with projects that span multiple locations and industry sectors.
Our highly skilled Data & Analytics team helps our clients to use their data resources for creating value, enhancing competitiveness and driving business decisions. Within Data & Analytics we provide unique services through delivering consulting projects, custom analytics work, proofs of concept, fantastic face to face and on-line trainings and accreditations for our brightest minds around data and advanced analytics.
Your new role
Our team is seeking a range of data analytics specialists to support our ambitious growth strategy. Working in our team you'll be mixing with some of the brightest minds while working on significant government projects – solving real world problems with NSW Government, using some of the most exciting and interesting data you wouldn’t normally have access to.You’ll be working collaboratively within a team environment and building strong client relationships.
Joining our team you’ll be working across projects that are applying data solutions to solve client problems using some of the below:

Building solutions using technologies like Java, Python, Node.js, NoSQL databases – leveraging Big Data platforms like Hadoop, Spark on Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure. 
Use Data Analytics tools such as SQL, Python, SSIS and visualisation tools
Developing innovative web and mobile applications using HTML5, CSS and JavaScript (D3, jQuery, Bootstrap and React).
Data strategy assessment, strategy development and stakeholder socialisation and acceptance
Data platform assessment, solution strategy and delivery
Define and deliver enterprise information management frameworks that address data lineage, data dictionaries, data ownership, data sensitivity, data privileges and accessibility. 

You bring to the role
We are open to candidates of all skill levels and experience. You will describe yourself as one of the below roles and bring relevant experience in your chosen area:

Data Engineer: Engineering modern data solutions or pipelines to facilitate advanced analytics, visualisation & interactive data applications
Data Analyst: Analysing and business consulting with data – using relational databases (SQL), data workbench & visualisation tools for project delivery, applying business logic and interpreting results
Information Management: You might focus on technical IM or be have more experience in traditional data governance and data strategy or platform assessment

You’ll demonstrate your experience in within a Government sector, either through in-house or consulting experience.  You’ll need to bring an ability to work collaboratively within a team environment and to build strong client relationships. We're looking for talented people, team players and progressive thinkers who can communicate their ideas convincingly.
You will:● Have a questioning mind and lots of bright ideas● Be a critical thinker with strong analytical and problem solving skills● Be comfortable with manipulating and combining large, high dimensional datasets from multiple sources● Have an ability to interpret findings and identify key insights to communicate to a non-technical audience● Have demonstrated experience building relationships with internal and/or external clients● Be passionate about delivering high quality work
What we offer you
We offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. We also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues; and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.
We believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.
This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of KPMG and its ongoing success. So if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results, talk to us first.

We’re looking for an experienced Business Readiness and Change Analyst to join our Deployment team within the Ventia Technology Enablement Program (TEP). Reporting to the Project Manager, you will be responsible for conducting the change readiness assessment and working with the business to ensure all steps for change adoption are taken in readiness for the TEP solution.
About the role
 Working as part of a Deployment Team, and engaging within the TEP change community, you will be responsible for:

Working with local leadership to build engagement and support them in driving the required changes
Undertaking change readiness and planning activities within assigned deployment units and making use of the Ventia change methodology framework and connecting across the TEP change network; including the management of key elements of the Business Readiness Action Plan to meet the delivery timelines
Developing change strategies and adoption plans to streamline readiness activities and facilitate improved acceptance and uptake of enterprise systems
Identifying change management risks and escalate issue through agreed channels within the deployment team
Engaging with external stakeholders, personally or through business leadership ie Clients, subcontractors, Vendors, other service providers

 [link removed]This project opportunity is for a period of up to two years fixed-term.
About you
To be successful in your application your experience will ideally include:

5years’ experience in organisational change management across large or complex environments
Demonstrated contributions to change projects that have directly impacted the business’ ways of working

About us

Your team enables Wealth Management Advice to achieve their strategic objectives through planning, prioritising, delivering and supporting projects and initiatives.Your team’s success will be realised through partnering with business and IT teams across both WM Advice and Enterprise Services
Role: The Technical Business Analyst role is responsible for eliciting and capturing the technical business requirements and ensure the solution meets the desired technical standards. This role provides the glue that holds the technical aspects of the program/project together while advising on technical decisions and innovation
Responsibilities:

Works with Business Analyst to evaluate the technical options and decide the best way to turn the high-level business requirements into a technical solution
Analyses business strategies to understand the way XPLAN can be optimised
Gather information from business stakeholders on business processes and transform into functional specifications
Lead development of business cases and business improvement initiatives, work closely with stakeholders to identify impacts to business processes as a result of XPLAN changes
Produce specifications and documentation to support implementing and managing changes in XPLAN.
Ensures XPLAN solutions are aligned with the Group’s enterprise architecture
Work with other technical roles such as developers, testers and other technology partners to design and optimise solutions
Analyse and capture technical processes and requirements using analysis methodologies and tools
Identify technical delivery issues and risks, assists with mitigation strategies, and escalates where necessary
Identify and manages gaps, determining the effectiveness of proposed solutions and developing business requirements documents.
Participate in testing and deployment of the prioritised business requirements and solutions
  Troubleshoot deployment and/or environment issues at all levels of complexity
Facilitate training workshops and creation/maintenance of functional documentation

Experience
Essential:

XPLAN skills – e.g. XPLAN templating, workflows, systems settings
2-5 years technical analysis, requirements gathering, modelling and process improvement experience
Software, systems and solution delivery lifecycle experience
Understanding of BABOK® Knowledge Areas              
Financial Services Industry Experience
Experience working in business / technology enabled change programs/projects
Understanding of delivery frameworks at enterprise level

 Desirable:

Knowledge of project management methodologies and agile principles highly regarded
Relevant IT or business tertiary qualifications
Recognised industry certifications
DFP/RG146 qualified

At CommBank we provide a range of benefits including competitive pay, an employee share plan, child care centres and even access to our not-for-profit private health insurance. We also get that people have lives outside of work and try to support you in the best possible way; whether that's looking at job sharing or multiple flexible working arrangements or even leave options to help you juggle your work and personal circumstances. We believe that investing in our people is the key to our ongoing success.

Implementation Analyst
Do work that matters:
As an Implementation Analyst the major responsibility of this role will be to administer the systems enhancements required by CFS Operations. You will be tasked with continually improving CFS Operations’ core processes – making the complex simple and providing innovative services.
See yourself in the team:
This role is with Colonial First State (CFS), specifically the enhancements &incidents team.
The Enhancements & Incidents team is responsible for managing the end-to-end process for any System Work Requests (SWRs) and Technical Work Requests (TWRs), as well as contributing to larger IT projects that impact CFS Operations.
We will investigate impacted systems and processes; conduct analysis; gather requirements; and contribute to the development and implementation of robust solutions that ensure the current and future needs of CFS Operations, and the broader CFS business, are met.
We do this by:

Taking ownership of initial and ongoing stakeholder management,
Producing and maintaining supporting documentation (e.g. SWR forms, technical documents, etc),
Producing accurate return on investment (ROI) or benefit calculations to justify the enhancements,
Preparing SWR (Change Impact Assessment, Change on a Page, etc) documents and rolling this out to the training leaders,
Conducting ongoing consultation with IT analysts on solution design,
Providing CFS Operations sign off for subsequent designed solutions and test plan,
Providing business support by end to end change and project management of the changes,
Preparing production test plans,
Supporting implementation and production testing,
Providing post implementation release support,
Organising widespread communications detailing system enhancement and operations impacts
Providing the business with on-the-ground troubleshooting and support.
Effectively facilitating meetings and workshops
Continuously improve SE&I team’s service to our business through simplicity, consistency, efficiency and reliability services.

Your path looks like:
If you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great opportunities. Whether you want to move across the organisation or up into a leadership role, the way you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities are key. Use the capabilities required for this role as a guide to the critical skills and behaviours you need for your next move.
We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:

Preferred 2 to 3 years’ experience in working as change analyst, business analyst or similar roles.
Ability to prioritise and address multiple conflicting requirements
Strong stakeholder’s management including working with different CBA teams and suppliers.
Demonstrated initiative and has strong leadership and interpersonal skills
Excellent customer service
Eye for detail and willingness to tackle issues beyond ‘own’ role as required
Ability to identify problems and help provide creative solutions
Ability to work within deadlines
Strong working knowledge of work-flow and imaging systems
A sound understanding of project delivery framework processes and/or Agile methodology

At CommBank, we're committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce reflecting the customers, businesses and communities we serve. As a value's driven organisation, we nurture and support our people; through focussing on skill and talent development, collaboration, flexibility and internal promotion. With service in mind at every touch point, we take accountability for the role we play in securing and enhancing the financial wellbeing of people, businesses and communities. At CommBank you can be you.

Become part of a team that is devoted to making the world a mentally healthier place Provide business analyst skills to deliver and improve StepCare, a mental health digital solution designed for adults with anxiety and depression, and implement the long-term road map for the StepCare information system Full-time position for a two year contract About the Institute: The Black Dog Institute is a Medical Research Institute and a global leader in translational mental health research. We harness the latest technology and other tools to quickly turn our world-class research findings into clinical services, education and e-health products that improve the lives of people with mental illness and the wider community.  We pride ourselves on translating our own world leading Workplace Mental Health research into an award-winning culture that encompasses a holistic view of wellbeing. We aim to create a positive, mentally healthy workplace that recognises the importance of meaningful work, balanced lifestyles, psychological well-being and continual learning whilst being guided by our core values - Collaboration, Compassion, Excellence, Innovation and Respect. We offer:   Competitive salaries Salary packaging Commitment to Learning and Development Flexible working hours and work-life balance Generous parental leave policy Pet friendly office Social and team events About the Role: The purpose of this position is to provide business analysis skills within a cross-functional team tasked with delivering and improving the Stepcare Service and implementing the long -term road map for the StepCare information system. The StepCare Service developed by the Black Dog Institute is an innovative stepped-care service implemented in general practice via the Black Dog Institute’s digital platform, for adults with depression and/or anxiety. Core capabilities are business analysis, knowledge of .NET development, knowledge of the Australian health care environment, detailed knowledge of the technological environment of general practice in Australia, knowledge of and experience with e-health tools, general technology skills and communications skills (written and aural). Your responsibilities: Work with Stepcare team to understand and improve the Stepcare system. Liaise between the StepCare team and the IT team to effectively interpret business requirements and technical specifications Work within established governance structures to deliver the appropriate monitoring, risk management, decision-making, and assurance that all relevant internal and external stakeholders are involved and appropriate signoffs are achieved. Scope and document new feature requirements for the Stepcare system Document and outline options and solutions with internal and external stakeholders Define and document business requirements and report these to key stakeholders Construct workflow diagrams and specifications Work with the IT team to ensure successful implementation of new feature requirements for Stepcare, ensuring that the architecture is successfully implemented and transitioned to technical design, build, test and production. Provide recommendations on improving the system and operational processes. Provide accurate and timely reports on activities as requested and contribute to the dissemination of information to stakeholders Selection Criteria: Essential  Tertiary qualifications, preferably with a Business or technology degree (or equivalent). At least five years' business analyst experience. Hands-on experience in analysing new digital technology service implementation, evaluation and benefit measurement. High level specialised knowledge and experience across all technology disciplines (including infrastructure, application development, security and data management). Strong communication skills (written and oral) including strong documentation skills. Experience in documenting business requirements, technical change requests and specifications Experience with delivery of web-based solutions. Excellent organisation and time-management skills, including the ability to plan and prioritise project workload. Experience in building and maintaining effective working relationships with multiple stakeholders. Proven initiative, analytical and problem-solving skills. Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to positively influence outcomes, develop and maintain productive working relationships and resolve conflict Commitment to high standards, particularly in regard to patient privacy and information security. Ability to deliver and meet deadlines Willingness and capacity to implement required OHS policies and safe work practice. Desirable  Experience in digital health delivery Experience working within the health sector particularly with GPs and Primary Health Networks (PHNs). Business analysis experience in a non-profit entity. What makes Holocentric exciting?  Working in the R&D team at Holocentric isn't a regular software job. It's kind of like comparing fast food preparation with being a chef. Building a product isn't just about the technology and writing software. It's about the impact on other people's lives. What we create makes a big difference to our customers, the way they work and people they interact with, be it keeping aircraft safe and in the sky, trains running, drinking water flowing, food being prepared in accordance with the strict regulations, or even helping to keep our country safe, our software is part of this. We have a great team of people who have done some great software work over the years, including scripting and runtime engines, diagramming frameworks and metadata-based repositories. Needless to say, we're a diverse bunch who love doing interesting things. What we're missing now is you. As the Technical Business Analyst, you will work within the Design team to define product requirements to ensure the Development team and QA team understand what needs to be built. Responsibilities include:  Work with Software Owner, Product Owners, and Development team to understand and refine requirements for sprint. Analyse functional requirements, perform impact analysis and gap analysis, and identify related business rules. Assist with writing user story and acceptance criteria to be reviewed prior to sprint commencement, using relevant modelling and other tools. Maintain functional requirements and business rules are update-to-date as needed. Collaborate with Design and Development team members to understand key UX and technical details; identify the gaps in the respective developed specifications. Clarify inquiries of user story and acceptance criteria from QA team. Assist with the provision of technical documentation and training material. Key Requirements  3+ years of technical business analysis experience in an Agile environment. Strong analytical skills with demonstrated experience with using multiple requirement analysis techniques. Demonstrated knowledge and experience with modelling using UML. Proven experience working with internal and external stakeholders. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Experience using JIRA and modelling tools. Understanding of microservices, RESTful APIs and UI Frameworks (desirable). Prior development experience (desirable). Tertiary education in relevant field (Engineering or Technical discipline). WHY HOLOCENTRIC? We are committed to building excellence and work hard to provide a workplace that encourages and supports our people. We have a highly collaborative and social team environment with open offices, Friday drinks, offsite company kick-offs and team building activities. We offer a range of opportunities for career and professional development plus a real ability to help shape our product future. We also have a share options scheme so you can participate in the success of our business. We don’t believe in fixing people in rigid positions, but rather seek to match interest and capability. If you like a challenge, want to deliver exceptional results and seek to reach your potential, we’d like to hear from you! DO YOU WANT TO BE PART OF SOMETHING BIG? So by now you would have realised that we aren't your average software company. We have big dreams for our business and our people. You wouldn't want to be the one who missed their opportunity to be part of a company that is on its way to becoming a leading Australian software company. If you want to make a difference and be part of a team that takes pride in helping other organisations improve their business performance, then please apply with your resume and covering letter to jobs@holocentric.com, telling us why you would like to join us.

job_title: Business Analyst SSI and Integrated Care
job_description: Employment Type: Temporary Full Time until 16 May 2021Position Classification: Health Manager Level 3Remuneration: $2126.56 - $2424.29Hours Per Week: 38Requisition ID: REQ104580Where you'll be working Northern Sydney’s vision is to be "leaders in healthcare, partners in community wellbeing". Our purpose is “embracing discovery and learning, building partnerships and engaging our community to deliver excellent health and wellbeing.”    We build teams and health services that embrace our values; Collaboration, Openness, Respect and Empowerment (CORE). Our CORE values and the behaviours that underpin them, shape the way we work together, with our patients and consumers, to deliver excellent health and wellbeing. If you’d like to be part of our journey we want to hear from you.  NSLHD is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity, Workforce Health and Safety, Ethical Practices and the principles of Cultural Diversity. Aboriginal people are encouraged to apply and, where found suitable, will be given higher priority. What you'll be doingThe Business and Data Analyst position will support priority improvement and transformation programs, including Local Health District (LHD) surgery performance, Ambulatory Care improvement, and System Integration. Analysis tasks will include identifying opportunities for improvement, modelling the impact of different interventions, and comparing cost-benefits of proposed solutions.       The position will work within the Strategy and Services Integration Team (SSI), supporting different LHD projects as required. The position holder is expected to operate with minimal supervision, demonstrating leadership and sound judgment in managing allocated projects. They will be required to consult with clinical, operational and project stakeholders from across Northern Sydney Local Health District (NSLHD), as well as externally with primary care stakeholders.     The Business &Data Analyst position will provide complex analysis, interpretation of data, development of data tools and communication of data findings. It is essential for the position holder to have advanced data analysis and visualisation skills in Excel, and beneficial to have experience using other data tools such as Qlikview and Tableau. The interview process will include a practical test involving the manipulation and presentation of data in Excel.    Employees must abide by the NSW Health Code of Conduct. Criminal record checks will be undertaken on successful applicants and applicants for positions designated as Category A will be required to obtain required vaccinations prior to commencing employment.     Candidates will need to meet the following criteria:  Consistently demonstrates behaviours that reinforce the CORE Values of our organisation; Collaboration, Openness, Respect and Empowerment. Demonstrates these behaviours with all stakeholders; colleagues, direct reports, as well as our patients and consumers, and those that care for them.Tertiary qualifications relevant to data analysis, such as Business Intelligence, Statistics or Data Analytics and/or extensive experience and a record of achievement in performance analysis and reporting in a large diverse organisation.Demonstrated superior analytical skills to understand complex service delivery and business processes and translate these into an analysis plan to help inform new processes and achieve business focused solutions.Demonstrated advanced Excel skills for the analysis and visualisation of complex datasets, and experience using other data visualisation tools such as Qlikview, Qliksense or Tableau.Demonstrated capacity to assess and maintain data integrity, and ensure the confidentiality of individual records in accordance with legislative requirements.Excellent organisational skills and experience working in a demanding professional environment with a capacity to prioritise, multi-task, achieve business goals and always work with a customer focused approach. Demonstrated experience in working to routine deadlines and / or working within a project environment.Well-developed communication, interpersonal, influencing and negotiation skills. Experience of doing this in a health setting is desirable but not essential.  Need more information?   1) Click here for the Position Description   2) Find out more about applying for this position For role related queries or questions contact Martyn Brookes on Martyn.Brookes@health.nsw.gov.auApplications Close: 14 May 2019

Sydney CBD
icare is currently seeking a Manager, Business Analytics to lead the business intelligence, and insights capability for Personal Injury

Define and implement the Personal Injury business intelligence future state
Newly created role, Permanent opportunity
Attractive remuneration package

We’re looking for someone to lead the Personal Injury business data and analytics team and develop and implement the Personal Injury business data and analytics strategy.
You’ll be working with a diverse mix of proactive, forward-thinking and courageous people who really care about making a difference for people and the NSW community. You will have a mind for getting things done and a heart for people and you will set the bar high through the quality of the work you do and the people-oriented decisions you make.
You will be a hands-on Data Analyst with a background in the insurance industry. You’ll bring your experience in leading teams to deliver reporting, insights and business intelligence along with relevant experience in business analysis, reporting and analytics, including BI tools such as Qlik Sense software and SaaS.
It’s an exciting environment where no two days are the same. But on a typical day you might find yourself:

building relationships collaboratively across Personal Injury to develop and support business data needs
managing and co-ordinating data integrity and business system improvement projects to ensure milestones and reporting requirements are met
managing performance management processes to monitor performance of the scheme and work with relevant stakeholders
identifying initiatives that address and improve performance in line with Personal Injury strategic objectives
contributing to the data quality and master data management plan to ensure that it accommodates the future state as identified by the business.

We’re a new kind of organisation, one that’s as supportive and socially conscious as it is agile and explorative. Our DNA of commercial mind and social heart captures who we are at our core.
If you think you’re the right person for this role, send us your resume (up to 5 pages). Don’t delay as we’re assessing applications as they are received. We’d love to hear how your capabilities, achievements and experience set you apart.
We know our strength comes from the diversity of our people and so we want people with different experiences and backgrounds to apply. We recognise the importance of balance and flexibility and understand that it’s not a one size fits all approach, so we’d be happy to talk about and consider your specific needs.
If there are any accessibility adjustments you need to help you be able to apply for this role, or if you require any further information about the role, please contact Ben Duffield on (02) 9216 3751 for a chat.
Please note that you must be an Australian citizen or a permanent resident of Australia or a New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand passport to apply for this role.

icare is the brand of Insurance & Care NSW
For more information about icare visit our website
icare operates a direct sourcing model so no agency introductions will be accepted

job_title: Product Manager - BDM / Sales - Data Centre
job_description: Product Manager – BDM – Data Centre   The purpose of the role is to proactively grow our client Data Centre business and to penetrate customer accounts at senior management / executive levels to influence business decisions related to the selling of Cisco Data Centre products.  Duties and responsibilities   Own and deploy Data Center GO-TO-MARKET Business Plan Proactively drive Cisco Data Centre Business to increase revenue and market share Identify and segment partners aligned to the plan Create Partner DC business plans Acquire in depth knowledge of Cisco Data Centre products (via online training resources and Product Management team) Work with customers and Internal Account Managers to identify new opportunities for Cisco Data Centre portfolio Create and deliver a growth strategy for the Data Centre Solution both through Account Mining and Business Development Manage segment growth through Channel Partners and create and deliver effective Engagement programs Keep a close tab on the market intelligence around the Data Centre industry and explore innovative growth, business development and partner engagement avenues Work with the resellers and aid and promote the Sales Skills and Specifications   Strong experience of selling Data Centre Solutions directly to the end customers/ through resellers Successful track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets Proven experience of selling Data Centre solutions/ Servers/ Storage/ Virtualisation Relevant Tertiary qualification / Certification Strong interpersonal and client engagement skills Exceptional presentation and Communication skills  To grab this opportunity, Apply here or write me at mcohen@charterhouse.com.au

The companyAn Australian owned company who are operating in the market for over a century. They specialise working on large scale projects anything in excess of $50M. They have worked on projects such as hospitals, schools, data centers, residential, commercial and retail. They pride themselves on having a flat management structure so everyone within the business has a clear view of how their career plan looks like.  They promote from within as they believe in rewarding their employees from the hard work they put in. The roleYou will sit within the Date Centers team as a Services Manager. You will design coordinate, install and maintain services as well as commissioning through to hand over. What you need for this roleYou will be expected to have worked in a previous Services Manager role with a head contractor here in Australia. Experience working on data centers is essential.Strong technical working knowledge of both Mechanical and Electrical. Must have working rights here in Australia as our client does not offer sponsorship.What to do nowIf you are interested in the role, please send an updated CV to Lynn.Cunningham@acrworld.com or call 0280790933 to hear more.

job_title: Senior Manager, Risk Data Management Governance
job_description:
Do work that matters
Working with the Executive Manager Risk Data Solutions, you will play a strategic role in operationalising accountabilities for data risk in alignment to the group’s data strategy. You will do this through building engagement with the Risk Management data community to embed data quality practices as well as providing advice on requirements for adherence to these data practices.
See yourself in our team 
Risk Strategy and Optimisation forms part of the Group Risk Management function supporting the Group Chief Risk Officer (GCRO) and Business Unit Chief Risk Officers execute the outcomes of Risk in the most effective way for the organisation.
The team will provide strategic guidance to the EGM Risk Strategy and Optimisation, Group CRO and the Risk Management Leadership Team, providing advice, governance and oversight that drives a data management culture.
On any given day you will

Assist Risk Management teams with the prioritisation of their data management activities, including providing education, advice and guidance on compliance
Establish and manage Data Management practices across Risk Management, ensuring consistent application of policies and standards, by developing and implementing procedures to support the group data management practices
Monitor Risk management compliance with Group policy and standards, guiding development of data dictionaries and taxonomies
Measure and Monitor implementation and adherence to Group Data Management Framework. tracking and reporting performance indicators of data quality and progress of implementation framework
Delivery evidencing of controls and processes that attest to the quality of data in adherence to the risk management strategy

Your path looks like 
If you live and breathe the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great opportunities both within Risk Strategy & Optimisation and beyond the wider CBA group. We’ll help you find the next step that’s right for you and enable you to be your best.
We’re interested in hearing from people who:

Are degree qualified in a relevant discipline e.g. finance, business, IT or legal
Sound understanding of Risk Management and Audit processes coupled with strong insights into the banking sector
Proven experience operating “in the grey”, in fast-paced environments undergoing complex transformational change
Implementation experience of BCBS239/CBP235 is preferred
High level of personal integrity with strong interpersonal, collaboration, communication, influencing and negotiating skills
Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills and the ability to build rapport at all levels across the organisation

At CommBank, we're committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce reflecting the customers, businesses and communities we serve. As a value's driven organisation, we nurture and support our people; through focusing on skill and talent development, collaboration, flexibility and internal promotion. With service in mind at every touch point, we take accountability for the role we play in securing and enhancing the financial wellbeing of people, businesses and communities. At CommBank you can be you.

Prefered AWS, but Informatica or other ETL automation tools are acceptable.  You will have;  Agile / Scrum Experience Worked in a very fast-paced environment with tight deadlines Effective time management and organizational skills Strong interpersonal management, communication and problem resolution skills Strong understanding of process models and methodologies Accountability for project results Effectively manage multiple project deliverables concurrently ETL knowledge Python experience Data normalization experience  If you're interested in hearing more about this role, apply now! Reece.richardson@perigongroup.com.au

About us Teachers Mutual Bank Limited (TMBL) is one of Australia’s largest values based, member-owned financial institutions. Part of our profits go back to members through competitive, award-winning products as well as towards sustainable business practices that benefit the environment and wider communities we serve. Members can join us through one of four unique brands, each focused on some of Australia’s key essential service sectors including teaching, universities, fire and emergency and health. Employees who work for our bank embrace the core values of passion, advocacy and sustainability and contribute to a diverse and inclusive workplace culture founded on mutual respect, equality and a focus on delivering exceptional member service.          About the role In this role, you will will work with the Business Development Program Administrator to assist in the strategic planning and execution of all related business activities and provide support to the national mobile team. The Business Development Event Administrator will also develop and implement workplace visitation program and develop industry events program to maximise TMBL investment. Types of events will include, but are not limited to; Business centres, Kiosk locations, Mobile offices, Seminars and Industry conferences. Some key duties include  Developing monthly planning activities with the Business Development Program Administrator to ensure representation at appropriate business development activities and industry events and conferences Assisting the Business Development Program Administrator to develop various new programs and initiatives that will increase sales while maintaining high member service levels Collaborating with key stakeholders to ensure allocation of resources to specific events, conferences and all activities as required Working with Business Development Program Administrator on providing reports measuring outcomes and objectives on all our business development activities  Applicant requirements To be successful in this role you will have:  Strong experience developing stakeholder engagement strategy Proven experience implementing business development strategy - working with both government and non-government stakeholders Experience in events management Experience managing projects and/or campaigns with post analysis Experience in data analysis will be highly regarded Leadership experience will be highly regarded  We are looking for a strategic thinker and skilled negotiator with high level administration skills. Your engaging persona and superior communication skills, both written and verbal, will see you succeed in this role. We offer an excellent salary package and many other fantastic employee benefits. Teachers Mutual Bank is an Employer of Choice, promotes Gender Diversity and follows EEO principles by appointing on merit.  For more information about working conditions as well as our employee value proposition, please visit the careers page on our website at www.tmbank.com.au or find us on LinkedIn!    Applications can be sent by no later than Monday, 20 May 2019. Detailed enquiries (not from agencies) can be directed to Jessica Melo on 02 9735 9459 during business hours.

job_title: Senior Manager, System/Business Analyst Projects and Change - 12 Month Contract
job_description:
Senior Manager, Systems/BA - Finance Projects and Change – 12 Month Max Term Contract
Join our high performing Finance Project Management team and bring your financial services experience to Macquarie! As a System/Business Analyst in the Projects and Change team, you will have demonstrated experience in data analysis and exposure to regulatory capital and/or regulatory reporting calculation engines and be confident working across existing regulatory reporting and projects.
Your key areas of responsibility will be understanding and explaining the end-to-end system process and data drivers of the regulatory results. You will also acquire an understanding of the current state processes and business context, as well as document and own business and system functional requirements. You will partner with many project delivery teams including key delivery partners in technology, data and the business. You will draw on your experience and analytical skills to translate the business and functional requirements into technical specifications and allow you to manage and review testing issues and identify options and recommendations. 
To be successful you will have experience within financial institutions, ideally having worked with finance or regulatory teams/projects. Ideally, you will have hands-on experience with project and change implementation in an agile environment and have worked with data analytics tools and data lakes. In addition, you will have proven experience as a business analyst working on BAU support or business process change projects and/or new platform implementations and had exposure to data analytics tool and data lakes.
You are proactive, diligent and your effective communication skills and abilities to escalate and take action where necessary is what enables you to deliver results for senior stakeholders. You’ll also take on a flexible, proactive, solution-oriented approach with the ability to work effectively through periods of change and disruption.
If you are motivated by the opportunity to work in a high performing team in a fast-paced environment, we would like to hear from you.
The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate communications and investor relations.
Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

job_title: Senior Data Engineer | Permanent Full Time
job_description: About us At Uniting, we believe in taking real steps to make the world a better place. We work to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice. Our services are in the areas of aged care and disability, community services, and chaplaincy and we get involved in social justice and advocacy issues that impact the people we serve. We commit to respecting children and take action to keep them safe. As an organisation we celebrate our diversity and welcome all people regardless of lifestyle choices, ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation and gender identity. We are bold, imaginative, respectful and compassionate.    About the Role This role is responsible for making a real difference in the lives of tens of thousands of vulnerable Australians through using data products (predictive analytics, insights embedded in applications aimed to deliver the right information to the right person at the right time, reporting, dashboards, and visualisations) to enable informed business decisions across Uniting.   Role Objectives  Effectively add tangible business value to Uniting by developing solutions that improve business efficiency, understand clients better, improve client care and improve staff and resource management Participate in Agile project methodologies, such as sprint planning (including task effort estimation), working in sprints and raising issues or delays with team as soon as possible, participating in showcases and retrospectives. Set clear expectations around delivery and follow up regularly to manage expectations. Raise scope creep with Team Lead as soon as possible. Work towards a DevOps / Product development model in Azure including automation of build, test, deployment and diagnostic/alert pipelines including learning technologies such as PowerShell, Azure Resource Management, Azure Functions, Git. Develop Business Intelligence ETLs, Predictive Analytics, Cubes, Reports (including Visualisations) and Dashboards according to the Software Development Life Cycle and learn these technical skills if required. Technologies currently used are: SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, R, PowerBI (PowerQuery M, DAX). Develop real-time software to ingest and diverge data, e.g. IoT data ingestion and insight divergence to Point of care systems. Be willing and able to learn and master new technologies. Train non-technical staff to use Cubes, Reports and Dashboards and train and mentor technical staff in ETL, Cube and Report/Dashboard development Gather and clarify requirements with business customers (staff) to ensure solutions meet business expectations Maintain quality standards by writing and running unit tests and system tests, checking work against development quality standards and maintain clear documentation of all requirements, design and operational and support processes. Communicate with business customers (staff) effectively using language appropriate to the audience. Commit to delivering on time as appropriate for projects Ensure Staff Experience is good through effective relationships, scope and quality management and through effective communication of tangible business value. Experience:  Tertiary qualifications in IT or a related discipline preferable (Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, Statistics). 10+ years experience in developing Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence / Data Engineering solutions: SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, PowerBI Strong customer service focus and ability to work as part of a team. Proven Business Analysis, data reconciliation and troubleshooting experience. Experience in DevOps/Product development operating models Experience in dashboard, report, and data model design   Even Better:  Eagerness to learn and apply real-time/Data Engineering technologies Eagerness to learn and apply R & Predictive Analytics (Machine Learning, Statistics) Knowledge of Information Systems. Knowledge of Agile Development methodologies desirable. Strong problem solving skills. Quality and results oriented Uniting is proud to be an EEO employer who supports an inclusive approach in the workplace. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.   Interested? Then apply today! Employment with Uniting is subject to satisfactory background checks which include a National Police Check and Reference Check and a Working with Children Check.

job_title: Data Engineer (SaaS, Aus #1 Site to hire tradies, Award winning company culture)
job_description: About UsHi. We're hipages. hipages provides a better, smarter way to connect tradies and consumers and get the job done well. Founded in an Aussie garage 14 years ago by two great mates, we’ve continued to reinvent and refine what we do, becoming Australia's number 1 site to hire qualified, trusted and verified tradies. We are on a mission to make home improvement effortlessly efficient. Our aim is to create a seamless experience for tradies and homeowners in place of the current unreliable - and unproductive - process that makes it a feat of endurance. We build technology that solves the frictions of an industry ready for optimisation, by redesigning the tradie/ client relationship and transforming the way trade businesses operate. To date, over two million Australians have changed the way they find, hire and manage trusted tradies to get a job done around their home. Hipages. Change the way you tradie. Join us on this exciting mission!!   Your opportunity: As a Data Engineer you’ll be responsible for collecting, transforming, storing and processing a wide variety of data sets. You will work closely with our data architect, data scientists, data analysts as well as key business stakeholders to devising strategies, prioritise, and deliver business value from our data assets.   You will be influential in defining the direction of the hipages marketplace as we continue to evolve, apply your experience to transform data into information, govern data quality and advance data-informed decision-making across the business. But most importantly, you’ll be joining a top-notch data science team! If working in a fun, high-growth, fast-paced company with potential opportunity to develop your career appeals, then read on.   What you'll be doing    Create, maintain, evolve and monitor hipages’ data pipeline.   Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of sources and implement ETL processes.   Identify, design and implement internal process improvements such as automating manual tasks, optimizing data delivery and governance as well as evolving infrastructure for improved scalability.   Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product and Data teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.   Collaborate with the analytics and data scientist team members to strive for greater functionality in our data systems and assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.    To be successful…. In addition to a down-to-earth attitude, a desire to continually master your craft and a good sense of humour, you will also bring:   5+ years’ experience in Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence and Big Data processing   Experience in writing ETL transformations in Python and Scala and familiarity with modern workflow systems like Airflow.   Experience with pipeline design and implementation with large distributed databases (Kinesis/Kafka, Spark/Beam/Flink, S3/HDFS etc)   Fluency in programming languages like Java / Scala / Python / Node.js   Experience in collecting, analysing, and synthesizing results from various data sources   Familiarity with scaling and deploying machine learning models   Strong sense of accountability and understanding of privacy around user data   Degree qualified in Computer Science, Information systems or similar   Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment   Strong project management and organizational skills   Proven history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets using distributed systems   Expertise in build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management    Why work for us? We believe great companies come from great people and we empower our team members to have a voice, to help drive hipages forward and ensure we continue to be a great place to work. A huge focus on your career development (with associated investment), competitive salary package, a multitude of best-practice employee benefits and the opportunity to become an owner in the business via participation in our Employee Share Program are a few of the reasons to work here, not to mention the free brekkie, snacks, fruit and the opportunity to work in the most amazing office space in the heart of the CBD! Our diverse and inclusive culture drives our success and helps makes us a great place to work - we celebrate the individual!  We encourage our team members to feel free to be themselves so they can unleash their maximum potential. We are a team of down-to-earth people who genuinely work together as a team to "make it happen". This is hipages' DNA. Check out our Instagram #hipagesteam and LinkedIn posts to get the picture.        This is an exciting and rare opportunity to really impact a business going from ‘great to best ‘ so don’t miss out and let us know about you!

salary: Enjoy flexible working and a Flexi Day on us!
job_description:
Our Company
Tabcorp is a world-class diversified gambling entertainment group and a top 50 ASX company. 
We operate the iconic brands Tatts, TAB, NSW Lotteries, Golden Casket, SA Lotteries, Keno, Sky Racing and Sky Sports Radio. We also deliver leading gaming services and products through MAX.
Our 5,000-plus strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive familiar brands which ignite passion and excitement in millions of Australians.
This leadership is reflected in who we are. If, like us, you’re truly customer-led and you want to use your talent to create awesome moments, we’d love to hear from you. 
Role Summary
The Senior New Business Manager will focus on new growth opportunities across New South Wales. Driving continuous business growth and market share will be paramount.
The successful applicant will have overall responsibility across all aspects of business development including acquiring and nurturing customer leads, commercial negotiations and contract sign-ups.
With full responsibility for executing the strategic direction, you will leverage key internal business expertise including:

Gaming product
Marketing
Data analysis
Customer insights to demonstrate a compelling customer value proposition.

We offer a portfolio of solutions built specifically around our customer’s needs and reflect our ability to add capability and scale. We’re all about execution and quality of delivery, optimising peak performance for our customers and their businesses.
In addition, the incumbent will also be responsible for building, developing, coaching and empowering a highly engaged, strong performing New Business team. You will Implement clear processes to maximise sales and revenue whilst also controlling expenses to ensure focus remains on delivering financial expectations.
Our Ideal Person
Proven success in the Gaming and/or Hospitality industry is highly regarded. The successful individual will  have a track record in developing and maintaining relationships, with a focus on dealing with strategically important, and large-scale venue customers.
The Senior New Business Manager will be well versed in preparing business cases, board papers and delivering presentations. This person will also provide commercial input to review and authorise contract negotiations and ensure optimal commercial outcomes.
Our ideal candidate will have a minimum of 5 years Senior Sales or Business Development experience within a sales or sales-related business. Ideally the successful candidate will be tertiary qualified in a business or commercial field.
When you join our team you’ll be able to take advantage of a range of benefits including flexible working arrangements, leadership and development programs and community programs.
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au
