Working for AMP 
Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration and promotes innovation.  It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities for professional growth. We’re flexible enough to allow you to make the most of your life, both professionally and personally.
We are looking for those that have the courage and agility to navigate changing and complex environments so that we can deliver the best solutions for our customers. We value people with integrity, an innate willingness to help others and an eagerness to perform to the best of their abilities. 
About the role
AMP has recently sold its life insurance business and over the next 12 months, this role will be responsible for facilitating the identification of business problems or opportunities; elicit, analyse, document, communicate & validate requirements; and design recommended changes to processes, policies & information systems, applying AMP’s methods and working in collaboration with key stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities

Facilitate monthly deep dive analysis on key variables in the result.
Assist with the business’ forecasting and budgeting processes, providing on-going support to the business partners and cost center managers to ensure that meaningful and realistic annual budgets and accurate forecasts are set.
Financial reporting including cash flow management expense reporting and also an element of legal entity restructuring
Develop project schedules, define, allocate and drive tasks. Meet with stakeholders to seek direction on issues, project changes and business requirements

Capabilities & Experience

Accounting background preferred 
Requirements and data analysis (including: Planning, Elicitation, Analysis, Documentation, Validation, Quality Assurance and Requirements Management, end to end trace-ability)
Exceptional communication skills both written and verbal
Exceptional attention to detail and levels of accuracy and an ability to work through unstructured problems and develop clear explanations
Experience working on large scale financial transformation programs 

Wellbeing & Benefits 
As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.
Inclusion & Diversity
AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP.

job_title: Product Definition Analyst (Technical Business Analyst) - Loyalty
job_description: Would you be keen to work in the airline industry, or rather in the marketing industry? Why choose, work in both!   Airline Loyalty programs sit at the boundary of both worlds: while a prime focus of theirs is to foster loyalty in airline customers, they also bring valuable customers to various businesses as hotels, banks or petrol stations. Join Amadeus Loyalty R&D, and help us building the next-generation Loyalty platform, offering solutions for:  Frequent flyer and loyalty members recognition and personalisation Loyalty call center agents to provide the best service to loyalty members Loyalty administrators to configure the program and variety of agreements with multiple partners such as airlines, shops, hotels and petrol stations. Join RBA's Information Technology Department and deliver our data centre upgrade project
Be part of an organisation that serves Australia's public interest
12 month full time, fixed term contract

 
In this role you'll lead and deliver the Bank's data centre upgrade project, where you'll establish key technology relationships and deliver new technology capability. The project is in the early development stage of its lifecycle and requires someone with prior experience project managing data centre upgrades or similar.
 
As part of the team you will:

Manage approved projects, including the project proposal/brief, project plan, project timetable, project resource plan, project budget, project risk assessment and procurement method/s, as required by the Enterprise and IT Portfolio Management Offices
Chair, participate in and document meetings with the Project Teams, internal stakeholders, industry bodies, vendors, other external service providers and others, as required.
Document, monitor and report on project issues, risks and action items, including people responsible and due dates.
Provide administrative and other support services as required for key stakeholders, including senior management and the Steering Committees, and relevant minute taking.
Gather information from the business stakeholders to understand their current and potential requirements. Match IT service
capabilities with business stakeholder expectations and use feedback to assess and promote understanding of need for future changes in services and systems.

 
The successful applicant will have the following skills and capability:

Demonstrated infrastructure Project Manager experience in the Financial Services industry.
Demonstrated Project Management experience in Data Centre mirgration and capability uplifts
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
A relevant degree qualification and Project Management Certification in Prince II
3-5 years project management experience

 
By joining the RBA, you'll have the opportunity to:

Work for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the Australian people
Develop your career in a collaborative environment
Access to a wide-range of benefits

 
About the RBA
The Reserve Bank of Australia pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system.
 
How to Apply
Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications. A supporting statement addressing the selection criteria would also be welcomed.
 
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

We have a rare and genuinely exciting opportunity for the right Analytics Specialist.   This position of Principal Data Science Consultant/Specialist will operate as a Data Science Leader and Champion for one of our most respected and successful client.   This role will see you providing Subject Matter Expertise to a range of internal and external Stakeholders and Clients on all things Data and Analytics.  You’ll be working directly with the Data Science and Business Intelligence teams to provide thought leadership, build and maintain analytics models, and liaise directly with clients to create new model features, driving revenue generation.    You’ll be responsible for ensuring that Data Science and Intelligence teams are aware of new, leading edge developments in Data modelling and that you become a subject matter expert in Automated Value Models (AVMs).    Key Responsibilities:  Translation of business requirements into technical modelling solutions, including writing analytics briefs for solution development from data sources to output of models.  Responsible for the coordination and completion of projects using agile methodologies Completion of smaller client analytics and insights projects to support product and account teams. Manage AVM analytics queries and requests and work with the Head of Analytics to prioritize in the Analytics roadmap.  Work as a senior member of the Analytics team with subject matter experience in analytics, modelling and deep understanding of data assets and tools as well as the design, build and reporting for internal and external clients.  Where relevant liaise with the business including; The delivery/execution of modelling solutions, handover of BAU reports to the Ops team; and ongoing regular/BAU automated modelling solutions and trouble shoot as issues arise. Ensure the design layout, associated effort and timelines required to deliver outputs on all briefs Line management of Analysts when and if required   Skills and Experience Required:    Bachelors (or higher) degree in computing, mathematics or statistics related disciplines.  Background in a data driven role as an analytic/modelling SME working within an analytics team. Proven experience working alongside data development and operational teams  Experience in stakeholder management across multiple business units and/or disciplines, Experience managing project workload including; receiving requests, gathering requirements, responding to briefs Minimum of 10 years commercial experience in relevant tools - SQL or other querying languages, R, Python Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills are essential for this role including the ability to present to both internal and external stakeholders including presenting to large groups  Provide relevant content for external media opportunities and present at industry events as a Thought Leader/SME in your specialist field  We see this role as ideal for an experienced Senior analytical professional who can provide added value through their passion for and experience in all things Data Driven.  This role will be the best fit for a person who has a deep interest in Data Science and a genuine drive to use their knowledge to contribute to the ongoing success and revenue generation of a highly successful business.    This is a one-off chance to work for an industry leader, with a culture of continuous improvement, collaboration and success.  If you’d like to the chance to be considered, apply now for a confidential discussion.

About the Firm:Wotton + Kearney (W+K) has one focus – we are known as one of the leading Australian law firms specialising in the insurance industry.   Established in Sydney in 2002 we have grown from one office with six lawyers to more than 140 lawyers specialising in insurance across our offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, Wellington & Auckland. Examples of work that we do is acting for insurers in relation to disputes arising from property damage and professional negligence claims. We are passionate about partnering with our industry clients to develop strategies to help mitigate insurance risk, manage claims, improve performance and create value for their businesses. Our specialist focus makes us the law firm of choice for some of the largest insurers, brokers, private companies and industry participants in Australia and across the world. Our commitment to this industry extends to overseas insurance markets including London, Europe and Asia Pacific.The position: This newly created position reflects the increasing importance of data-driven decision to make decisions that enhance our client engagement, client service and pricing models and drive business performance.    This role works directly with our Business Analyst and closely with our Practice Groups, Finance, Business Development & Marketing, and IT teams. The role suits a finance or accounting professional from a professional services background who is looking to utilise their skillset in a different way. It requires someone who has a commercial mindset, a deep interest in analyzing data to derive valuable insights and experience in business partnering.Responsibilities: Your key responsibilities will be to:  manage and deliver monthly KPI reports that give meaningful insight into business and client specific performance; support the firm’s budgeting and forecasting processes; collaborate with the BDM, Finance and IT teams to deliver financial and client performance data; respond to queries relating to specific financial and performance reports; and  support the Business Analyst to implement data and system projects as needed.  Skills and key competencies: We’re looking for someone who is:  degree qualified in business, economics, commerce with an accounting background an advantage; analytical and detail oriented; an excellent problem solver with great project management and communication skills; advanced at Microsoft Excel for financial modelling, streamlining & automating reporting/processes; independent and a quick learner; and a team player.  Previous experience building financial models would be an advantage.  What we have to offer: It matters to us that you feel recognised for what you bring to the team. We take time out to wind down and we celebrate achievements, big or small, professional or personal. These are some of the ways we say thanks.  Above-market remuneration Involvement in our pro-bono legal service program and CSR initiatives A generous employee referral program Fantastic and regular social opportunities throughout the year. Great retail discounts & rewards via our HRIS system

salary: Great opportunity to work at Head Office
job_description:
We have a full-time role for a Employee Services Compliance/Reporting Analyst who will be responsible for ensuring Downer’s expense and travel policy are followed, providing insightful reports to the business and ensuring expense data integrity in the ERP. Reporting to the Employee Services Supervisor, the role will have the following key responsibilities:

Analyse raw data and prepare compliance reports to support the business operations
Be the main contact with CTM and Concur Audit from a compliance and reporting perspective
Leverage of CTM and Concur Audit reports
Resolve issues raised through the Quality Management System (ServiceNow),
Ensure integrity of expense data posted to ERP and reconcile expense related clearing account,
Assist/guide junior members in the team,
Maintain/update the expense and travel policy/procedures as required,
Provide after-hours support as required

To be successful in the role, you will have:


Minimum 7 years in a compliance, reporting analyst and/or financial accounting role
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance required
Accounting qualification such as CA or CPA is required
Experience in balance sheet account reconciliation is required
Experience in Expense Management, Corporate Card Services, Corporate Travel booking within a large organization is desired
Concur, Tramada and large ERP (e.g. JDEGS, SAP) experience is desired
Strong analytical and spreadsheet skills
Able to associate financial/operational data against policy
Able to effectively communicate information to a range of stakeholders including business customers and external vendors (e.g. AMEX, Concur, CTM)
Able to quickly understand and apply knowledge of Concur Expense Management System and Tramada Lightning Self Booking system
Strong attention to detail with ability to review own work for accuracy
Able to develop own understanding of processes and suggest and/or implement process improvement initiatives as required
Able to work well in a fast-paced environment and quickly shift focus as required
Enjoy looking into the numbers and analysing data

In addition, you will have:

Understand how to reconcile payment clearing account and able to navigate through large ERPs and integration tools
Knowledge of American Express and Visa credit card functionalities, online booking tools and international travel booking process would be an advantage
Very strong capability with Excel
Proficient in other Microsoft Office software – Access, Word

APPLY for this amazing opportunity today! 
To register your interest hit “apply now” or contact Chantal on chantal.dalli@Downergroup.com for more information.
(Note: Downer does not accept applications via email)

About Novotech  Novotech is internationally recognised as the leading independent and full service contract research organisation (CRO) in the Asia Pacific region. We provide a wide range clinical development services across all research phases and therapeutic areas; and have been instrumental in the success of hundreds of Phase I – IV clinical trials throughout the Asia Pacific. Powered by the highest quality people, Novotech strives to set the benchmark for both business and clinical trial performance. Our people are one of our key strengths. We value our people and recognise the work they do. We are lucky to have the best people and talent from across the Asia Pacific region work together to deliver to clinical trial success for our clients. Our people and those we look to recruit have an attitude of making things happen. They are problem solvers, driven with a focus on delivering quality, accountability and a high level of performance.  About the role  Due to continued growth, we are looking for a talented Statistical Programmer to join the Biometrics team office or home based within Australia. To develop and standardise (re-usable) program code for the purpose of undertaking data validation, and for generating tables, listings and figures (TLFs) which are part of interim and final reports, in accordance with applicable regulatory guidelines and using validated statistical software environments, in particular SAS. Core responsibilities: Provide input into statistical analysis plans with respect to presentation of data and results (tables, listings, figures) and advise project staff with requirements in relation to data collection, storage and tabulation (CDASH, SDTM, ADaM)Develop and validate SAS programs for the tabulation of data, preparation of subject listings, graphical output and statistical analysis of data.Develop and validate SAS programs for multivariate data checking of CRF and Non-CRF (external) data by Data ManagementDevelop and maintain a library of validated programs based on CDISC (CDASH, SDTM, ADAM), and regulatory guidance for data submissions, in particular FDA.Act as Project Programmer for assigned projects involving multiple studies, and ensure consistency in data structuring and presentationAct as mentor to junior statistical programmers and conduct training activitiesAssist clinical data management in developing clinical databases and eCRF's for data capture and cleaning that are compliant with CDASH/CDISC requirements.  Benefits and perks  To deliver clinical trial and research excellence for our clients, our people are 'best in class'. At Novotech, we seek and nurture people with exceptional talent. We are committed to providing our people with regular internal and external training, a competitive bonus structure and a supportive work environment. We are also focused on providing our people with a wide variety of career growth and development opportunities. For more information about where your next career step at Novotech might take you,visit http://novotech-cro.com/novotech-careers  Skills and experience  Required Qualification(s): Degree in biostatistics, computer science or life sciences with demonstrated programming experience in the fields of biostatistics or pharmacometrics. Required Professional Experience: 2-5 years experience as a Statistical Programmer within a pharmaceutical company or CRO. Other Required skills: High level of proficiency with SAS software, R, and other statistical analysis or data visualisation software packages.Fluency in English and excellent verbal and written communication skills are essentialAdaptability, team work and collaboration are essential

At Foxtel, we’re bringing television to Australians like never before. Our mission is to provide Australia’s best value streamed and live sport, movies, drama, news and entertainment experience.
We work as a team, we’re agile and we’re accountable. We put the customer first and we’re passionate about what we do. We have fun and we’re different, better, special.
Our Data & Analytics team are looking for a Data & Analytics Commercialisation Lead to join their team to lead the day-to-day operations of the Content & Commercial team.
The successful candidate will be expected to work closely with business stakeholders and analysts to build analytics solutions that address strategic business challenged and enable decision making as well as engage with Enterprise wide stakeholders to represent analytics needs.
Your purpose

Design, develop and deploy strategic analysis which address key business challenges
Use innovative approaches to discover new insights in existing data and incorporate new data for additional insight
Lead the design and planning for the training and development programme within the Analytics Team and with Stakeholders
Provide mentoring support and technical guidance for Analysts
Perform analysis and present strategic recommendations for the Content Team in order to optimise budget forecasts and increase revenue
Support the Content Team with relevant insights
Drive incremental revenue by crafting sales arguments for content and platforms (specific to Advertising/Acquisition/Retention)
Create supporting research and presentations to advocate for the effectiveness of advertising in our products/channels

Your capability

Proven experience developing and execution of advanced analysis such as cluster segmentation and propensity modeling
Experience working in fast paced environment with high demand and multiple projects
Proven team leadership skills along with experience coaching and training Analysts
Proficient in SQL, Python, R (or similar) and strong understanding of analytics techniques such as cohort analysis and customer lifetime value, Tableau skills an advantage
Knowledge of Next Generation Data Paradigms highly beneficial – Big Data/Hadoop, NoSQL
Certified Product Owner or Scrum Master within Agile Delivery Method preferable
Demonstrated ability to coach a team to achieve their potential and the ability to work collaboratively to achieve shared goals is essential

What’s in it for you?
We have a benefits program with something for everyone. But we’re in the entertainment business and we connect Australians to all the stories they love, so what would a Foxtel benefits program be without a free Foxtel subscription and discounted broadband!
Above all, we love entertainment and, if you do too, you’ll love working with us.  So if you’re excited about this opportunity, please click ‘Apply now’.

About Us   Pactera is a leading digital consulting and technology services firm delivering world-class solutions to customers since 1995 and has shared many customer successes. We are more than a technology company. Pactera is a global organisation of relationship builders and digital visionaries.   We take pride in establishing lasting partnerships with our global clients to create value and accelerate their digital transformation journey via offerings across a number of areas that include Analytics and Business Intelligence, Technology Solutions, DevOps, Consulting, Operations, Managed Services and Business Process outsourcing.   Consulting Big Data Engineer   If you are looking to be the universal translator between IT, business, software engineering and data scientists working across organisation boundaries and delivery teams, APPLY NOW!   As a Data Engineer the key focus of your role will be to understand the business problem being solved, engineer the data solutions required and deliver iteratively to ensure high standards of software development and data quality. You enjoy rapid development and deployment of data engineering solutions   About you:   You are someone who enjoys enabling technology to improve process and drive outcomes. With a track record of designing and deploying large scale technical solutions, which deliver tangible and ongoing value. Janus Analytics (part of the CoreData group) is seeking a fulltime Data Scientist to help drive customer analytics projects primarily in the financial services industry.  We provide tailored customer analytics that transform businesses by driving valuable customer experiences and improved relationship intimacy. We are an evidenced based consultancy, combining primary research, database analytics and behavioural science to deliver customised solutions to our clients. You are a motivated data scientist who is interested in driving high quality research and consulting while working with some of the best in the industry. You take pride in your ability to communicate analytical findings both verbally and visually. You are equally comfortably dealing with sales and operational people, ensuring that we are delivering outcomes that support our clients’ needs. You are passionate about processes and continuous process improvement. You are naturally curious, well organised and have attention for detail. A high level of motivation and excellent written and verbal skills are required to manage a diverse range of clients. This is a fast-paced work environment so you will display flexibility and the ability to work on multiple projects, the ability to generate client ready work, a natural aptitude for organisation, and a deadline-driven ethos. Financial services and economic analysis experience highly valued. Duties and responsibilities   Develop and deliver sophisticated analytical solutions to meet our clients’ business goals   Work in projects that involve components of data science   Build analytics models and dashboards - hands on where necessary   Engage with client stakeholders, understanding their goals, strategies and processes   Assist the sales team in onboarding clients   Proactively engage in continuous improvement of analytical techniques and data visualisation used within the company   Support consultants within the team, furthering their understanding of the business needs and improving technical ability  Skills and experience Minimum 3-5 years of experience working as a data scientist or closely related role Hard skills required:   Programming and coding skills (R, Python, SQL, etc)   Strong knowledge of relational DBMS, and unstructured data models   Knowledge of AWS stack (EC2, S3, EMR, Lambda, IAM, etc.)   Advanced ability in statistics, particularly in predictive modelling (Linear models, Decision trees, etc) and unsupervised methods (cluster analysis, FA, PCA, etc)   Be able to build dashboards that provide actionable intelligence to clients (e.g. shiny apps, Tableau and PowerBI)   Ability to liaise with clients autonomously   Experience in Natural Language Processing a bonus    Key general skills:   Time management and multi-tasking projects   Project management and documentation   Excellent numerical and analytical skills   Interpersonal skills   Excellent communication skills   Writing and presentation abilities   Financial services industry knowledge a plus   Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative discipline (Masters or PhD preferred)       Personal qualities:   Attention to detail   Resourceful and creative   Pragmatic and flexible   Methodical, well organised with good time management   Team player, able to take the lead or follow as required   Positive, ‘can do’ attitude and embrace taking initiative    Employee benefits Education Janus Analytics values ongoing education and professional development. We offer flexible working arrangements for staff who are pursuing higher education, including unpaid leave arrangements to attend classes, exams or just to study. If we think that the degree is relevant to the work you are doing, we will also pay it in full!   Meritocracy We value our employees on their merit, not on their tenure. We value our flat corporate structure where we allow all staff to shine. We do not enforce any minimum tenure in roles allowing for rapid progression for talented staff. Travel The CoreData group is a global business with offices in 4 countries. Staff are offered the opportunity to travel overseas, either temporarily or permanently, to gain broader exposure to other markets and help develop our international team. Culture Janus Analytics is proud of its entrepreneurial, start-up culture where training is very ‘hands on’ and there’s an atmosphere in which teams are tight and colleagues help each other. You will be responsible for end-to-end analytics project work which will be interesting, challenging and provide opportunities for personal and career development.   About the company Janus Analytics (part of the global CoreData group) is an award-winning company that provides end to end analytics solutions using behavioural science to improve customer experiences and relationships. We ensure all the pieces of the puzzle fit together for an integrated bespoke solution that really works. We have worked with some of the biggest financial service providers in Australia and looking to expand soon to our international CoreData group businesses in Boston and London. Our team brings together a range of multi-disciplinary professionals, using our experience to maintain a strong outcome focus. CoreData (our parent company) is a global specialist financial services market research, panel and consulting business. CoreData serve as a strategic growth partner to a broad array of industry clients including many of the top banks, super funds, financial planning licensees, and insurance companies.  Only Australian citizens or permanent residents with full working rights should apply.

The Cloud Service Provider business has grown 45% YoY in 2018 and Micro Focus is seeing rapid adoption of Cloud solutions by Enterprise and mid-market customers. To best capture this revenue stream, Micro Focus is hiring regional alliance leaders to manage and drive new opportunities, CSP sales engagement and pipeline.   Introduction and Overview: The regional Cloud Service Provider (CSP) Alliance Business Manager is responsible for driving revenues through sales and demand generation activities targeted on a partner CSP Platform (e.g. AWS, Azure). By aligning the CSP and Micro Focus sellers on opportunities, the Business Manager can accelerate deals, reduce sales cycles and close more deals. A set of demand generation activities available from the CSP can be leveraged by the Business Manager to drive new business and sales collaboration between Micro Focus and the CSP partner.   Management level definitions:   Applies advanced subject matter knowledge to drive new and creative revenue streams on the designated CSP platform. Business manager is viewed as a subject matter expert and top professional in sales and alliance management. Frequently contributes to the development of new ideas and methods. Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives. Acts as an expert providing direction and guidance to process improvements and establishing policies. Frequently represents the organization to external customers/clients. Exercises significant independent judgment within broadly defined policies and practices to determine best method for accomplishing work and achieving objectives.   Responsibilities:  Aligns Micro Focus, CSP and SI sales teams on opportunities to advance deals Track, report and manage sales opportunities (e.g. leads, deal registration, pipeline, bookings) Promotes Micro Focus solutions to CSP sales, segment, technical and marketing teams Influences large account sales teams to partner with CSP for near-term revenue growth, while at the same time, develop joint relationships, initiatives and programs for long-term sustained regional sales growth. Develops long term and short term business with the CSP and using the Alliance Account Plan as a means to document and communicate the plan. Acts as the advocate for the CSP in the company and represents all GBUs with CSP. Manages the virtual team of company representatives to ensure the pursuit and closure of global opportunities through the CSP, and increase the funnel for the company. Classification Guidance: The sections below help differentiate between levels to enable consistency.   Education and Experience:  University or Bachelor’s degree. Typically 8-12 years of selling experience at end-user account or partner level. Experience selling to partners in a complex environment.   Knowledge and Skills:  Leverages consultative presence in CSP partner to identify opportunities. Actively and proactively manages the CSP partner to protect & grow company’s business; coordinates all CSP partner regional plans and funnel activities. Aggressively shapes offers in pursuit of new business and/or portfolio enhancement. Leadership skills to manage partner’s sales force. Actively manage the account to protect & grow company’s business. Forecasting, planning and reporting skills in relation to partner/alliance deals. Shapes offers in pursuit of new business and/or portfolio enhancement. Thorough understanding of the company’s organization & operations, including key business rules, and alignment with company GBU go-to-market strategies, partner segmentation, key programs & initiatives, structure and business model. Thorough understanding of the company's products, software, and services. Able to communicate the strengths of the company's offerings relative to competition, and overcome objections. Effectively sells the company's offerings by building strategic relationships with partner decision makers; aligning partner and company processes; and promoting company programs and offerings. Develops strategic plans with the partner to grow the size of the business and the company's share. Partners effectively with others in the account to ensure coordinated efficient account management. Ability to motivate partner’s sales force. Coordinates and directs efforts across the company's sales teams.   Impact/Scope:  Carries quota and works in a region and potentially global. 100% revenue goals.   Complexity:  Multi-BU, multi-country, multi-year with region. Coordinate sales deals across BU.

job_title: Principal Consultant - Big Data and Analytics
job_description: Are you a Senior Big Data and Analytics leader looking to make a strategic impact? At Amazon, our vision is be earth’s most customer-centric company. In 2006, we launched Amazon Web Services, giving customers access to the same cloud technology we built to serve millions of shoppers on Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a secure cloud services platform, offering compute power, database storage, content delivery and other functionality to help businesses scale and grow. Millions of customers are currently leveraging AWS cloud products and solutions to build sophisticated applications with increased flexibility, scalability and reliability. ** To ensure we receive your application, please apply via our career site here https://bit.ly/2D4rP4z **The RoleThis is a brand new role in ANZ as a Specialist Technical Account Manager (STAM), being an expert on all things Big Data & Analytics. We’re going through an exciting period of rapid growth and you’ll be one of the founding members of a new team of specialist experts bringing the latest in disruptive, cutting-edge cloud computing technologies to our customers. You’ll act as a trusted advisor and advocate for customers across the region.     Solve incredibly complex, large scale (billions of records) data challenges for our customers You will collaborate with our customers and partners on achieving operational excellence, post migrating their Big Data Solutions to the cloud. As a Specialist TAM, you'll partner with customers and our own Technical Account Managers. Learn more about the work our Technical Account Managers do by watching this short video https://bit.ly/2AivWrM. You'll provide consultative expertise post sales, as part of a wider Enterprise Support team As a Technical Evangelist as part of our wider Asia-Pacific, Japan and China team, you’ll help uplift our delivery capabilities in the region. As a Thought Leader you’ll help solve a variety of cost and agility challenges some of the most iconic, high profile companies in ANZ from large enterprises to startups. Lead teams through high impacts projects, using the latest data analytics technologies Highly autonomous role, taking ownership of our Big Data and Analytics offerings within ANZ. Focus on AWS Big Data Services such as Amazon EMR, Amazon Redshift, AWS Glue, Elasticsearch and Kinesis. Help to plan, debug, and oversee business critical Big Data applications and migrations. Work hand-in-hand with Solutions Architecture, Business Development, Professional Services and Sales. The location is based in Australia office (e.g. Melbourne, Sydney, Perth, Canberra, Brisbane etc), but work across an Asia-Pacific context (Australia/New Zealand, ASEAN, India, Japan and China)   We’re passionate about supporting the needs of our people and their family members. Benefits include Medical Cover, Employee Assistance Programs and Global Mobility opportunities.Want to be part of history and transform businesses through cloud computing adoption?CultureAt Amazon Web Services, we don't mind being called "peculiar." We have our own way of doing things. We're obsessed with customers, we see beauty in simplifying the complex, and we're comfortable with being misunderstood. That might sound unorthodox, but our unusual approach and our culture - focused on removing obstacles so builders can build - are part of why our people enjoy working in AWS.Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Female / Minority / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.Basic Qualifications     5 or more years of hands on, Big Data platform implementation experience. Experience with analytic solutions applied to the Marketing or Risk needs of enterprises. Experience in similar role as a Principal Consultant, Technical Architect, Technical Lead, Technical, Pre Sales Consultant, Lead Consultant etc Ability to gain credibility and build relationships with all levels in an organisation, from technical experts to senior executives. Expert understanding of ETL principles and how to apply them within Big Data workloads. Be proficient in at least 2 of the following languages: Java, Scala, Python, Perl, Ruby, C, C#. Ability to lead effectively across internal and external organizations and virtual teams. A talent for being able to influence and build mindshare convincingly with any audience. Confident in public speaking to large audiences.   Preferred qualifications    Familiarity with Amazon Redshift, EMR, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch, Athena, Kinesis and Glue. Deep understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP and NoSQL databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting and Dashboard development. Deep understanding of Apache Hadoop 1/2 and the Hadoop ecosystem. Experience with tools such as Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Oozie, Hue, Zookeeper, HCatalog, Solr, and Avro. Familiarity with SQL-on-Hadoop technologies such as Hive, Pig, Impala, Spark SQL, and/or Presto. Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business environments such as large enterprises and start-ups. AWS Certifications, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate/Professional highly desirable.   ** To ensure we receive your application, please apply via our career site here https://bit.ly/2D4rP4z **   If you would like a confidential discussion to find out more, please contact the Recruiter, Adrian Holtham on aholtham@amazon.com, +61 431920414.

Assist potential small business owners in planning and commencing their new business Various locations across the Sydney metropolitan area Sydney Business is a Registered Training Organisation (RTO) approved to deliver AQF qualifications from the BSB Business Services Training Package. As small business specialists and an approved provider for the Federal Government program - New Business Assistance with NEIS (New Enterprise Incentive Scheme), Sydney Business is proud to have delivered top quality training and business mentoring since 1994. Who is Zip? Join the Zipfam!Zip is one of Australia’s fastest growing fintechs and the company behind popular products such as zipPay, zipMoney and PocketBook.   We are a dynamic product driven organisation and we like to move fast - we try things, learn, and continually improve our offerings one step at a time.   Over 700,000 customers choose to pay with Zip, and we’re available online and instore at more than 10,000 retailers. Go to www.zip.co to find out more about our products.What are we looking for?We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist who will be responsible for the design and implementation of new data science capabilities to deliver highly personalised experiences for customers in a multi-channel environment. Whilst the position requires an individual with strong technical competency, you will also be the conduit between Product, Marketing, Tech & Data Science teams, providing thought leadership to bring the “art and science” together in an operational environment. More importantly, you will be someone who is passionate about numbers, machine learning and the application of analytics to solve real-world business problems in an organisation without red-tape or data silos!What your day will look like at Zip!  Developing supervised and/or unsupervised machine learning algorithms that underpin a recommendation engine spanning inbound and outbound digital channels (including eDM, SMS, Native App, Web, Push) Embedding technical processes to iteratively experiment with customer lifecycle journeys and marketing content that maximise customer engagement. Creating a customer segmentation model that will support the personalisation of content and messaging. Analysis and enrichment of product level (SKU) data to further understand consumer buying behaviours that can increase the effectiveness of marketing content. Natural language processing (NLP) to improve the accuracy in categorising bank transactional data. Supporting the implementation of a recommendation engine by working closely with Product, Marketing & Tech teams to develop a pipeline that utilises real-time data to inform real-time decisions. Managing and mentoring other data scientists, with a focus to grow the customer data science capability at Zip Co Ltd. Working with the Head of Analytics & Data Science in the design of customer strategies, frameworks and architectures to personalise communications across the customer lifecycle.  You will thrive in this role if you have:   Tertiary qualifications in a quantitative discipline (E.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Actuarial Studies, Economics). 8+ years commercial analytics experience from a retail/consumer product environment with a strong presence in B2C digital channels. Experience in developing next-best-offer/next-best-action recommendation systems. Hands-on experience in modelling and the application statistical/machine learning techniques (E.g. GLMs, XGBOOST, k-means clustering, neural networks, random forests etc.). Strong exposure to analytical scripting languages, in particular SQL, Python, and R.  An extra bonus if you have:  Post-graduate qualification/s (Masters or PhD). Exposure to Big Data platforms (E.g. AWS) and applications (E.g. Hadoop, Hive, Spark). An understanding of experimental design practices with respect to marketing analytics.  Why you will want to become a Zipster!     NOW is the best time to join - we are scaling and you will have the chance to really contribute and excel in your career. We have state of the art offices in the CBD. Our offices are fitted out with the latest technology and tools, designed with smart spaces to make work more fun! Flexible working hours and working from home days. Breakfast is yummy and waiting for you daily. Loads of social events and Friday drinks. Staff discounts for Zip products, movie tickets, retail stores and much more. Friday massages. Competitive share programme for ALL employees – we ALL share the rewards of working together and building great products. Regular fundraisers and a a paid leave day every year to undertake voluntary work as Zipcares. We promote diversity!    And there is so much more, APPLY now and we would love to tell you more about what it's like to become a Zipster at Zip!   We will review all resumes and love to update all candidates about their applications. We appreciate the time it takes to apply for a role and know how it is important it is to stay in touch with top talent!    Recruitment agencies: We would love to get in touch with you, should we require assistance but we do not agree to your engagement terms for any unsolicited resumes sent to the Zip team.

We are looking for an experienced Data & Analytics Manager to join our Business Intelligence team to help and support us meet the growing demand for data driven insights at Vodafone. Reporting to the Head of BI Demand, Analytics & Reporting and managing a small team, Data & Analytics Manager is responsible for managing the delivery of standard and advanced analytics projects, direct supervision of analysts and working closely with business stakeholders to create a future road map and deliver value through analytics.  Based in our North Sydney office, this role is responsible for the design, development and industrialisation of advanced analytics capability for the business that aims to provide actionable insights to inform decision making. The ensures that we are looking after the evolution of next generation analytical platforms and contributes to the formation of “Vodafone - Analytics Centre of Excellence”.  Key accountabilities include: Ensuring data integrity is maintained across all data consumption layers where insights are driven from a single source of truth to deliver cutting edge analytical capabilities that align with short, medium and long-term business initiatives.Engaging with Technology teams and influencing change and stability in design of the Enterprise Data eco system.Participate in design governance forums and be accountable for changes in the data presentation layer.Partner with GMs & Head ofs’ and present the strategy for data requirements and delivery.Lead cross-functional projects using advanced data modelling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities.Knowledge & Experience Requirements: 5 + years of experience in a position monitoring, managing, manipulating and drawing insights from data, and someone with at least 3 years of experience leading a team.An individual with energy and drive to succeed and who understand the importance of stakeholder management and setting realistic expectations.Working knowledge of data mining principles: predictive analytics, mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on premises and cloud-based data sources.Understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analysing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations for business units.Experience and knowledge of statistical modelling techniques: GLM multiple regression, logistic regression, log-linear regression, variable selection, etc.Strong Python or R programming experience and related data science libraries (such as scikit-learn, Pandas, Tensorflow/Keras)Strong programming skills with querying languages: SQL, SAS, Python etc.Experience with big data tools: Teradata, Aster, Hadoop, etc.Experience with data visualization tools: Tableau, QlikA degree or background in Maths, Engineering, Computer Science, Finance, Business or ITUnderstanding of Cloud frameworks like AWS or GCP and tools like Sage Maker, TensorFlow.Strong ability to plan and manage numerous processes, people and projects simultaneously.Excellent communication, collaboration and delegation skills.With Vodafone, you’ll have the power to make a difference to our customers and how they connect With Vodafone, we are committed to attracting, developing and retaining the best people by offering a flexible, diverse and inclusive workplace where hard work is truly rewarded. You will have access to fantastic benefits as part of a global company, including generous leave policies, leadership development programs and opportunities to grow your career. You’ll be faced with loads of variety where no two days are ever the same in a collaborative work space that helps drive innovation.  The future is exciting. Ready?  When you sign up and create a LiveHire profile, your personal information will be collected in accordance with Vodafone's Privacy Collection Statement and LiveHire's Personal Information Collection Statement. job_title: Digital Data Scientist - Marketing and Fundraising Division - Leading NFP
job_description: Merge analytics and digital marketing to ensure we keep evolving in the most effective way Take the next step in your and build on your strategic abilitiesCelebrating over 60 years, Cancer Council NSW (CCNSW) is an independent, community funded not for profit.  CCNSW recognises in this rapidly changing marketplace, it is essential to build and maintain a competitive advantage through extracting value from the organisation's online and offline data assets, and to develop advanced analytics as a core competency.This is where the Direct Marketing and Insights Unit fits in. As part of the wider Marketing and Fundraising Division, the team manages the analysis, extracts and data strategy that underpins our success in digital and traditional marketing and fundraising, and also undertakes analysis and data interpretation for other key parts of the organisation as and when required.This role will take the lead in ensuring we maximise revenue online to fund vital cancer research and programs through using deep data insights to guide data selection to provide the right people, with the right offer at the right time, in the most cost efficient way possible.    How?Based in our Woolloomooloo office, this role will explore and analyse Cancer Council datasets to help understand and organise online data, identify underlying patterns and trends, and develop methods that identify how to best extract and summarize information from the data that can be used to inform better decision-making.Key deliverables will be:Strategic leadership:  In partnership with marketing and digital managers, develop the digital data strategy to maximise performance through building high level data capabilities, self-service and automation offline and online.Consultation: Advise and mentor internal customers on the subjects of digital data management, database structure and coding, historical use of data, test design and response tracking, data integrity, data quality and enhancement and analysis interpretation.What will set you up for success?As an outstanding communicator, you will have exceptional stakeholder management skills and an ability to translate data into a solution focussed approach. You will also need:Sound understanding of the principles and best practices of managing online data in marketing with a good working knowledge of privacy legislationExperience working with and creating data architecturesStrong experience analyzing and interpreting data from 3rd party providers: Google Marketing Platform (GA 360, Ads, Studio), Facebook InsightsSound understanding of Sitecore CMS platform (XP) capabilities, Experience Database (xDB) and Microsoft Azure.    Experience in Power BI & CRM toolsExperience using statistical computer languages SQL (Python  or  R) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data setsHands-on experience working with operational and analytical database systems, including building complex data selections, extracting and manipulating dataStrong interpersonal & negotiation skills, with the ability to build productive working relationships and explain complex theories in plain English with a consultative approachDetailed experience in using analytics for digital marketing with demonstrated success in the application of data analysis to add value and drive marketing strategy Internally this role is called Digital Data ScientistWhy wait! Apply online by visiting our website directly, copying the following link www.cancercouncil.com.au/jobs then click on the role title and submit your cover letter and resume!Applications close COB Tuesday 7th May, 2019.If you have any questions or need any additional information, please do not hesitate to call Bridget on (02) 9334 1436.

job_title: Senior Manager, Risk Data Management Implementation
job_description:
Do work that matters
Working with the Executive Manager Risk Data Solutions, you will play a strategic role in operationalising accountabilities for data risk in alignment to the group’s data strategy. You will do this through building engagement with the Risk Management data community to embed data quality practices as well as providing advice on requirements for adherence to these data practices.
See yourself in our team 
Risk Strategy and Optimisation forms part of the Group Risk Management function supporting the Group Chief Risk Officer (GCRO) and Business Unit Chief Risk Officers execute the outcomes of Risk in the most effective way for the organisation.
The team will provide strategic guidance to the EGM Risk Strategy and Optimisation, Group CRO and the Risk Management Leadership Team, providing advice, governance and oversight that drives a data management culture.
On any given day you will

Support projects and Risk Management teams with the implementation of data management to ensure consistent application and compliant adherence to policies and frameworks
Map and maintain current data landscape to identify and action risk and control gaps
Support the utilisation of data management tools, assisting data practitioners in maintaining data management records to evidence data quality, guiding the development of data dictionaries and taxonomies
Map and maintain a pipeline of data initiatives to provide visibility and evidence of the uplift to data quality
Submit and progress opportunity canvases for the progression of RM wide data quality initiatives
Build a culture of data risk management across Risk Management

Your path looks like 
If you live and breathe the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great opportunities both within Risk Strategy & Optimisation and beyond the wider CBA group. We’ll help you find the next step that’s right for you and enable you to be your best.
We’re interested in hearing from people who:

Are degree qualified in a relevant discipline e.g. finance, business, IT or legal
A strong business analysis background with project management and/or Agile qualifications desirable
Sound understanding of Risk Management processes coupled with strong insights into the banking sector
Proven experience operating “in the grey”, in fast-paced environments undergoing complex transformational change
High level of personal integrity with strong interpersonal, collaboration, communication, influencing and negotiating skills.
Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills and the ability to build rapport at all levels across the organisation
Experience within data governance will be highly regarded

At CommBank, we're committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce reflecting the customers, businesses and communities we serve. As a value's driven organisation, we nurture and support our people; through focusing on skill and talent development, collaboration, flexibility and internal promotion. With service in mind at every touch point, we take accountability for the role we play in securing and enhancing the financial wellbeing of people, businesses and communities. At CommBank you can be you.

A unique opportunity to apply your operational Risk expertise to all Risk disciplines managed by Risk Management Group ’s global operations. 
We are looking for an experienced Operational Risk Manager to join the Business Operational Risk management team in the Risk Management Group. This team is responsible for embedding the Operational Risk Management Framework into Risk Management Group. Embedding the Framework requires a thorough understanding of the Operational Risks inherent in Risk Management Group, advising on and monitoring the effectiveness of mitigating controls, delivering against and refining the control assurance programme, and providing advice, education and feedback to Risk Management Group staff. This is an opportunity for you to be a trusted adviser, adding real value to your stakeholders. 
You will partner with Risk Management Group’s divisions to ensure they clearly understand their role in relation to effective operational Risk management. Key components of operational Risk management include facilitating and maintaining Risk and Control Self Assessments, leading incident investigations, and testing control design and performance. You will perform ad hoc Risk reviews, analyse Risk data, and oversee remedial actions when necessary. Also, you will help implement enterprise-wide Risk management on behalf of Risk Management Group, including business continuity planning and user access reviews.
The role is both exciting and intellectually challenging, requiring your deep understanding of Operational Risk, and the ability to exercise exceptional judgement to effectively manage the Risk in Risk Management Group. It offers you a unique opportunity to gain an understanding of the Operational Risk within the various Risk divisions. Your stakeholders cross Risk Management Group’s global and diverse activities which bridge every Macquarie Group function. 
Your ability to lead discussions with operational staff at all levels, coupled with a genuine skill in building and nurturing meaningful relationships will be paramount to your success in this role. 
Additionally, you will have proven experience within Operational Risk management or Audit, preferably gained within a financial services environment. A university degree in an accounting, finance or related discipline, and relevant postgraduate qualifications, will also be highly regarded. 
If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you, please apply via the link below. 
The Risk Management Group is an independent, centralised unit responsible for assessing and monitoring Risks across Macquarie. This includes Market, Credit, Compliance, Operational and Behavioural Risks. Risk Management Group personnel liaise closely with all operating areas to ensure Macquarie’s Risks are understood and properly managed. 
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

job_title: Sessional Lecturers/Tutors - IT and Business Courses
job_description: ATMC is seeking a number of professional and experienced Sessional Lecturers/Tutors to deliver Information Technology,Business Management, Marketing,Business Analysis and Statistics, Auditing, Law and Accounting units for our courses based in our Sydney CBD campus. ABOUT ATMC  Australian Technical and Management College (ATMC) is a nationally recognised educational institute with campuses in Melbourne and Sydney. ATMC is associated with Federation University Australia (FedUni) & University of the Sunshine Coast (USC). ATMC, in association with the partner universities, delivers both Bachelors and Masters Programs in the areas of Information Technology, Information Systems, Business, Management and Accounting. ATMC constantly strives to deliver a high quality student experience, by delivering quality academic instructions and providing a range of support services to our international and domestic students in order to ensure that their time in Australia is both successful and enjoyable. About the Positions   We require a number of Sessional Lecturers/Tutors to deliver courses in the following discipline areas for Semester 2, 2019 year at our Sydney campuses:  Information Technology  Non-Relational Database Systems Network, Management and Security Big data Analysis Mobile Development Fundamentals Business process Analytics and Change Gaming development and Fundamentals Software Engineering Methodologies Programming   Business Management  Trade and Finance in a Global Economy Managing Organisations Managing People   Marketing  Introduction to Marketing   Business Analysis and Statistics   Business Analytics and Statistics   Finance  Trade and Finance in a Global Economy Finance   Auditing  Auditing and Professional Practice Issues in Auditing Practice   Law  Commercial Law Business Law Taxation Law and Practices   Accounting  Issues in Auditing Practice Auditing and Professional Practice Accounting   Unit materials for delivery will be provided to Lecturers. Successful candidates will be expected to make themselves available for student consultations and staff meetings, as required. Selection Criteria Essential:  Masters' qualification or higher in the relevant discipline area Minimum of two years teaching experience at a tertiary level Copies of student evaluations at the previous and/ or current workplace Microsoft Office suite proficiency A demonstrated commitment to delivering quality education Punctuality and professionalism Respect for people from diverse cultural backgrounds Desirable:  Industry experience Publications Experience in dealing with Moodle, Blackboard, Learnline and other eLearning platforms To apply, please upload your resume, along with copies of your student evaluations and a brief covering letter including the disciplines you have taught by clicking the button below. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

About HCF 
HCF is Australia's largest not for profit private health insurer. With over 80 years of heritage in Australia, we remain faithful to our not for profit charter and continue to deliver more benefits to our members. With the adoption of our 2020 Strategy, our vision is to make health care understandable, affordable, high quality and customer centric.
HCF Australia is undergoing a strategic transformation to deliver new business capabilities to meet its strategic plan. As a key driver in the change, IT is at the forefront of the design and implementation of new systems and supports the ongoing change management, support and delivery of the overall business transformation.
 
About the Role
This role provides design support for the development and implementation of BI reporting aligned to business strategies and priorities. Work with key stakeholders across departments to understand reporting requirements, create reports & dashboards, from variety of data sources.
Reporting to the Manager of Data Analytics & BI Delivery, you will be responsible for the following:

Work with business stakeholders in understanding the reporting requirements
Continuously apply and monitor SQL for database management integrity
Design, develop and implement reports/dashboards in Tableau
Identify opportunities in automating repetitive manual insights delivery into a dashboard/reporting delivery, by working closely with data analysts
Support the activity in transforming business requirements to technical ETL requirements for IT consumption.
Work closely with analysts in the wider team to help them upskill in dashboard building and visualization(s).

 
About you 

Reporting and analytics experience (two years) with Tableau is essential
Expertise in SQL servers
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure. 
Proficient knowledge in IBM Cognos reporting suite
Strong understanding of Data modelling e.g. Kimball, Data Vault
Strong verbal and written communication skills and prime stakeholder management capability

 
Benefits & Culture:
In addition to the salary offered, HCF have a number of employee benefits including:

Discounts on health insurance and other insurances
Family and friends day
Study leave
Parental leave scheme
Developmental opportunities
Comprehensive training and ongoing support

We believe in developing our people to assist in driving continuous improvement within the organisation. At the same time we are dedicated to creating a working culture where staff members can flourish. We work hard to ensure that all our positions are challenging and rewarding, where you can utilise and further develop your skills to truly make a difference.
If you think you have what it takes to join HCF, apply now!

Summary  The Supply Chain Business Analyst is the custodian of the Supply Chain Excellence Analytics for ANZ cluster. This role entails being the lead analyst for the Supply Chain Organisation supporting functional leaders and branches to guide Supply chain improvement activities focusing on KPI analytics, process optimization, governance and controls. Reporting to the Supply Chain Excellence Manager and working directly/indirectly with other in-country stakeholders, the incumbent is responsible for producing cyclical financial KPI reporting, process engineering and providing oversight on supply chain controls aligned to MAPS, SOX and GFM. Essential Job Functions  Collaborate with Supply chain leads and process owners to identify and drive functional process improvements Deploy standardised financial Supply Chain KPI’s for all branches and 3PL’s Develop and setup a central database/process for gathering and consolidating data from branches for inventory, expense and CAPEX. Inventory, E&O and CAPEX at SKU level, including but not limited to: stock value/quantity, near-expiry and quarantine stock, un-deployed instrument sets, consignment inventory, excess stock, etc. Analyze data periodically to identify and recommend optimization opportunities for selected branches, resulting in inventory turns improvement, cost optimization, stock-health optimization, service level increase, etc. Conduct training and provide the support needed to internal stakeholders to extend improvement initiatives to distribution facilities and supply chain functions regionally Act as Custodian for all governance and controls facilitation and reporting pertaining to internal and external financial audits Support the Supply Chain Excellence Manager in implementing the regional Supply Chain Excellence initiatives, by providing required reports, communication packs, special analysis, recommendations, working closely with markets, etc. Support project leaders and project team members of assigned projects as required Create and implement processes and methods to automate data gathering and analysis of regional and country Supply Chain KPIs, including but not limited to: Service Levels, Warehouse Excellence KPIs, etc. Develop and deploy relevant training material pertaining to SC Excellence, Supply Chain Finance analytics and continuous Improvement. Education:  Tertiary qualifications in Commerce, Finance or related disciplines Supply Chain certifications (such as APICS), desirable Experience  At least 5 years’ of relevant industry experience in supply chain analytics and/or financial analysis Technical Knowledge & Competencies:  Strong understanding Lean or 6S methodology, desirable Good understanding of Supply Chain processes and Supply Chain performance metrics Above average analytical abilities Solid finance and business acumen Subject matter expert in Supply Chain analytic / databases and designing dashboards Advanced Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint Discipline with deadlines Attention to detail Problem-solving aptitude Applications To apply, please ensure that you include a cover letter addressing it to Talent Acquisition Lead ANZ. You have a deep understanding for credit risk measurement and control frameworks and are able to set these up from scratch using first principle thinking. You're self-motivated, highly organised and focused on impact. You're comfortable with ambiguity and can think from first principles. You have strong analytical skills (previous experience of SQL  R, Python, SAS, VBA and similar are a plus). Proven retail or non-retail credit risk modelling or model validation experience. Excellent tertiary qualifications in actuarial, statistics, econometric or other related quantitative discipline.  Excellent written and inter-personal communication skills, particularly the ability to explain complicated issues in an efficient and effective manner. You should have demonstrated an ability to communicate with influence  ****Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted for this role; however we do keep applications on file for future opportunities.

salary: Great salary, fantastic training and development
job_description: DiUS is an Australian technology consultancy possessing 15 years within the Australian Market. We're neither a body shop, nor a product house. Developing a relationship with DiUS as a client means becoming part of the DiUS family. We work with some of Australia's largest companies, but also actively seek the opportunity to partner with innovative startups to help them along the path to becoming fully fledged businesses.   About you: - You are proficient at working in the realm of deep learning with a strong background in the more classical forms of machine learning. - You have a PhD degree in Machine Learning and are looking to apply your expertise to build valuable, commercial applications using ML & DL. - You stay informed of the latest developments in state-of-the-art ML algorithms, in terms of research papers & open-source code. - You have experience working with ML frameworks: Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow, Pytorch. - You have experience either in academia or from industry in some of the specific areas of:   Computer vision (using CNN): object detection (Retinanet, YOLOv3), instance segmentation (Mask-RCNN), semantic segmentation (UNet), pose estimation (PoseNet), image classification (ResNet).   NLP (using RNN): sentiment analysis (BERT, ULMFIT)   Structured/Tabular data: regression and classification (Random forest, Logistic Regression)   Deep reinforcement learning (DQN, PG)    - You are willing and able to assist with new client engagements, to investigate technical feasibility, help identify success metrics and provide input into product delivery roadmaps. - You have some familiarity with data engineering and a willingness to spend time working with data. - You have experience in productionizing or deploying your models to cloud platforms. - You have an interest in learning how a software product can best be developed for a client while being part of a cross-functional agile team. - Bonus: You are active in the ML/DL community, happy to present to clients, and at community events   What DiUS can provide:   - the chance to further develop your deep expertise in ML & DL working with peers of a similar background. - an environment with a learning mindset where you are contributing to a useful outcome while also learning new skills from those around you. - a tailored training program for example in terms of developing consulting & presentation skills

When everything’s connected, how we connect is everything … and we’d like to connect with you too!  We’re looking for a Business Analyst with TTEC in Sydney, Australia.About TTEC:We help global brands provide a great experience to their customers, build customer loyalty, and grow their business. Your role brings that principle to life.Life at TTEC:As a global company, we’re always on. When one of us is going to bed, a coworker half-way around the world has already had their coffee (or tea) and is ready to grab the baton and run with it. We work at a fast pace around here and we’re not one for keeping the status quo. But just because we’re busy, it doesn’t mean we don’t know how to have fun. We’re passionate about throwing company events that bring us together to laugh and celebrate each other’s achievements. We’re also big on taking time out for professional development and giving back. So, if you’re looking for a work-life full of purpose, passion and career potential, keep reading… What you’ll be doing: Are you looking for an opportunity where you’ll bring your analytical skills to the table and provide recommendations to improve processes? Responsibilities include business evaluation, process development, business analysis, business modeling and report development. On a typical day, you’ll:  Develop and maintain national center operations data solutions that utilize Oracle, SQL, Access, Seagate Crystal Reports, and Excel Manage multiple complex business projects Develop new reports both proactively and in response to client request to improve operational efficiencies Maintain national database records and perform routine audits of data validating proper site, client, and project relationships Why you? What you bring: Connections are everything here at TTEC. That means we connect with our customers, our teammates and most importantly with you.  And the ability to connect yourself is what you bring to the table… along with the following:Experience in reporting (operations and financial)  1+ years call center or outsourcing experience SQL experience is required Database administration skills using Access and Oracle databases Ability to deliver high-quality results, on time and on target Ability to work cooperatively with stakeholders and team member to resolve the issues on hand Enjoy the excitement of a dynamic environment Exemplary communication skills to include written, verbal skills and superior listening skills Bachelor’s degree in a business related field or equivalent preferred As a TTEC Customer Experience Champion, you’ll enjoy:  Career-growth and lots of learning opportunities for aspiring minds Fun, talented and witty teammates Free breakfast 2 days a week! Free lunch on Tuesdays! Knowledgeable, encouraging, and present leadership Family-friendly environment Free-spirited, theme-based employee events Diverse and community-minded organization And yes…all the competitive pay, performance incentives, and benefits you’d expect And most importantly… a positive and optimistic attitude and outlook Apply Today:  Click on the Apply Now button. You’ve applied, now what? After successfully completing the online application, please make your communication lines are open and regularly check your email for instructions. Thank you for applying – it's time to share this opportunity with your network and experience the happiness of working with friends (besides us, of course). About IRI
At IRi we go beyond big data to supercharge our client’s growth and profitability. We use our leading technology platform and prescriptive analytic tools to deliver powerful market and consumer information, and end to end customised solutions – from insights to planning, targeting/optimization to activation/execution, all the way through to ROI measurement. Exceptional client service is a part of everything we do.
Role Overview
Confident in data analysis and communication, your role is to ensure that the wide range of data assets within IRI are 'fit for purpose' to be used in our products. You will assess existing and new data acquisition sources, including statistical design, weighting and projection of data. You will be involved in the formulation, testing and management of measures, analyses and models used within our products and solutions.
Who you are:
With a background in mathematics/ statistics with 4 years+ experience, you are passionate about consumer behaviour and enjoy working as part of project teams. You are confident in your ability to add value and enjoy problem solving.
What you’ll be doing: 
Own sampling, cleaning, and weighting processes with a goal of improvement in these where needed to ensure efficiency (quality data for Clients and / or reduced cost)
This will involve understanding data management processes, project management with IT and determining optimal data collection, cleaning and projection methodsBe a subject matter expert for the Client Service team by providing answers to data questions, answers to statistical questions and educating client service on aspects of AnalysisShape the future of our IRI Products through innovation in analysis models (for Clients), and adoption of new methods of data collection and or matching enabled by technology changes
What you need to bring:
Excellent time management skillsHigh level of integrityA can do attitudeThe ability to work independently and as part of a teamA passion for dataAn inquisitive nature

Life At IRI
We are passionate about facilitating a work environment that enables individuals to become the best version of themselves. Our people’s personal growth is a top priority.
Our leaders create a space where our people can perform meaningful work, whilst enjoying what they do and learning along the way. We value collaboration over lengthy processes or bureaucratic procedures, and we empower our people to resolve obstacles to performance.
Here are some of the great things we offer our people
Progressive learning and development programs to suit your individual needsA culture where creativity and curiosity is encouraged and we have the opportunity to learn, adapt and perform to our greatest potential.An opportunity to be a part of an exciting global company that leads the way when it comes to understanding our consumer market and the changes which impact how we behave and live.Access to our leading experts in the industry around Thought Leadership.Progressive benefits and initiatives that support not only our people but the community at large.Attractive salary packageFlexible working hoursCasual dress codeFree gym membership- with fitness classesGreat location – 5 minute walk to Rhodes Station

We are interviewing suitable candidates as they apply so if this role sounds suitable, send your CV through to us today!

job_title: Junior-Mid Level Data Engineer: AWS + Spark + Python
job_description: We are currently recruiting a Junior-Mid Level Data Engineer to work with big data, specifically; AWS, Apache Spark, EMR, Teradata, Python, possibly Scala and more.
