job_title: Technical Lead - Data Governance / Information Architecture
job_description:
As a Technical Lead - Data Governance / Information Architecture, you will have experience with decision making capabilities on technical architecture and solution design.
You will have experience in large complex enterprise data systems (including Data Acquisition/Movement, Data Governance, Data Lakes, Compute Provisioning, Reporting, Visualization and Data Science platforms) and have proven track record in simplification through automation of asset lifecycle management and enablement. 
You are always looking ahead to ensure your solutions fit in the bigger picture and the long-term strategy.  You are a provider of viable solutions aligned with industry best practices and emerging technologies. You lead others, participate and are accountable for implementation through the project lifecycle.

Identify value opportunities to exploit the domain or technology for maximum business effectiveness.

As a Product owner in collaboration with the Platform manager, customers and other stakeholders, develop the Technology Roadmap of assets you are accountable for.
Lead the improvement of automation practices and security in the team.
Define software quality practices and improve development processes.
Upskill and mentor developers of various experience & capability.
Participate in and support the rollout of continuous improvement initiatives.
Performance measurement and tuning

Skills, experience & qualifications

Experience with Data Governance Tools, such as Collibra and Reference Data Management Solutions (required)
Extensive experience in investigating, recommending and integrating/deploying third party solutions, including Vendor/Partner collaboration in areas including Data Governance, Reporting Tools, Data Lakes, distributed Compute and Visualisation (required) 
Demonstrated ownership and delivery of solutions which provide uplift to systems, processes, standards and ways of working.
Knowledge and experience with Agile Development practices, Test Driven Development & Continuous Integration.
Knowledge of ITIL and service management practices
Demonstrated passion for Service & User enablement and delivery
Demonstrated successful influencing and working with multiple stakeholders, both Technology and Business.
Experience with Cloud environments; compute, data and security related services

 So what's on offer

Flexible working arrangements 
Up to 25% off insurance, Banking, superannuation
Employee share scheme (permanent employees only)
Competitive salary and excellent employee benefits

BENEFITS  Be a part of the Earth's largest Cloud Platform organization Clear and defined career progression, training & certifications + much more Subsidised Healthcare, Sign-on bonus, Stock & Shares, Paid commuting to work, subsidised mobile phone allowance DESCRIPTIONAmazon has built a reputation for excellence with recent examples of being named #1 in customer service, #1 most trusted, and #2 most innovative. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is carrying on that tradition while leading the world in Cloud technologies. AWS Premium Support provides global technical support to a wide range of external customers as they build mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.Our Big Data teams specialise in helping customers with streaming, storing and processing vast amounts of data in the Cloud. We also help our customers to leverage this data to produce business insights, which may include using Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence (ML/AI) while our engineers focus on helping customers use and integrate services in what is arguably our industry’s most exciting space. The portfolio of services covers EMR (Hadoop), DynamoDB (NoSQL), ElasticSearch, Kinesis, Athena, ML/AI & more. With a global presence in many countries, our follow the sun support and shift model mean you will not be on-call!We are seeking talented Cloud & Systems engineers who are well versed in maintaining large complex systems/clusters. You will be able to write code to automate maintenance, monitor performance or crunch data to solve business problems. We invest heavily in knowledge acquisition and skills development providing unlimited opportunities for technical and career development. Drive customer interactions through: Phone, Chat, Emails, Screen shares and conference calls. Leverage your customer support experience to provide feedback to internal AWS teams on how to improve our services. Interact with leading technologists around the world.   BASIC QUALIFICATIONS To qualify for this role, you should have the following experience:   Strong Linux/Unix system administrator skills. Intermediate programming/scripting skills. Ideally in Java or Python, but will consider experience in other Object Oriented and Functional languages. Understanding of networking principles and ability to troubleshoot (DNS, TCP/IP, HTTP). Foundation knowledge of databases and Structured Query Language (SQL). Understanding of Virtualization and/or cloud computing. Good understanding of security best practices. Impeccable written & oral communication skills.  Exceptional customer focus / customer service experience.  Good understanding of distributed computing environments and methodologies. Ability to work a staggered week, either Sun-Thu or Tue-Sat (no on-call)   PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS These qualifications are optional, but please highlight them on your resume if you have them:   B.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science, MIS, CIS, or a related field. Experience in either software development or technical support. Demonstrable knowledge & experience in various Big Data or distributed systems. Such as Hadoop, NoSQL, Search and Streaming Experience with Cloud Services and Cloud deployments. Exposure specifically to AWS is a bonus Experience utilising data analysis techniques such as quantitative or qualitative analysis Ability to work in a fast paced and agile development environment

job_title: Asset Valuation & Data Management, Macquarie Asset Management
job_description:
A fantastic entry-level opportunity for you to join our Macquarie Asset Management group as an Asset Valuation and Data Management Associate on a contract basis. Supporting our successful Asset Management business, you will be joining the team responsible for the daily valuation of securities, performing the static creation, maintenance & data quality controls and performing valuation validation control in adherence to Asset Management Pricing Policy.
You will be assisting in the daily valuation of securities across all listed and OTC securities for a wide range of security types. You will need to leverage your understanding of standard methodologies used for valuation of assets as you will be required to perform valuation validation controls and checks on all security prices. In addition to this you will be performing static creation, maintenance and enrichment process for data domains managed by the teams as well as assisting in the maintenance and review of benchmark levels used for portfolio performance reporting purposes. You will also be managing administration of business users for accesses to external websites and portals.
To be successful in this role, it is desirable to have overall post-qualification experience with a financial institution, preferable working in a Reference Data or Pricing team for a Global Custodian or an Asset Manager. You will have excellent communication skills and ability to adhere to strict team service level agreement with clients. You are also someone with a team orientated approach coupled with good organisational skills and attention to detail. Prior system experience in Blackrock Aladdin, Simcorp Dimension, Markit, Thinkfolio, Bloomberg, EaglePace, PEGA etc is desirable but is not a requirement for this role.
If you have excellent time management skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, please apply now.
Macquarie Asset Management (MAM; formerly known as Macquarie Funds Group) is a full-service asset manager, offering a diverse range of products including securities investment management, infrastructure and real asset management, and fund and equity-based structured products.
MAM comprises the following three divisions:  • Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets  • Macquarie Investment Management  • Macquarie Specialised Investment Solutions.
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team. Find out more about Macquarie at www.macquarie.com/about

job_title: Business Analyst - Counterparty Lifecycle Management team
job_description:
A great opportunity exists for a proactive and experienced Business Analyst to join our Counterparty Lifecycle Management team in Sydney on a 12 months contract and add value as a team player during a busy period of change.
The key to success in this role will be in the delivery of initiatives within scope and on time whilst ensuring quality objectives are achieved with high stakeholder satisfaction.
In this role you will work closely with internal stakeholders across operations, legal, technology and so on. You will gather, analyse and document business requirements and analysis operational impacts and facilitate solutions. In addition to this you will effectively manage and deliver projects in an agile environment, ensure strong communication channels are established and maintained, and manage project inter-dependencies, risks, issues, financials and benefits realisation. You will be identifying and resolving risks and issues impacting projects and planning and managing business test lifecycles from User Acceptance through to Post Implementation.
The ideal candidate will have experience in working in agile delivery, a confident approach to defining new business and a proven track record of identifying process improvements and seeing these through to delivery. Ideally you will have prior proven experience as a business analyst or experience in a project management role delivering successful projects.  
If you have strong analytical abilities and can engage with stakeholders on a senior level whilst maintaining the ability to work with Subject Matter Experts on detail and if you have the ability to prioritise your work schedule and deliver to tight deadlines under pressure, please apply now.
The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Market Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, Brand & Marketing and the Macquarie Group Foundation.

Rabobank is the world’s leading specialist in food and agribusiness banking. One of our key strengths lies in our people who have a deep understanding of agriculture and are committed to adding long-term value for clients. Our commitment to our employees and customers is at the heart of everything we do.   We are currently looking for an experienced Analyst to join our Enterprise Risk Management team. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Risk Analytics & Reporting, this role is responsible for providing the risk analytical and reporting needs within Rabobank Australia & New Zealand, ensuring that risk reporting is aligned to and supports enterprise key risks and risk appetite statements. Working closely with your manager, you will ensure that economic, regulatory capital and provisioning are calculated accurately and drivers of movement are analysed.   To be successful in this role you would have a good understanding of credit risk modelling (incl. capital, provisioning and stress testing). You will also be familiar with Australian and New Zealand regulatory requirements, with a sound knowledge of data warehouse and business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and analytical tools such as SAS, SQL or R.   How do people describe you? You thrive working within a team environment, have great rapport with others and have great organisation, time management, and analytical skills.   This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a unique culture for a great banking brand who is one of the market leaders in the agri lending space.   At Rabobank, we’re committed to a culture where diversity and inclusion is valued, respected and encouraged. We welcome applicants from diverse cultures, faith and sexual orientation.   Rabobank is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role.   For more information about the role, please visit our website – www.rabobank.com.au/careers

icare is currently seeking an experienced Senior Data Scientist for end to end model development work and leading a team of Junior Data Scientists.

Excellent opportunity in our Analytics and Data Science team
Newly created, Permanent opportunity
Attractive remuneration package

We’re looking for someone to play a strategic role and contribute to industry-leading performance through new and creative analytical models, employing the latest methods for machine learning.
You’ll be working with a diverse mix of collaborative, innovative and respectful people who really care about making a difference for people and the NSW community. You will have a mind for getting things done and a heart for people and you will set the bar high through the quality of the work you do and the people-oriented decisions you make.
You’ll bring your degree qualification and experience in mathematics or statistics or computing science as well as a solid experience developing and deploying Data Science solutions. You have expert knowledge and experience in predictive analytics using statistical and machine learning algorithms using SAS, R, Python or similar. The ability to write code for data wrangling and model development is essential. Software development lifecycle knowledge and knowledge of insurance industry are desirable.
It’s an exciting environment where no two days are the same. But on a typical day you might find yourself: providing secretarial assistance to the Manager

leading a team of junior data scientists as well as hands on work including building models and providing insights
providing thought leadership and insights on results and explaining to stakeholders how data science can improve strategic outcomes
understanding stakeholder requirements, setting expectations and ensuring transparent communication
designing and launching innovative and complex analytic models
contributing to the establishment of a dynamic yet stable data science infrastructure and shape and drive data driven initiatives
responsible for key projects within the business including end-to-end project management and delivery.

We’re a new kind of organisation, one that’s as supportive and socially conscious as it is agile and explorative. Our DNA of commercial mind and social heart captures who we are at our core.
If you think you’re the right person for this role, send us your resume (up to 5 pages). Don’t delay as we’re assessing applications as they are received. We’d love to hear how your capabilities, achievements and experience set you apart.
We know our strength comes from the diversity of our people and so we want people with different experiences and backgrounds to apply. We recognise the importance of balance and flexibility and understand that it’s not a one size fits all approach, so we’d be happy to talk about and consider your specific needs.
If there are any accessibility adjustments you need to help you be able to apply for this role, or if you require any further information about the role, please contact Ben Duffield on (02) 9216 3751 for a chat.
Please note that you must be an Australian citizen or a permanent resident of Australia or a New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand passport to apply for this role.

job_title: Senior SQL Server Data Platform Consultant
job_description: We are looking for a talented Microsoft SQL Server Data Platform consultant to join our team in Sydney.  We have a varied and interesting client base throughout the region, serving clients through all states of Australia, New Zealand, PNG, Fiji and the Oceania region. Help each client maximise the value of our service.  Work with multiple clients and stakeholders at all levels. Act as the primary assigned technical consultant to certain customers. job_title: Risk Analyst - Modelling & Portfolio (12mth Fixed Term Contract)
job_description: Exciting and rare opportunity Winning company culture Australian and New Zealand company with Global influence Custom Fleet is Australia and New Zealand’s leading fleet management company, harnessing technology to connect businesses with where they need to be – safely and efficiently. Our next-generation technology enables seamless mobility and smart analytics across our services, while our fleet financing helps customer cost-effectively and sustainably grow their business. What is it like to work for Custom Fleet? At Custom Fleet, our unifying purpose is ‘to connect you to where you want to be’. Our Way of Working (WoWs) are to be Customer Centric, Collaborative, Innovative, Accountable, and Passionate, and it was great to see in our recent employee engagement survey these WoWs resonated most with our employee’s experience at work, along with Custom Fleet being an inclusive, fun, and fair workplace. We offer a range of 'Custom Perks' including a reward and recognition program, volunteer and community engagement opportunities, social events, an extra week of annual leave, employee discounts portal, wellbeing leave, and a commitment to investing in our people. About the role In the role of Risk Analyst, you will be responsible for monitoring asset portfolio health and managing the ongoing improvement to Custom Fleet’s risk data models and adhering to model governance. The role will be required to provide technical support and guidance to the wider residual value risk team and with the development of risk models. Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities  Update residual values (RV) & maintenance models Develop portfolio reports and risk models (RV model, maintenance budget models and credit risk models). Extracting, manipulating and analysing large volumes of data across multiple streams of risk including but not limited to RV, maintenance, securitisation and credit risk.   Review credit risk models, RV models and maintenance models and investigate changes to improve model stability and performance Assist with preparation of the quarterly RV reviews Perform user acceptance testing of updated RV and maintenance grids in lease quoting and management system. Support regular reporting requirements by providing insights and commentary on monthly gain/loss on sale reporting, portfolio composition and provide early warning on concentration limit breaches. Assist with nonstandard RV and maintenance requests as required What does our successful candidate look like?  Strong technical skills (statistical modelling and programming). Strong communications skills to provide senior management with insights and recommendations. Data analytics experience. At least 2 years experience in SAS programming or Oracle SQL (mandatory). At least 2 years experience in practical statistics model building and data mining (mandatory). Strong SQL query language knowledge. Strong VBA and Excel knowledge. PowerPoint presentation skills. Desirable Qualifications/Requirements   Degree with strong analytical/statistical and data management focus such as: data science, mathematics, statistics, actuarial studies etc.  Auto industry experience  Statistical education background  To apply, please send us your Resume and Cover Letter by clicking ‘Apply Now’. Please note we review applications as they come in, so if you think you are our next Risk Analyst it is best to submit your application as soon as possible!

These include; Government, Telecommunications, Commercial and Finance. We currently have more than 1200 consultants assisting our clients across Australia and are continuing to grow at a rapid pace. Through the delivery of services and implementation of new systems, processes and technology, we assist our clients to gain competitive advantage and reach new heights.Job Reference – S38

You will provide financial advice regarding productivity and efficiency opportunities to enable the practice services group to undertake profit improvement opportunities. You will review operating results and complete variance analytics and well as identify and maximise drivers of profit and cash flow. job_title: Senior Manager Fraud Technologies - Fraud Data Analytics
job_description:
Analytics and big data are changing the world. At CommBank we understand this and have significant focus on using the power of data and analytics to provide unique customer experiences and to transform our business.  We are searching for a Senior Manager to oversee the design of the Group’s fraud analytics platform. Your leadership and vision will bring new data science and automation techniques to Fraud Analytics, providing step-change improvements in fraud detection
Our Company
Commbank is Australia’s leading provider of financial services including retail, premium, business and institutional banking, funds management, superannuation, insurance, investment and share broking products and services. We are a business with more than 800,000 shareholders and over 52,000 employees.
The Direct Channels Analytics & Strategy team, part of Retail Banking Services, drives the Group’s innovation in fraud management. The team supports the operations of Group Fraud Management Services and Group Investigations, responsible for the protection of CommBank’s customers and monetary assets from fraud and financial loss.
At CommBank, we’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce reflecting the customers, businesses and communities we serve. As a values driven organisation, we nurture and support our people; through focusing on skill and talent development, collaboration, flexibility and internal promotion. With service in mind at every touch point, we take accountability for the role we play in securing and enhancing the financial wellbeing of people, businesses and communities. At CommBank you can be you! 
Our Team
Fraud Analytics is responsible for developing and enhancing the Group’s fraud detection systems, algorithms, and reporting engines. Our analytics run on Australia’s largest real-time transaction monitoring system, handling many millions of transactions per day.
Key functions of Fraud Analytics include:

Maintaining the Group’s fraud detection algorithms through intelligent automation.
Studying emerging fraud trends.
Developing advanced models of fraud behaviour.
Reporting fraud losses across the Group’s products and channels.

Fraud Technologies is responsible for the design of the Group’s fraud analytics platform, enabling the efficient and robust execution of fraud analysis procedures.
What You’ll Do
You will report to the Executive Manager, Fraud Analytics. Your direct reports will be the Manager Data Science and the Manager Intelligent Automation, the two sub-teams within Fraud Technologies.
Specific accountabilities of the role include:

Collaborate across the business to deeply understand requirements for efficient and robust fraud analysis.
With this understanding, lead the design of the fraud analytics platform, including its rule and model pipelines.
Maximise the end-to-end automation of the fraud analytics platform, further reducing its risk profile.
Lead the production of a portfolio of fraud models that comply with Group Model Policy requirements.
Create, articulate and implement a world class fraud technology roadmap that continuously lifts fraud detection.
Manage and motivate a team of analytics professionals to deliver your agenda at high performance.
Champion the culture and processes that drive innovation across the Fraud Analytics team.

You
You are a creative and innovative thinker with a proven track record of building and leading successful technology teams in the fraud domain.You communicate your ideas simply and create clarity.  A collaborator and an influencer, you are  able to articulate and realise a vision for fraud technology within a large organisation. You have extensive experience developing large scale analytics platforms utilising SAS and Python. Big data experience is your DNA and you back it up with both SQL and Hadoop and possibly Pega as well. We would love to hear from you if you incorporate the above with an advanced data science capability and software engineering experience.

salary: Attractive Daily Rate based on Exp!
job_description: We are interviewing right now, for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join a high performing team with a focus on scaling and optimising machine learning models in production & POC big data environments (Apache Spark + AWS primarily). Initial 6 month contract with good potential to extend Very attractive daily rate Interesting problems to solve (e.g. large-scale transformation, not a small incremental improvement) with actual big data Some great peers in engineering, data science and downstream analytics teams This could be a perfect role for a you if you find yourself in hybrid data science-data engineering roles    At this time, we are only able to consider applicants with current Australian work rights.   Please apply via the links or reach out for much more information to Patrick Choy at Patrick@TalentInsights.com.au with a message, a CV or Cover Letter.

You will work closely with the Sales and Marketing teams, Stakeholders, Channel Partners and Vendors to manage growth and profitability for your portfolio.  The Role:  The right candidate for this role will be a self-starter. Able to formulate their own plan, understand and help deliver the Vendor Blueprint. Extensive and proven Channel Sales experience is absolutely crucial to this role.You will need comprehensive Commercial Product Manager experience within the Data Centre Infrastructure space - not necessarily in a specialised Vendor Manager role. Working within a highly Agile and successful organisation, you will be nimble enough to think outside the box and own your space within the company, delivering maximum profitability.  Your relationship management skills, commercial mindset and industry acumen will ensure that you can hit the ground running. Offering an expansive, fluid approach and ability to manage very large scale accounts.  You will have tenacity, and a desire toward leadership. An ability to inspire the people around you, and show empathy are essential requirements for this role.  Essential Requirements Vendor Strategy  Lead the development of the vendor strategy (Vendor Blue Print) in collaboration with engineering, sales and marketing. Share final blue print with relevant stakeholders Establish strategic priorities, key initiatives and measurable outcomes that are aligned to objectives set by the vendor Develop and co-ordinate the execution of activity plans with marketing, engineering and sales Ensure activity and sales performance is recorded and reported to internal stake holders and to the vendor on a regular basis. Preparation and running of quarterly or half-yearly business reviews (QBRs/HBRs), including preparation and presentation of content. Ensure the vendor plans have appropriate resourcing and funding to achieve maximum vendor profitability e.g.: by achieving KPI rebates  Vendor Business Development  Be the subject matter expert for the vendor’s channel program and technology Establish priorities in relation to growing market share and developing new business (as part of your vendor strategy) Communicate with the sales, operations and finance teams regarding technology updates, promotions, new products, webex sessions etc Enable our sales team so that our CDMs can sell into the channel via the vendor’s key partners Understand and report on competitive vendors and distributors Support the Vendor Business Manager to deliver the elements of vendor cross-sell and up-sell  Own the launch of new vendor programs and products into the business, ensuring all relevant parts of the business know what they need to do  Reseller recruitment/management  If recruitment is part of the vendor strategy, establish a list of development partners for recruit/accelerate activity Assist the CDM with the vendor-specific business activity plans with development partners – using the BAP template provided Promote and drive deal registration across partners Identify opportunities to execute vendor LEEP campaigns for Land and Expand Identify opportunities to attach Channel Services Develop campaigns to attach Channel Services and similar to LEEP, bring together the relevant people to build the campaign Vendor sales forecast gap analysis and cross-referencing as required Assess vendor deal registration and pipeline reports and align to CDMs  Activity planning and execution  Increase market share and performance of product range through development and implementation of an activity/channel plan for each vendor Work with the Vendor MDF Administrator to ensure all proposed activities in the plan are in line with the vendor’s MDF program Manage all campaign execution with the support of the Marketing team, Sales Engineers and Channel Development Managers. Coordinate Use Salesforce for activity/campaign tracking Understand and follow digital marketing briefing processes and workflows to ensure the timely execution of any digital content as part of your activity plan.   Vendor MDF Management  In line with the vendor Blue Print, seek vendor funding to support the execution of the vendor’s channel activity plan (compliant with the vendor’s MDF program) Understand the vendors’ MDF program and maximise use of available funds for your campaigns. Work within the vendor’s MDF process and guidelines. Work with the MDF Administrator (located in the finance team) to manage all MDF requests and claims. Work within the internal MDF process and understand how to balance compliance with being creative.  Website/online marketing  Ensure the website content is up to date with current vendor marketing programs, promotions, training, events, webex sessions, product announcements, vendor logo branding etc (executed by the Digital Marketing team) Brief the campaign manager to develop e-newsletters and execute other e-marketing campaigns – comms plan  Relationship/Stakeholder Management   Establish and develop a business relationship with the vendor’s channel leadership, channel managers, marketing and sales (end user focused) teams Be fully informed on the vendor partner program and support all key elements of its execution across the business Facilitate and nurture relationship between vendor key resources – Sales, engineering, marketing, operations, internal sales, renewals and end user sales rep etc.  Culture  This is an incredible opportunity to connect with many different senior parties across the scope of your role. Expand your professional network and be visible.  There are amazing growth opportunities, with a clear progression plan, a range of great benefits and attractive remuneration package. If this role is of interest, please click ‘Apply Now’ or contact me for a confidential discussion

The Big Red Group (BRG) is a platform for ecommerce marketplaces, including RedBalloon, Adrenaline, Redii and Marketics (Albert AI). We want to shift the way people experience life by serving a customer an experience every second somewhere on earth. With the customer at the heart of everything we do, we are proud to be a place that does great work, and attracts exceptional talent. Every day we play to win.Due to a newly created division within the BRG, we are looking for a Business Development Manager to support the wider commercial B2B team. Supporting the Head of Sales & Product, you will assist in following up leads that are generated through our pipeline and fostering them through the sales pipeline. You will have the opportunity to own your own smaller accounts and support in the growth and development of these. You will be the face of the B2B and represent each of our brands by helping customers find the right product solution for their needs.To be successful in this role you must be self motivated and sales focused. You are happy being on the phone and believe in a high level of customer service, you will bring your energy to the team and our clients everyday. You can expect to see yourself, on the phone, creating decks for large sales opportunities, fulfilling client orders, working with suppliers for large orders or team experiences. You will need to have experience in a sales role, supporting a sales and marketing team and excellent attention to detail. You will be confident in developing solutions and pitching these to senior leaders within businesses. This is an exciting opportunity for someone to work in a multi-brand environment allowing them exposure to a wider sales role which will give them opportunities for strategic thinking and take the next step in their career! What you will do...  Respond to and qualify inbound phone, email enquiries and service leads for all BRG brands new & existing corporate clients Outbound sales, calling warm leads or previous clients to generate business and retain great client relationships Practice a consultative sales approach, not a one size fits all solution for each corporate client, including online demos, presentations, proposals and order processing. . Identify stakeholders (influencers and the decision makers). Confidently sell to Senior HR Management and Executives by demonstrating depth of knowledge on the financial and cultural impacts of recognition. Managing the input of information into Salesforce and helping evolve the lead process for the B2B team, ensuring there is data integrity within the system Build strong relationships with your assigned clients, including face-to-face meetings Work with Customer team to troubleshoot and resolve any issues Reporting, preparing client insights, case studies Work within a small team to ensure overall business success is the ultimate goal. What you will bring...  Ability to thrive and work under pressure in a fast-paced start-up environment without compromising attention to detail Experience in sales, channel manager or client facing role in a product, SaaS or B2B based role You will have experience selling solutions into SMEs, you are ambitious, strategic, organized and entrepreneurial with a flair for generating and cultivating relationships Demonstrated experience in meeting sales targets, retaining clients and presenting solutions that inspire clients. Experience using Hubspot, Salesforce or Marketo lead management and nurture cycles Passion for experiences, team engagement and recognition The good stuff… At the BRG, our purpose is to shift the way people experience life. So when it comes to our people we want to shift the way they experience life, at work. Our employee benefits (below) are a meaningful reflection of this purpose, and the chance to be part of an established yet high-growth business is something that keeps our people engaged and determined to win every day.  3 paid 'Volunteer Days' to give back to the community through our 1% pledge Commitment to professional development at all levels of the organisation A competitive compensation and incentive plan New Sydney CBD offices Monthly social and wellness events Flexible work arrangements Annual three-day company trip Generous discount on all experiences If you think this sounds like the perfect role for you apply today to begin your journey with the BRG! www.thebigredgroup.com.au We are an equal opportunity employer. No agencies please - we got this! To learn more about the industry we work in - check out the information on our upcoming whitepaper release all about The Experience Economy (video below)!

job_title: Risk Manager, Data Governance, Institutional Banking and Markets
job_description:
You are flexible and resilient in ever changing circumstances
We are a creative, innovative and high performing Risk team
Together we can be the best we can be

Do work that matters
Risk Management Institutional Banking & Markets (IB&M) forms part of the Group Risk Management division, and specifically, it provides Institutional Banking & Markets (IB&M) businesses with specialist risk services and advice.
This role encompasses multiple accountabilities pertaining supporting the development of IB&M’s data governance capability.
See yourself in our team
IB&M is one of the client facing business groups within the Bank and is responsible for managing the Group’s relationships with major corporate, government clients, institutional investors, provides a full range of capital raising, transactional and risk management products and services.
In any given week you will
As a Risk Manager with a Data Governance focus you will be tasked in contributing to the development of the data management function within IB&M Risk Management by supporting the business in defining, managing, sharing and governing its critical data elements.
This includes:

Supporting the IB&M Risk Management Data Steward by working with senior stakeholders across IB&M and Risk Management to implement Policy & Standards through Data Governance; ensuring information remains trusted, compliant and secured.
Working with the CBA Group Data Office (GDO) by assisting in implementing APRA Practise guides relating to Data Risk – CPG235 / BCBS 239
Facilitating business stakeholders to define ownership of Critical Data Elements and maintaining the Critical Data Elements (CDEs) Register as well as mapping data lineage for those CDEs across systems.
Facilitate data quality control creation to ensure monitoring of CDEs via reporting
Assisting with development of data standards, data dictionaries and other documentation specific to and fit-for-purpose for IB&M
Co-ordinating and assisting with production of content for senior forums.
Support the production of reporting for Group Data Governance Committee and Group Data Stewards Committe

Your path looks like 
If you live and breathe the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great career opportunities both within the Risk Management leadership team and beyond in the wider CommBank Group. We’ll help you find the next step that’s right for you and enable you to be your best.
We're interested in hearing from people who:

Substantial experience at a major financial institution
Research, analytical and problem solving skills
Familiarity with institutional credit origination, decisioning policies and processes
Understanding of Operational risk with a data focus.
Knowledge of institutional banking and markets products & business processes
Knowledge of risk, lending and product systems
Ability to co-ordinate multiple projects at one time and manage completing timelines
Exposure to process improvement initiatives and experience in coordinating system/process changes
Experience with business analysis and requirements elicitation and management

At CommBank, we’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce reflecting the customers, businesses and communities we serve. As a value’s driven organisation, we nurture and support our people; through focusing on skill and talent development, collaboration, flexibility and internal promotion. With service in mind at every touch point, we take accountability for the role we play in securing and enhancing the financial wellbeing of people, businesses and communities. At CommBank you can be you.

Company Overview:   Southern Cross University’s (SCU) branch campuses in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth offer international students the opportunity to study at one of Australia's highly ranked and innovative public universities in three of Australia's most popular international student destinations. Young, progressive and connected, SCU offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs in accounting, business administration and information technology with a strong focus on producing career-ready graduates. The Southern Cross University branch campuses are part of EduCo International Group, a diversified, post-secondary education company dedicated to helping international students achieve their academic and career goals. EduCo manages and operates private colleges and works with public and not-for-profit universities in growing the student community and the creation of specialised on-campus pathway programs in Australia, Canada, Ireland and the United States. EduCo conducts academic courses on behalf of Southern Cross University at Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. The Role:   The Business and Administration Manager is a newly created position with the purpose of ensuring that the Company’s SCU Partnership operations, projects and improvement initiatives are executed smoothly, including:  drafting and executing plans and tasks; assigning work to various project team members, organizing workflow, and coordinating SCU management meetings; all expenses are within the operating budget; drafting and presenting reports to executives.  Reporting to the SVP, SCU Partnerships, the role is central to the coordination and execution of policy and process improvements, and coordinates with the broader EduCo Group on business policies, processes and financial delegation requirements as well as SCU Parent Campus’s partnership requirements. Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities:    Management of SVP SCU Partnership email and expense claims Manage the Management/Executive reporting cycle with and from stakeholders of relevant EduCo entities and departments Progress tracking for OGSM goals and measures Coordination & scheduling of meetings and presentations/town halls to track OGSM measures/goals Development and maintenance of ongoing data dashboards, and reconcile with all other data sources and reports Administration and project management support for all regulatory submissions Note taking, preparation of Minutes, Action Items etc. Formatting and presentation responsibility Project management of annual report submissions SharePoint Administrator for EduCo SCU Partnership Coordination of corporate company maintenance documents Maintaining the current filing and database system, and looking for ways to improve current systems  Coordination and monitoring of all SCU Branch Campus site activities (renovations, event planning etc.) Updating and recording all organizational changes and business development initiatives within SCU Partnership Qualifications, Experience & Technical Skills:    Proven experience in Administration management positions Strong communication (written and verbal) An understanding of project management principles is highly regarded Familiarity with financial and facilities management principles In-depth understanding of office management procedures and legislation Tertiary qualifications in business administration or relevant field Proficient in Microsoft Office suite skills (Word, Excel, PPT, Visio) Proficient in CRM, namely Sales Force Previous experience in a tertiary education sector is an advantage but not essential Experience with business writing including reporting and presentations. In return we offer a range of great benefits, including work variety, workplace flexibility and leave options, learning and development opportunities, and study support. EduCo prides itself on being a great place to work.   If you are looking for an exciting and challenging role as a Business and Administration Manager, please submit your resume and cover letter.  As an equal opportunity employer, EduCo values employee diversity and we are committed to building a more inclusive workplace. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community. Only people with the right to work in Australia may apply for this position Due to high volume of applications only a handful of selected applicants will be contacted for interviews. Thank you

Rabobank is the world’s leading specialist in food and agribusiness banking. One of our key strengths lies in our people who have a deep understanding of agriculture and are committed to adding long-term value for clients. Our commitment to our employees and customers is at the heart of everything we do.   We are currently looking for an experienced Senior Manager to join our Enterprise Risk Management team. Reporting to the Head of Enterprise Risk Management, this role is responsible for managing the risk, analytical and reporting needs within Rabobank Australia and New Zealand. You will be working with the wider team to develop an effective risk analytical framework to support the performance of the Agribusiness portfolio while ensuring risk reporting is aligned to and supports enterprise key risks and risk appetite statements.   To be successful in this role you would have a good understanding of credit risk modelling (incl. capital, provisioning and stress testing), ideally from large company enterprise wide operations. You will also have familiarity of Australian and New Zealand regulatory requirements, with a sound knowledge of BIS II requirements and using data warehouse and business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and analytical tools such as SAS, SQL or R.   How do people describe you? We welcome applicants from diverse cultures, faith and sexual orientation.   Rabobank is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role. Salary Package: A competitive salary package commensurate with skills and experience will be negotiated with the successful applicant
Appointment Type:  Full-time, continuing 

The RoleThe Office of the Vice-President, University Services and Strategy, is seeking an experienced Director of Business Intelligence to lead the design and delivery of information solutions at Macquarie University.
Reporting to the Vice-President, University Services and Strategy, you will:

Lead the development and implementation of a University-wide data and information strategy including data governance, data life cycle management and data policy development in alignment with the University’s strategic direction.
Build, direct and oversee the growth and development of a data analytics and governance function that supports the University in its information and business intelligence requirements.
Develop and lead a high performing team capable of supporting business partners in creating and/or specifying data solutions for a range of university-wide reporting requirements.
Collaborate cross-functionally and influence at all levels of the organisation to drive successful adoption and integration of advanced analytics that leverages large disparate data sets to uncover reliable, fact-based external and internal insights that drive decision making and growth.
Partner with senior management to understand and interpret University policy, structure, processes and data to inform the development and prioritisation of project initiatives.
Direct the scoping, prioritising and oversight of all BI based solutions and support the ongoing improvement of data collection, management and analytics. 

About YouYou will lead, design and deliver data analytics solutions to support the University’s overall strategic direction. You will possess exceptional leadership skills to develop a high performing team, collaborate to achieve shared goals and enjoy working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. 
You will have the ability to strongly communicate, build and manage effective relationships across the University with a wide range of stakeholders. Additionally, you will partner with senior management to deliver outstanding results that expand growth.  
You will efficiently prioritise, plan and manage multiple tasks in a timely manner and ensure a high level of service. You will be passionate, self-driven and articulate, whilst maintaining a professional demeanour and ideally, have experience in a similar role. 
About UsThe Vice-President, University Services and Strategy provides executive leadership of the University Services and Strategy portfolio and oversees the coordination and execution of a range of University initiatives.
Macquarie is a University engaged with the real and often complex problems and opportunities that define our lives. Since our foundation 54 years ago, we have aspired to be a different type of University. Over the years, we’ve grown to become the centre of a vibrant local and global community. Connect with us today.
To ApplyTo be considered for this position, please apply online and attach your resume and a separate cover letter that outlines how you meet the selection criteria below:

Degree qualified in a Science, Technology, Machine Learning, Engineering or Mathematics discipline.
At least 8 -10 years of experience working in business intelligence/data analytics.
Proven understanding and track record of modern Business Intelligence tools.
Experience leading a cross-functional team including data scientists and analysts.
Demonstrated track record in producing tangible and actionable insights and recommendations to a broad range of executives and stakeholders.
Experience developing solutions using large volumes of data, creating predictive models using BI technology/applications, and using applied statistical analysis such as regression, classification and clustering.

For further information regarding this role please view the position description below:
Position description:Director, Business Intelligence & Reporting.pdf
Specific Enquiries: casey.minissale@mq.edu.au
General HR Enquiries: samantha.poulos@mq.edu.au
Applications Close: Tuesday, 7 May 2019 at 11:55pm (AEST)
Location: Macquarie University, North Ryde NSW 2109
You will be required to undertake a criminal check. 
Macquarie University is committed to Equity, Diversity and Inclusion. We value individual difference and recognise the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where the backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of our staff are a driving force for collaboration, innovation and impact. 
We work to ensure genuine equality of opportunity for people regardless of their gender, age, cultural background, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and/or family status, and we encourage you to apply for a position at Macquarie University.

advertiser: JACOBS DOUWE EGBERTS AU PTY LTD
job_description: As a key member of our ANZ HR team, you will have the opportunity to work both collaboratively and autonomously. We value professionalism, delivery and drive for results… whilst having lots of fun and loving what we do! This role will have responsibilities across a number of sites around Australia, predominantly Gordon and Kingsgrove with some interstate travel also required.  As our HR Business Partner and reporting through to the ANZ HR Director, you will drive both global and ANZ initiatives, ensure strategy implementation, provide advice, support and coaching on all matters including employee relations and enterprise bargaining. Partnering with the General Manager ANZ for our Professional business, you will sit on the local Management team where you will work closely with leaders to drive improved performance through our teams. With a solid commercial acumen, you will be expected to understand the business, the drivers and how the people, culture and talent agenda can contribute to local growth. The role includes:   Providing business partnering and coaching in driving team engagement, talent development, performance management, organizational structures and resourcing strategies Driving culture and people development   Manage IR / ER escalations Championing internal communications in accordance with Global and ANZ plans To be successful in this role, the following skills & experiences are required:  5+ years experience in a HR Business Partnering capacity within FMCG or Pharmaceutical Leadership presence - an ability and willingness to inspire change, growth and development  Expertise in coaching, influencing and negotiating skills, with an ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders across all levels of the organisation Strong commercial and analytical skills, including a high degree of attention to detail Tech savvy – we are embarking on a transformation of existing HR systems and workforce analytics ER / IR experience including negotiating collective agreements, managing union relationships and performance management  Experience in operating within a global matrixed environment  Change management experience  L & D experience (with solid facilitation experience) An ability and willingness to balance the tactical “getting things done” and the strategic “steering the ship” A passion for all things coffee! What we can offer:    Best team mates around!  Intensive induction and support  Broad, diverse and influential role  Global organisation with long history that we are proud of… and a future we’re excited to be creating! At JACOBS DOUWE EGBERTS we can offer you the opportunity to join a highly successful global, yet local, coffee company at an exciting time. We are privately owned with big ambitions. When we grow, you grow. If you have a thirst to be part of this journey you will be exposed to the full spectrum of your field of work. We value potential and create opportunities. We also have the basics covered including an appealing remuneration and a suite of benefits, some of which may include: Employee Assistance Program, wellbeing programs, free products, additional leave for you to volunteer or move house, paid parental leave, additional superannuation options, access to professional training and facilities, rewards and recognition programs, option to purchase additional leave, summer hours and so much more! We are proud of our collaborative company culture and operate with a team of dedicated professional individuals who share the company strategy and vision. We are an equal opportunity employer and believe that Diversity; whether that be gender, cultural or generational diversity enhances our workplaces. Please be advised that shortlisted candidates may be required to undertake pre-employment medical and background screening including reference checks.  If you fit the description apply online today, or contact Ali Barfoot, Talent Acquisition Manager on +61 2 9551 3423 if you have any questions.

NRMA’s strategic intent is to be a commercially successful mutual, seen as the market leader in the delivery of its products and services. NRMA is actively looking to diversify its revenue and assets base including an enhancement of our transportation and tourism portfolios.  The opportunity is to join our dynamic Commercial team to support the execution of the growth strategy with a particular focus on the tourism sector. As a Business Development Manager you will drive the team’s work in the tourism sector, keeping abreast of trends in the sector and seeking out both organic and inorganic growth opportunities, while providing strategic and commercially sound advice and expertise across the NRMA group. Our Member magazine is the most widely read magazine in NSW, and our Membership program NRMA Blue delivers value to Members with transport, tourism and entertainment benefits that really matter.  We are proudly diverse and are committed to fostering an inclusive culture where all people are valued, respected and able to contribute their talents to drive organisational performance. job_title: Head of Forensics and Data Processing
job_description: Who are we? We are the leading provider of digital document solutions to over 2,000 law firms, government agencies and corporate legal departments across Asia Pacific. Our team is expanding, and we are always looking for exceptional consultants to join our highly skilled consultancy team. The Role This role will be responsible for leading the Forensics and Data Processing teams, delivering forensic technology offerings to clients, opening the business to new Forensics markets nationally and internationally and ensuring the overall success of Data Processing through ownership of the department’s processes, procedures and employee performance. You will use your expertise and experience in pitches and presentations to existing and potential clients to continually strive to increase our profile in the market as well as the capacity of the team. In this role, you will:  Manage and lead national and international teams Ensure resources are allocated appropriately to meet client needs Manage and track revenue and profitability Ensure internal and external stakeholder management Participate in high level project/sales meetings Identify and nurture client relationships Provide hands on guidance to the team in relation to legal technology when required And more!  Selection Criteria We are looking for a strong eDiscovery specialist with experience in leading a large team or someone looking to make the next jump in their career. Additionally, you will have:  Demonstrable leadership skills (preferably from a law firm or service bureau) Significant previous eDiscovery and Computer Forensics experience Ability to work to deadlines and under pressure High attention to detail Delivering goals in a changing environment Ability to follow through in a timely manner with all set tasks Exceptional interpersonal skills (flexible, confident and approachable) Strong written and verbal communication skills Intimate understanding of industry supported databases with database management experience Able to query and manipulate data using Access, SQL and other data base tools Able to work on various eDiscovery tools, data analytics Demonstrable leadership skills (preferably from a law firm or service bureau) Financial acumen (e.g. budgeting and P&L) Strong client stakeholder (internal and external) relationship management skills Exceptional presentation skills Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline Minimum 4 years’ experience in eDiscovery tools like Nuix, Relativity, Law Pre-Discovery, Venio or any other similar platforms (highly desirable)  On top of the salary package, you will be entitled to a bonus scheme that is attached to the performance of the team. Additionally, employees of Law In Order receive birthday leave, free travel insurance, access to regular social events and activities, and the option to Dress for Your Day. If you are interested in this position APPLY NOW by following the prompts on this page. Please include in your application a 1 page cover letter addressing the above selection criteria and reasons as to why you would be the right candidate for this role. We look forward to receiving and reviewing your application.

Talent Insights are working with a well-funded, successful start-up that is hiring their first senior data engineer. The remit of this role is to establish data engineering and best practices across; data collection, structures, design data services and set-up the ‘infrastructure’ to enable real-time insights and support machine learning and data science projects. Experience delivering high availability / low latency solutions is required.  The company is already successful in the security space, with global growth plans and a very high calibre of talent and engineers. Very importantly, they have immediate legitimate use-cases for real-time data analytics, scalable and robust solutions, actual big data and leveraging machine learning both for the benefit of their internal operations and externally for customers.   Required Skills & Experience (must-have unless otherwise indicated):   Experience building data pipelines and solutions in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud Platform or Azure) Computer Science / Software Engineering experience with high availability & low latency systems – we are open to Python, Scala, Java - any additional functional programming experience would be beneficial Good understanding of distributed systems, various modern data storage options and engineering best practices such as; CI/CD, Agile, DevOps, APIs, containerisation & automating data quality Team player attitude and willingness to wear multiple hats, deal with ambiguity and get involved in all things data engineering and machine learning     The role and environment: Fast-paced start-up with a some extremely talented peers across software engineering (product team) and Devops + site reliability (platform team). Once you have helped build out the data environments, infrastructure and tooling, you will work closely with a data scientist and the other teams to deploy solutions in prod and for research.To be successful, we are seeking an experience data engineer / software engineer with a very hands-on background building cloud-based data environments (AWS and Google Cloud Platform are in use) and ideally with experience across fast data. The stack you will work with will include AWS & GCP, ElasticSearch, AWS S3, Kubernetes, Redis, Google Pub/Sub and you will be instrumental in recommending and introducing new tools and technologies to enable data science and analytics.  Can work in a team but also get productive and solve problems on your own, ask questions and take an interest in quality code and best practices Happy to take a pragmatic approach to technology choices    Benefits of this specific role:   The hiring is due to growth and the establishment of data engineering and science – so you get to join at the ground floor and have a huge impact! In addition, there is a great close-knit team culture, events and perks, and a very competive salary package + equity on offer. This is a fast-growing software start-up that is well-funded and backed with an experienced team of investors, engineers and enterprise clients already on board.

We have an excellent opportunity for a commercially focused financial professional to support the CFO in providing financial business partnership to the Global Supply Chain and IT organisation. As a manager of managers, this role is accountable for the development and upskilling across portfolios of the team and the coaching of staff to ensure a superior service to the business.
If you enjoy working in a collaborative and fast paced environment and thrive on making improvements to the way we do things, then you won’t be disappointed here at Cochlear!
Key Responsibilities 

Leading and contributing to the execution of strategic initiatives by providing accurate and timely financial information, for example the new manufacturing plant in China and incorporating it into our overall Global Supply Chain.
Driving financial accountability for business results together with achieving business case targets by implementing a financial reporting model that supports initiative execution
Leading the process for the setting of financial targets and development of profitable financial plans Performing the financial appraisal of strategic plans, developing business cases that support the strategic plans, performing financial and risk analysis of the business plans and cases
Oversee all financial management reporting for Supply Chain, including Warranty & Repair and IT
Identifying ways to continuously improve the financial management operating model to deliver relevant, compliant, accurate and timely financial information in an efficient manner
Build capability of people managers and their teams and lead them to their full potential.

Why is this role right for you?

You will be degree qualified and have Professional accounting (Chartered, CPA or CIMA)
15+ years commercial experience in  multinational organisation(s) with a significant portion in a M&L/Supply Chain environment
Demonstrated ability to lead and develop a team, and driving process excellence
Have a successful FP&A track record including budgeting/forecasts, management reports and analytics
Successfully introduced processes and other steps to improve gross margins and problem solving
Be confident in dealing with a range of stakeholders with strong communication, presentation skills and solid negotiations skills
Ability to operate in growth driven environments and deliver against competing priorities
Enjoy working in a global business which results in a dynamic and at times uncertaint environment and being able to respond appropriately

This is your chance to be part of a premier organization with a great culture, working in a dynamic, growing and rapidly evolving environment to deliver outstanding results that benefit our customers every day.
Be part of something purposeful and APPLY now by clicking on the link below and see your career grow!
Cochlear Summary
Cochlear’s mission is to help people hear and be heard. Around the world, more people chose a Cochlear-branded hearing implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people’s lives. Learn and grow with us as we tackle the most complex challenges in helping people to Hear Now. And Always. Cochlear is the global market leader in implantable hearing solutions including cochlear implant systems (CI) and bone anchored hearing aids (Baha™).
#cochlearcareers

Our client is a fantastic AWS partner with a large focus Big Data Solutions with some of the best technologies available on the market. Due to significant growth across their Sydney team, they now require a senior resource to step into a key position as Senior Data Scientist Consultant to help deliver cutting-edge Big Data solutions to their top tier customers. This role will see you work through a range of Bid Data Technologies such as R and Python, and the tools within them i.e. Pandas, SciPy, Numpy (Python skills are preferred).  To be considered we are looking for people with the following skills and experience: Must have qualifications:  2+ years working as a data scientist; 5+ years working in a commercial analytics environment; Skilled across multiple machine learning models; Demonstrated experience with cloud-based analytical solutions; Demonstrated realisation of client benefits; Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms; Expert in common data science languages, such as R and Python, and the tools within them i.e. Pandas, SciPy, Numpy (Python skills are preferred). Highly proficient in SQL; Very strong applied statistics skills, and an understanding of what makes data reliable; Articulate and engaging communicator of analytical solutions and best practice approaches to data science projects; Well-versed in tools used to develop, deploy and manage analytics solutions; Australian citizenship, permanent resident of Australia or bona fide working visa.  Desirable:  A scientific background with exposure to large scientific projects; Pre-sales background Exposure to neural networks and advanced machine learning techniques; Expert data visualisation skills; Expert skills in data model design; Understands big data & data engineering technologies to support data science, such as Spark and Hadoop.

job_title: Senior Manager / Manager, Regulatory Reporting & Change
job_description:
Senior Manager / Manager - Regulatory Reporting & Change 
As a Manager or Senior Manager within the Group Regulatory Reporting Finance Team you will be instrumental in delivering on a major regulatory change projects for Macquarie. Our Financial Management Group is a growth business within Macquarie, giving you exposure and access to great leadership and ground-breaking objectives.
As a key member of the team, your responsibilities will include:

participating in the business transformation project team impacting regulatory reporting covering both external regulator driven changes as well as internal changes (for example, funding structure changes, internal entity reorganisations, etc.)
contributing to the Finance Project Management and Operations team, the data team, regulatory subject matter experts and the technology teams to deliver on projects
Delivering projects including developing the project objectives in conjunction with the project manager and business lead
being the key liaison between the team and other business units
contributing to the development and maintenance of the backlog, approving prioritisation of sprints, providing support and direction to project team and other subject matter experts working on the project
co-ordinating across the broader regulatory reporting teams, including the local reporting teams to assess and analyse impacts and liaise with other non-finance management groups as necessary to workshop and assess the changes, including validation of any assumptions and interpretations
ensuring that the control environment is robust and conforms to the Group Regulatory Reporting framework.

You will excel in this role if you can bring:

CA or CPA qualification
regulatory reporting, financial reporting or technical accounting background, ideally with hands on experience of project and change implementation in an agile project environment
excellent stakeholder management and communications skills will allow you to successfully keep the team updated on deliverables and ensure key project managers are aware of progress against project landmarks
a flexible, dedicated and solution orientated approach with the ability to work effectively through periods of change and disruption.

If you are motivated by the opportunity to work in a high performing team in a fast-paced environment, we would like to hear from you.
The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate communications and investor relations.
Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.The Role: We are currently seeking a hands-on Data Engineering developer to be based in our Sydney Office on a 12-month fixed term contract. This is a unique opportunity for a passionate data engineering developer, you will help our customers by resolving complex client issues by using proven data quality management, data integration, meta data management, data management, and data delivery.The key purpose of this role is to acquire, integrate, transform, and prepare data. Other responsibilities include: Working in an Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) environment and being tasked to build a data warehouse using complex transformations.Troubleshoot and help improve existing SQL scripts/ ETL jobs. Follow set standards and best practices in SQL scripting and ETL development.Refactor existing jobs that do not follow set standards.Experience in project life cycle activities on DW/BI (Data warehouse and Business Intelligence) development and maintenance projectsUnderstanding of databases/ data marts/data warehouses and complex SQL Experience with Microsoft SQL Server.Experience developing best practices ETL code, ETL unit testing and developer code reviewDesign, develop and implement ETL, data marts, and data warehouses to solve specific business requirements and enable reporting and analyticsWork with service & support team to resolve escalated operational issuesAbout You: As an experience Data Engineer you will utilise your technical skills to develop solutions and help improve our solutions. Required key skills will include:5yrs+ SSIS Hands on development experience5yrs+ SQL Server development experienceMust have worked with SSIS deploymentsExperience in ETL methodology, Data Warehousing Standards, Dimensional Modelling backgroundStrong ability to analyze user requirements into technical solutions according to specifications.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Experience with database design applications, including Visio and Erwin.Good knowledge of applicable data privacy practicesStrong written and oral communication, presentation and interpersonal skills.Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. Job Title: Manager, Delivery Planning and ReportingJob Grade / Classification:  Environmental Officer Class 11Employment Type: Ongoing, FulltimeLocation: Sydney or ‘Regional NSW’ (location negotiable). Our Sydney CBD office is relocating to Parramatta at the end of 2019.About the RoleThe Manager, Delivery Planning and Reporting is responsible for collaborating with the Director, Regional Delivery and the Regional Managers (in collaboration with the Programs Branch and the Office of the Chief Executive) in work required to plan, develop, monitor and report on regional delivery activity, including landholder support, stakeholder engagement, communications, program delivery, reporting and other regional delivery activities.Key accountabilities:• Develop and implement evidence-based systems to assess and manage regional delivery workload demands, planning, data gathering and reporting, aligned with the BCT’s Business Plan and MER Framework.• Collaborate with the Director, Regional Delivery and the Regional Managers (in collaboration with the Programs Branch and the Office of the Chief Executive) in the work required to plan, monitor and report on regional delivery activity.• Collaborate with Programs Branch and the Office of the Chief Executive to ensure alignment between regional delivery plans and the BCT’s business plan and broader strategies and plans.• Foster collaboration within the Regional Delivery Branch and across the BCT’s division to drive regional delivery consistency and effectiveness in program delivery and landholder support.• Provide expert advice based on appropriate factual evidence, and an understanding of the BCT's legislative, strategic and operational framework; and provide planning, monitoring and reporting services for the branch.• Develop effective and strategic channels of communication and engagement with internal and external stakeholders to advance the BCT’s objectives.• Provide professional, and timely advice to the Director, Regional Delivery on regional program delivery planning and reporting.Essential requirements• Extensive experience in planning and reporting.• Demonstrated broad knowledge of the government, public administration and budgetary procedures, processes and protocols.Agency overviewThe New South Wales Biodiversity Conservation Trust (BCT) is a not-for-profit statutory body, established under Part 10 of the Biodiversity Conservation Act 2016 and managed by a Board appointed by the Minister for the Environment. The Trust’s roles are to support and encourage landholders to enter into agreements to conserve and protect biodiversity on private land, guided by the government’s Biodiversity Conservation Investment Strategy; secure biodiversity offsets when developers choose to pay into the Biodiversity Conservation Fund; and other activities that promote greater awareness of, appreciation and understanding of, biodiversity and the importance of conserving it.Currently the Department of Planning and Environment is transitioning into a new Department of Planning and Industry which will take effect from 1 July 2019.Please read the following documents prior to preparing your application:• Role description• Application Guide• Applying for a role in the NSW public SectorGood to knowA Recruitment Pool may be established for future roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from Planning and Environment Cluster and other NSW Public Sector agencies over a 12-month period. Our commitment to diversity and flexibilityAt the Planning and Environment Cluster, we believe a diverse and inclusive workforce contributes to the success of our business and are committed to ensuring that our workforce reflects the communities of NSW.We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.To ApplyComplete all the questions in the online application. Submit your most recent resume and a cover letter explaining how you feel you are the right fit to the role.The information provided in your application needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role. (Refer to the role description for details about the capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential role requirements.) Applications Close: Tuesday 14 May 2019 at 11:59pm.Should you require further information about the role please contact; Alan Goodwin on 02 6022 0696 or Alan.Goodwin@bct.nsw.gov.au. If you are viewing this advertisement on LinkedIn, please click ‘Apply’ to access more information about this role via the I Work For NSW website.
