About the business  CSBA is a Melbourne based customer experience consultancy. Our clients use our expertise to understand their customer expectations and CSBA works with them to ensure they have the people and processes in place to exceed those expectations.  About the role  CSBA is seeking a Data Analyst to support the research team with a core need to provide technical support across all facets of Market Research. The role requires excellent Excel skills with any other data processing tool experience viewed positively. In addition to this, the ability to manage the technical aspects of research projects as well as develop online dashboard reporting makes this role a fully rounded one. Key Responsibilities include: Developing and building online dashboards in DapresyManaging survey projects in Unicom Intelligence (IBM Dimensions)Cleaning and processing of survey samples or lists provided by clientsImplementing quality controls to ensure sample is cleaned and loaded correctlyWhere possible automating key parts of the processThe uploading of sample and the distribution of online invitations & remindersSupport field team and researchers with quota monitoring, data validation and general data management for syndicated studies.Assist with the testing of all surveys to ensure output is as expected The role requires a technically-adept person who is detail-oriented and process-driven. The team uses a range of systems and the opportunity exists to learn a range of new skills within the organisation. Company description:Origin is an Australian listed public energy company with headquarters in Sydney. It is an Australian Stock Exchange publicly listed company.Job description: Manage and optimise Campaign Data solutions Data modelling and data integration Adobe Campaign focus    ORIGIN – GOOD ENERGYOrigin has a rich heritage in energy exploration, production, power generation and retailing. Today, we're a leading provider of energy to homes and businesses throughout Australia.   THE ROLE Origin is the largest energy retailer in Australia and with 4.3 million customer accounts we’re constantly evolving and changing to better suit their needs. Our activities include power generation, energy trading, the sale of LPG, electricity, natural gas and solar as well as the development of new and emerging technologies. Consider your possibilities with Australia’s leading integrated energy company. The role of Campaign Data Engineer is responsible for managing and enhancing the campaign data model that underpins Origin’s campaign management platform, Adobe Campaign.  The role will administer, maintain and develop data capabilities to support existing and future direct campaign activities.  This role will engage with upstream data platforms and Adobe to optimise data flows, data accuracy and automation capabilities to support seamless customer contacts. This is a unique opportunity to join the Digital and Transformation team in Melbourne. Reporting to the CRM Analytics and Operations Manager you’ll be responsible for:  All aspects of the Campaign Data solution delivery life cycle including analysis, estimation, design, development, testing, production deployment, and support Developing standardised practices for delivering new data sources to the campaign data mart, including data acquisition, transformation, and analysis Ensuring Data practices integrate into the overall data architectures and data management principles Develop and tune processes to ensure optimal performance and reliability whilst maintaining data integrity Working closely with the Marketing Campaign Managers and Campaign Analysts to support new data requirements and planning for future data needs  The Campaign Data Engineer will have deep expertise in campaign data design and development and will act as a data SME to partner and support Campaign analysts and Campaign Managers in Marketing and Digital    IS THIS YOU? You’ll need to have a unique mix of business acumen and passion for big data, excellent communication skills and a focus on data supporting campaign management. You must also hold qualifications in information management, computer science or a related discipline. To be considered for this role you will have:  Strong Adobe Campaign experience Experience working in Customer and Marketing Campaign management roles Expert experience and proficiency in coding skills relevant to data management (e.g. SAS, Java, Python, Scala, SQL) Proficiency with SQL, NoSQL, relational database design and methods Knowledge of data modelling, data lake, and data warehouse principles Advanced ETL design, development and optimisation capabilities using a variety of tools – Matillion or Adobe preferred Experience working in an agile environment  Our purpose drives everything.  If you connect with Getting energy right for our customers, community and planet this role is for you. For more information contact:Iain Pratt on (03) 8665 7325 Requisition ID:  71669  Origin recognises Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples as the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia, and we pay our respects to Elders past, present and future.  https://www.originenergy.com.au/about/careers.

· Salary packaging - to suit your personal and financial circumstances · Technology discounts - from Apple, HP, Lenovo, to Windows · Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best Do you want to work for one of the fastest growing data teams in Australia? Do you want to work on multiple data platforms and provide new solution offerings by leveraging cloud and big data technologies? About the team Big data, information and analytics. Three words that spark apprehension in most businesses. But our team of experts are constantly curious and excited about combining our wonderful array of technological expertise to transform data into our clients’ most valuable assets, making their work smarter. Our data consultants are supported with resources, training and tools they need to excel at their work, but also the freedom and power to create their own paths forward to make a difference. As a Senior Consultant - Big Data, you will work closely with the team and stakeholders to build and deliver a Cloud based vision for a next generation Big Data analytics platform. You will have a focus on data quality, data security and deliver the systems that process huge volumes of data. What will you typical day look like? You will play a pivotal role in - Designing and producing high performing and stable applications to perform complex processing of massive volumes of data in a new cloud based architecture; Building real-time data processing applications which are integrated with business systems to enable value from analytic models to drive rapid decision making; Designing data structures (including data storage, data ingestion, analytics layers, data output/input files) on a variety of technological solutions (e.g. RDBMS, Big Data, columnar, NoSQL or graph databases); Developing a component of a data solution; this could be a data mapping, a database, a migration/ingestion prototype or a solution roadmap ; Contributing to system architecture design for a data platform (including cloud-based structures both on and off premises, data warehouse components and data lakes); this could cover a range of technologies, various countries/locations and lines of business; Support data strategy or technology strategy definition programs, including technology stack definition and target operating model requirements Enough about us, let’s talk about you:You are someone with:Experience in building and implementing big data solutions using industry best practice tools, technologies and methodsUse of ‘traditional’ data analytics tools and techniques (e.g. MSSQL, Oracle, MySQL) and ETL software (e.g. SSIS, Informatica, CloverETL)Working in large scale cloud data solutions using platforms such as AWS or AzureExperience in scripting or programming (e.g. Python, Java, Scala, C#)Excellent verbal and written communication skills to adapt to technical and non-technical audiences.Educated to degree level (or have equivalent experience)Why Deloitte? At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. Next Steps Sound exactly like the sort of role for you? Apply now! If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Aditi Aggarwal from the Talent Acquisition team. We’d love to hear from you.

With a focus on innovation and informed by current research using contemporary techniques and technology, each dedicated team strives for continuous development of their skills and knowledge.
About the role
The Data Analytics Specialist is responsible for analysis, design, development, implementation, support and enhancement of reporting and decision support systems, including working with various stakeholders to implement process change management where required.
DATA ENGINEERING AND WAREHOUSING

Deliver optimized business solutions by data modelling/data architecture, performing impact/risk/gap analysis, identification of facts, dimensions, aggregates and hierarchies.
Design data integration, ELT/ETL jobs and other data pipelines within Microsoft BI Platform.
Gather and profile data from multiple sources and assimilate into meaningful inputs for databases.
Build and improve master data technologies, capability and integration with existing analytics solutions.

REPORTING AND ANALYTICS

Lead the development and enhancement of business intelligence and reporting services.
Tell a story with visualisations.
Assist with data gathering strategies to ensure alignment with IT and Business Strategies.
Identify new opportunities for data gathering to fill gaps in existing models and/or enhance models to drive higher levels of performance throughout the organisation.
Conduct analysis, summarise key findings and trends, and produces value-add data analysis and reports.

OPERATIONAL SUPPORT AND TROUBLESHOOTING

Looks for opportunities to improve the services provided by our facilities.
Demonstrate a commitment to high quality customer service principles, practices and attributes.
Understands the interdependencies of tasks and activities within the organisation and the flow on effect on their own actions.
Contributes to the development and maintenance of departmental documentation, configuration management and training resources.
Actively contributes in the review, selection and implementation of Business Intelligence tools in conjunction with colleagues to provide appropriate access to key information for stakeholders.
Implement solutions with a view to long term organisational strategies and potential future opportunities.
Be involved and contribute towards integrated risk planning and management.
Implement appropriate data cleansing and checking mechanisms to ensure the integrity, timeliness of reporting systems.

STAKEHOLDER MANAGEMENT

Actively develop relationships with both internal and external stakeholders to foster a collaborative environment.

Skills/Experience requirements:
Essential

Extensive experience across data engineering, data management, data modelling, data architecture and data warehousing technologies and practices.
Experience designing and developing reports and performance metrics from complex and disparate transactional systems.
Ability to perform in-depth systems and data analytics.
Experience extracting, cleansing and analysing data using reporting and BI tools.
Excellent business acumen with the ability to work with stakeholders at all levels.
Sound knowledge of Relational Database management concepts and data modelling.

Desirable

Knowledge and experience of the health industry.
Exposure to structured/unstructured data, big data architecture and predictive analytics solutions.

How to Apply
If you have an interest in health analytics and meet the minimum requirements, please click ‘apply’ to be considered.
 
Note: due to high volume of applications only those who are shortlisted will be contacted.

Clinical Trial Data Programmer Australasian Leukaemia & Lymphoma Group Full time, ongoing Inner Melbourne The Australasian Leukaemia & Lymphoma Group (ALLG) is the leading national cooperative group that specialises in establishing investigator-initiated clinical trials for patients with a haematological (blood) cancer. The successful candidate will be responsible for building and amending clinical databases to capture data for the ALLG multisite clinical trials.  This position will also involve data reconciliations, data extraction, development and maintenance of resources and documentation for clinical trial data management including the development and management of the eDC CRF library, effective communication, collaboration with ALLG investigators and key stakeholders. The position is fulltime, ongoing, and part of a team dedicated to research excellence in a progressive clinical setting. The position involves minimal travel but a willingness to travel interstate when needed is essential.   Key Skills and Essential Criteria  Tertiary qualification in an information technology, health or science field Experience in programming and constructing databases for multi-site clinical trials Demonstrated experience in clinical trial data management; data mapping, eCRF design and data reports Demonstrated experience with the design and application of validation checks in order to query data  High level of proficiency with eDC systems Experience with user acceptance testing and data extraction processes Familiarity with statistical programs and concepts Experience with SQL reports Demonstrated project management and organisational skills including the ability to work with minimal supervision across multiple projects and tight timelines High attention to detail Personal confidence to liaise with a variety of health and research professionals Desirable Criteria   Experience using Marvin by XClinical or equivalent eDC Understanding of medical terminology, ideally oncology, haematology Demonstrated understanding of Good Clinical Practice, regulatory, ethical, privacy and other relevant guidelines (preferred but not essential)  Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Office Suite, specifically MS Access databases and MS Excel The ALLG as a not-for-profit organisation offers salary packaging entitlement. The position involves minimal travel and a willingness to travel interstate when needed is essential. For further information and to request the position description, contact Marina Mullins, Operations Manager-ALLG. To apply, send a cover letter addressing the key skills and criteria above and a copy of your current CV to Marina Mullins. CLOSING DATE: 12th of MAY 2019  Marina Mullins, Operations Manager,Australasian Leukaemia and Lymphoma Group marina.mullins@allg.org.au

job_title: ETL/Data Migration/Data Governance/BI and Reporting Analysts
job_description: Hi we are RXP Group ( ASX:RXP) one of the leading digital services consultancies in Australia. We specialise in providing clients with digital expertise and support across current and emerging channels. From the initial design phase right through to final build, we go above and beyond to deliver effective, long lasting solutions to complex problems.  We fuse brand, insights, design and technology, to help companies innovate and digitally transform – all with the aim of Making Happier Humans.  RXP Insight VIC are looking for a seasoned Data and BI Analysts to join our team to support various engagements across Melbourne on a contract or perm engagement. These critical project roles will require Senior Data and BI Analysts/Consultants that are experts in delivering complex enterprise data projects with an innate ability to lead and manage medium to large project teams and effectively manage stakeholders at all levels in a fast-paced environments with time sensitive projects. Above all you will thrive on being a technical, hands on delivery focused Data Lead.    More specifically you will be an SME in the areas of:  Data Migration Data Governance ETL Reporting/Visualisation   To be successful in these roles you will have demonstrated capability in:  Leading Agile/Scrum Teams in either one or more of the above specialisations Managing, influencing and negotiating with stakeholders at all levels Leading, driving and delivering complex, enterprise wide data projects Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent leadership skills Hands on experience with RXP technologies such as Informatica, the MSBI Stack, Tableau and Power BI, Azure or AWS  As an RXP Data Lead you will have previous onshore consulting experience with a proven track record of:  Delivering complex data projects onshore Leading Agile Scrum Teams along with related certifications (highly advantageous) Certifications in at least 2 RXP technologies (as noted above)  A workplace culture that encourages your growth and celebrates diversity  Our people embrace change, are insightful and intelligent industry leaders who are passionate about contributing meaningfully to our clients’ digital futures. Together we help to improve the way our clients operate by delivering compelling business and technical experiences. If you like the sound of us, then learn more about joining us by visiting www.rxpservices.com  Note: To be eligible to apply for this position, you must have existing Australian work rights. The shortlisted candidate/s may be required to undergo a Criminal History Background/Police/Qualifications Check at the later stages of the recruitment process.  RXP Services operate a National Talent Management function and do not accept unsolicited resumes via recruitment agency or consultancy. All Recruitment is driven through our fully functional National Talent Team and as such RXP Services will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes

As the Data Migration Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in the implementation of a new Dynamics365 ERP System which includes configuration of Finance, Supply Chain and Field Operations modules. You will be responsible for analysing, designing, extracting, cleansing, testing, and migrating data from multiple systems to a clean dataset, ready for transformation and load to Dynamics365 by the Solution Implementer (SI).     Minimum 3-5 years’ experience as a Data Migration Specialist Experience in migrating existing legacy data to an enterprise solution Good understanding and use of Databases, T-SQL Scripting, stored procedures and data models Expertise in developing migration solutions within SQL Server, SSRS, ETL tools, Data conversion, Data De-duplication and Data Cleansing. Strong Written and verbal communication skills and demonstrated success in building relationships with key people at all levels and arrive at resolutions to migration design decisions and data quality issue resolution Strong organisational skills with proven ability to prioritise workloads effectively and meet tight deadlines without supervision Data migration on at least one major Microsoft Dynamics implementation project   Exposure to Microsoft Dynamics GP (source system), Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Microsoft Dynamics AX, Microsoft Dynamics365 and is highly desirable

The CompanyThis is an international organization with a powerful brand and a reputation for excellence and innovation. A membership-based business with a wide consumer base, this is a growth orientated company, with lots of forward momentum. They have built an incredible culture and place to work due to investing in quality personnel according to a comprehensive set of values.In order for the business to implement Dynamics 365, all their data from multiple legacy systems, needs to be analyzed, cleansed and migrated. This has now created a need for a Data Migration Specialist to be the conduit between the business, IT and the Solution Implementer. As the Data Migration Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in the implementation of a new Dynamics365 ERP System which includes the configuration of finance, supply chain and field operations modules. The RoleReporting directly into the Delivery Manager, the role will require the Data Migration Specialist to analyze, design, extract, cleanse, test and migrate data from multiple systems to a clean data set, ready for transformation and load into Dynamics 365 by the Solution Implementer. Specifically, the Data Migration Specialist will;Hands on extraction and cleansing of data from legacy systems to then load into Dynamics 365.Review, interpret, recommend and respond to the detailed design proposed by the Solution Implementer and align it with the business requirements.Manage data quality through identification, assessment, monitoring, and correction of issues.Manage data validation through quantitative and qualitative checks to measure the success of the migration as well as detect defects.Data Cleansing of source for data migration to ensure data validation and migration.Develop a wide range of reports and relevant lists from the database for the use in ST and UAT.Document the data migration plan, schedule, test plan and detailed conversion reports.Support the solution implementers migration team by ensuring they have the necessary resources, tools, data and access to achieve their objectives and products.Work with SME resources and assist in performing the reconciliation and data migration testing process to highlight any issues for correction.Work with SMEs to User Acceptance Test for data migration and sign off.Assist in development of cutover plans and schedules for trial migrations, dress rehearsals and go-live implementations. Your ProfileSignificant experience as a hands on Data Migration Specialist or similar.Experience in migrating existing legacy data to an enterprise solution.Experience with Databases, T-SQL scripting, stored procedures and data models.Expertise in developing migration solutions within SQL Server, SSRS, ETL tools, Data conversion, Data De-duplication and Data Cleansing.Ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders as well as managing their expectations through a migration process.Data migration on at least one major Microsoft Dynamics implementation project or similar.Exposure to Microsoft Dynamics GP (source system), Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Microsoft Dynamics AX, Microsoft Dynamics 365 is highly desirable.Apply TodayPlease send your resume to us by clicking the “Apply Now” button. Resumes in MS Word format are preferred.Job Reference No: 06810-0010941994JR

Wesfarmers Limited have structured its department store businesses to enable Kmart and Target to maximise and share opportunities where appropriate whilst separately maintaining and growing these iconic Australian brands.  The Property Division is an area that works across both these retail brands with regards to new store development opportunities.
A unique opportunity to join the Property Team has become available for an experienced Network Data professional to take on the role of Data and GIS Manager as a key resource for the Network Planning team.  Reporting to the National Network Planning Manager, this role will see you involved in the following;

Design and organise existing data to create one identifiable source of the truth and a logical and systematic relationship between data-sets and databases/ tools
Responsible for creating and maintaining the streams of data between Network tools and databases, other business functions and third parties
Maintain and seek to improve the WESDS Store Data Tool, MapInfo and Excel templates used within the Network Planning function
Track store lifecycle from identification of opportunities through location, potential sites, approved deals, opened stores, refurbishments and closures and integrate into data tools and databases
Primary responsibility for Flybys database processing and mapping
Keep Network Planners and Manager up to date on shopping centre and competitor activity, ensuring relevant data feeds into network planning models and databases

To be successful in securing this role, you will ideally possess the following skills and experience;

Tertiary qualification in the field of Geomatics/ Data Sciences, Maths & Statistics, Computer Science or related field or discipline
Considerable MapInfo and MapBasic experience essential, advanced user of MapInfo GIS, QGIS skills highly valued
Advanced user of Excel, Access, MS SQL including VB programming and SQL programming combined with experience with data visualisation tools e.g. Tableau
Those with previous experience in retail and/or the property sector will be considered highly desirable 
Experience of statistical regression analysis preferable
Strong GIS background, within a Property Economics, Site Research or Network Planning team (preferably within a large retailer or specialty retail /property consultancy)
Data extraction and manipulation with specific experience of working with and managing large and complex datasets
Appreciation of market dynamics, customer insights and macroeconomic influences on retail markets
Self-motivated and proactive; excellent organisational skills; strong written communication skills
Ideally possess a knowledge of Australian retail landscape and understanding of market trends
Ability to provide independent, open and honest advice with regards to GIS and data related issues

You will benefit from joining an amazing business and a dynamic team who are all committed to the success of Kmart and providing our customers with a great shopping experience. Our values – Think Customer, Take Care, Live Integrity, Grow Together and Reach Higher will resonate with you deeply and you’ll enjoy being part of a growing, iconic Australian business that has a fantastic culture that is non-hierarchical, diverse and inclusive. Your work environment will be highly collaborative, fast-paced and progressive, with no two days the same!
You will be afforded autonomy and accountability in your role and have access to development opportunities across the Wesfarmers Group, excellent remuneration, inclusion in a bonus scheme & access to Wesfarmers share plan (both for eligible team members), free parking and benefits program including a discount card for Kmart, Coles, Target and Officeworks.
At Kmart we aim to ensure our teams reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate.
Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.

Who we are  Containerchain is a successful and growing software company that has ambitious international expansion plans. We are a leader in our industry, providing solutions and ideas that increase the efficiency of ports, shipping, and freight logistics. As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for gathering, analysing, modelling and documenting requirements for the continuous development of our software product suite.  You'll be working with our Customers, and Business and Tech teams to make sure that our most important business requirements flow seamlessly to our products.  We follow Agile, so we're looking for someone who can work with our teams to ensure we deliver quality, quickly.   Your Key Responsibilities:  Gather and Document Customer and Business Requirements for Product Development Translate Customer and Business Requirements into User Stories and supporting documents Technical analysis of legacy application functionality and data structures Support the Development Process through Clarification of Requirements and User Stories Review and Validate produced functionality to ensure it meets Customer and Business Requirements   You have:  5+ years demonstrated Business Analysis experience in an Agile environment (Scrum and / or Kanban) Demonstrable experience in identifying business requirements and translating into user stories for implementation by Technology teams Highly developed data and process modelling skills Strong analytical and lateral thinking skills Strong technical and user documentation skills and experience   What would give you an advantage:  Experience working in the logistics industry Experience of documenting legacy applications for lift and shift projects   What's on Offer? About us: At Bunnings we believe home improvement should be accessible to everyone. When it comes to working with us, the same applies. Whether you’ve mastered DIY, you may just be able to find a role that’s made for you.  In our support offices, we may not quite resemble our iconic green sheds, but working behind the scenes are a team of people that make our stores come to life.  To create a work environment where our team members feel like they belong, we do our best to nurture a supportive culture. Our trust in each other gives us confidence to make an impact in our roles and to our customers.   Our team members are encouraged to lead their own way. Our teams are empowered and encouraged to be accountable for making an impact, no matter how big or small.    About the opportunity: The Business Development Project Analyst will influence the achievement of Bunnings’ long-term earnings growth targets via the identification, research, development, evaluation and execution of new business initiatives (both organically and via acquisition). Key responsibilities of the role will include:  Work alongside the Business Development Manager, Director of Corporate Affairs and Business Development and the CFO to investigate, develop and recommend new projects/acquisitions which facilitate the achievement of long-term earnings growth and return on capital targets Research bulky goods industry segments in Australia and New Zealand to understand market sizes and structures Assist with the identification of entry strategies for priority segments Develop detailed financial evaluations to support proposed projects Participate in negotiations with third parties and assist with required transactional agreements Develop board papers in support of identified opportunities   What you will need:  4+ years’ relevant commercial experience Tertiary qualification in Commerce, Accounting or Business CA or CPA or CFA / equivalent qualified Strong analytical and conceptual thinker Valuations experience Sound commercial judgement Strong influencing skills at senior level (Bunnings Leadership Team, Wesfarmers) Excellent interpersonal ability   What's in it for you:   Competitive salary package  Team member and partner discount  12 weeks paid parental leave for eligible team members  The opportunity to participate in Wesfarmers Share Plan  Access to discounted offers from corporate partners  Ongoing career development and training  Work in a fun and informal team  Offers flexibility in an inclusive work environment  Chances to create a real difference in your community and environment    Retaining an inclusive, family feel while growing into one of Australia’s and New Zealand’s largest and most widely recognised brands has come naturally to us and we’d love to welcome you to the family.

The Business Dog and Bone is Australia's premier independent ICT consultancy. Our independence enables decision makers to make informed and strategically sound decisions to successfully fulfil their organisation's mission. Founded in 2002, we are a growing and dynamic organisation that is looking for enthusiastic people to join our team. Our growth is driven by a commitment to ethical business and creating demonstrable value for our clients. We are focused on creating a better world through empowering our clients. These include a wide variety of well-known corporates, government and a focus on the not-for-profit sector, thus, reflecting our strong interest in equality, social justice, and environmental responsibility. Being one of the only BCORP certified ICT organisations in Australia, we believe in playing a role in corporate social responsibility, helping build a cohesive, tolerant and just society. The Role The rapid growth of Dog and Bone has led our Consulting Project Delivery Team to seek an additional team member. We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst with drive and commitment, who wants a rewarding career in IT. This role will see you working as part of a team of consultants who are responsible for the delivery of key projects. As a trusted advisor who understands business requirements and holistic solutions, you will work with a range of technologies and IT services that support an organisation's strategies and workforce to deliver value to an organisation. The role is designed to gather client business requirements, analyse existing systems and recommend future state solutions based on those needs. You will facilitate meetings and workshops with clients and deliver complex messages in a non-technical way, bridging the gap between business and technology requirements. You will also prepare technical specification documents which clearly identify business needs and contribute to the preparations of reports which include IT strategies, RFPs and technical reviews. About You - Skills and Experience You share a similar philosophy to our own and have business analyst expertise with at least 4+ years' experience working in the Australian IT/ICT industry. Throughout your experience you have been responsible for collecting, analysing and summarising information and trends and proposing improvements or alternative solutions to systems based on analysis and need. With an excellent ability to work with business and technical teams, you have gathered business requirements and converted them to user stories and technical requirements, developed workflow charts and diagrams and prepared technical reports. You have excellent report writing and verbal communication skills, including presenting in a clear and concise manner. You are a flexible and adaptable individual who can work autonomously but also collaboratively as part of a team. Job Benefits and Perks Dog and Bone pride ourselves on the diversity of our staff, progressive business practices and commitment to a positive, flexible and family-friendly workplace. The delivery of high-quality outcomes to our clients is underpinned by a focused and collaborative work environment. In addition, we also offer:  Five weeks leave + your birthday off! Located in trendy Northcote, close to great cafes, shops and close to public transport Weekly team lunches Fresh fruit and espresso on tap If this sounds like exactly what you are looking for, please send a current resume and covering letter through the SEEK link ASAP. Applications close when we have found the right person!

THE COMPANY Aginic is a rapidly growing data solutions, design and agile delivery company. In the past five years, we’ve grown into a team of 60+ people across four cities and are responsible for innovative BI solutions across government and commercial clients across Australia. We are headquartered in Brisbane and are expanding rapidly in the Melbourne market.  As such, we are currently seeking an experienced Data Analytics / Business Intelligence technical manager to support this growth. Our Melbourne office provides the hub for delivery to clients in the health sector nationally as well as supporting projects in other sectors within Victoria and South Australia. We work hard but we like to have fun - with plenty of coffee, games and team outings. We have an agile model and support flexible working arrangements. If that sounds like your kind of team, read on! THE ROLE As the Data Analytics / BI Manager you will assist and support the Director to target amazing growth in the Victorian market; providing on the ground guidance to our squads in technical delivery as well as actively contributing to business development. This role will enable you to explore and grow your own leadership skills in a consulting environment as well as further honing your technical and adaptive delivery skills. You will gain satisfaction in working with clients to improve service delivery; using a broad range of technologies to help solve real business and societal challenges. The right person will:   Be ready to manage, develop and grow a small team.   Be excited about the opportunity to further develop their own skill set.   Have broad experience in the following:   deploying analytics / BI applications on one of the main cloud providers (Azure, AWS, GCP)   using BI tools such as PowerBI, Tableau and Qlik for analytics and data visualisation.   using a range of SQL based (SQL Server, MySQL, PostrgreSQL, DB2) database management systems with some experience in NOSQL (e.g. MongoBD)   working with structured numerical data as well as unstructured textual data.   using Python, R or other tools for data analysis and predictive modelling   Agile delivery practices.     Have an analytical mindset and be comfortable with challenging assumptions.   Be experienced in successfully engaging with a variety of stakeholders at all levels of an organisation.   Be keen to promote and lead internal initiatives around best practice approaches so that we can continually improve our efficiency, quality and relevance.   Have a passion for supporting improvements in healthcare service delivery.  By design, your role will expand as our team continues growing. When you join Aginic we’ll support you with experienced mentors and a development path that allows you to build rounded skills. THE BENEFITS We’re committed to promoting diversity in the workplace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. Are you looking to join a high performing, smart and fun team? Apply now!   Our clients are awesome and the work we do has a big impact on a number of industries, particularly healthcare and education.   We are a young, dynamic and quickly growing group of inquisitive minds that come from a diverse set of backgrounds including, engineers, mathematicians, actuaries, accountants, software developers, lean and agile gurus, healthcare professionals and designers.   We invest heavily in learning, research and development and have a ventures business that is currently exploring exciting products.   We have partnerships in place with some of the world’s leading technology providers including, Google, Microsoft, Qlik, Elastic and Snowflake.   We support you to develop your skills through:   internal training   industry conferences and events   certifications

job_title: Data Governance Analyst's, Lead's & Consultant's - Risk Projects
job_description: Full Job Description   Talent Insights are working on a number of exclusive roles with multiple clients in banking, retail and consulting. We are looking for people with experience as either a Data Governance specialist, Analyst, lead or consultant, ideally with experience in risk management. Join a customer focused data group, and work with talented data analytics and data science teams. The roles will support our clients maintaining effective governance, data stewardship and quality assurance. The Role   The purpose of the role is to support the Group in maintaining effective governance, data stewardship and quality assurance over its data and metadata assets. This includes compliance with applicable legislation, regulatory requirements, internal policies and the standards we apply to our use of data. Your contribution will primarily focus on the provision of data governance operations and analysis, data stewardship and data assurance activities, as well as associated metadata maintenance activities to support the pragmatic advice to stakeholders.  Experience Required:   As a Data Governance Risk Analyst or consultant, you will understand privacy law and how to classify data accordingly to privacy law.  Able to work autonomously and maintain effective communication across different business, technical and risk teams with varying levels awareness & knowledge. Good experience in Data Governance Framework to improve risk data assets and planned benefits Detailed and process-oriented by nature, with the ability to provide insightful analysis and pragmatic advice in a dynamic environment. Strong experience with metadata practices and governance. Experience with looking at the wider picture and articulate complex problems in an easy-to-understand and digestible format. Understanding of delivering data frameworks for data management and designing data for simplification Familiarity with IP and data privacy regulations and data privacy engineering/best practice. (Desirable) Experience with data quality and data profiling tools and methodologies, SQL    Please submit a CV or profile via the links below. If you prefer a confidential discussion first, you can email suganya@talentinsights.com.au

EnergyAustralia is one of Australia's largest energy companies providing smart, innovative energy solutions for our customers. We're in an exciting transformation and are committed to becoming a world-class organisation with the customer at the heart of everything we do.
The management of Embedded Networks IT resources is required to deliver, control and manage the current and future business requirements of the embedded networks business. 
About the role
In this standalone role you will be responsible for leading system and operational activities to support the business operations, including system management and maintenance, new site establishment, new product and pricing introduction, service management and ongoing enhancements to system and operational capabilities.
You will be responsible for;

Managing system changes and updates, product & pricing management, troubleshooting system issues and user problems, management data integrity and site reconciliation, monitor availability, performance and system capacity and implement improvement changes as required
Ensuring all regulatory and commercial changes are identified and reviewed with internal stakeholders
Ensuring that key performance data is readily available and validated for monthly business reporting and compliance
Ensure customer move-in/move-outs, monthly billing and collections, site reconciliation is performed within the agreed timelines (both internal and external)
Ensuring that all Client obligations and deliverables from site establishment to customer registration to billing to Client P&L reporting are completed.

What we are looking for:

Demonstrated similar application support experience at a senior or junior lead level within a large and complex organisation
Demonstrated some technical skills in embedded network applications i.e. Zuora, Zendesk, Jira and Salesforce (desirable) or similar enterprise applications 
Demonstrated billing and financial background 
Exceptional stakeholder and vendor management skills
Enjoys working in a dynamic environment
Relevant IT or computer course/degree/qualification or progress toward a relevant qualification i.e. ITIL certification

Interested?
If you share our passion for making customers a priority, doing the right thing, leading change and want to be part of an organisation focused on making a positive impact, click the 'Apply" button to submit your application.

job_title: Business Manager - Leading Electrical Wholesale Company. Eastern Metro locations
job_description: About the Company:     MM Electrical Merchandising (MMEM) are the leading distributor of electrical and data components and equipment in Australia. With a national branch footprint of over 300 stores, and over 2000 employees, MMEM operate brands including AWM, Haymans and TLE. Their success is a result of their ability to build strong customer relationships, demonstrate industry knowledge and provide a high level of service.  About the Role:  With continued success and expansion, MMEM are seeking highly motivated and ambitious Electrical Wholesale professionals to take on management positions within the business.    As a Business Manager with MMEM, you will find yourself in a true leadership position. You will be responsible for the business plan, operations, and overall sales of your own individual electrical wholesale business.     Responsibilities include:  Developing and implementing business, product and sales strategies to grow revenue and market share Working closely with key customers and suppliers to develop and maintain strong and effective relationships Effectively managing systems and procedures for controlling performance of the business and key account customers against budgets and forecasts Leading, training and developing your team to achieve measurable results Maintaining extensive knowledge of the company's products and services  Eastern Metro VIC locations.    About You:   To be successful in this role, it is imperative you have proven experience in the Electrical Wholesale Industry. You are a confident and strong leader with an aptitude for maximising sales performance, profitability and growth in a dynamic and competitive environment. You are now seeking a fresh challenge, and uncapped earning potential, with the market leader in Electrical Wholesale – MMEM.    You have:  Exceptional knowledge of the Electrical Wholesale market Vision, drive and the ability to think outside the square A flair for customer service, sales and business development Excellent interpersonal skills to drive relationships with internal and external stakeholders Outstanding time management and organisational skills Strong communication, conflict resolution and negotiation skills Excellent computer systems and data analysis skills Current drivers licence A qualification in a relevant discipline and/or formal management training  Please note – candidates without Electrical Wholesale experience will not be considered for this role.    Apply today or, for more information, contact Megan at Allan Hall Human Resource Services on 02 8978 3752.    Only successful candidates will be contacted for the next stage of the recruitment process. Thank you for your understanding.

job_title: Data driven marketing - Digital Sales - Business Development Manager!
job_description: Data driven marketing – Digital Sales - Business Development Manager! Big Wave Digital has had the long standing pleasure of partnering with this hugely successful global customer information and data driven marketing technology firm. Through new product launches and new business wins, we are currently on the hunt for a self-motivated B2B Business Development Manager, with a sales assassin attitude to join the data marketing and digital sales team. The position requires someone who has the smarts to turn marketing data and numbers into business outcomes; you’ll need drive and determination to succeed, the persistence to chase down a win, the tenacity to convert your prospects and the desire to make a shyte load of commission. To be selected for interview, you’ll need to have the following skills/experience/attributes….  Proven ability to make quality cold calls to Brands and Agency clients, selling into Digital Marketing leaders, Directors & C-Suite. Have a winning sales methodology/formula that you can demonstrate and articulate when asked Have that sales assassin attitude – never give up till the qualified prospect has converted to an active client Established forecasting skills (using salesforce would be great, however other CRM experience is fine) Aptitude for understanding client needs, sensational listening skills, with the ability to think on your feet Ability to interpret large sets of marketing data – highly analytical, with the passion for using numbers and consumer insights to create successful business outcomes Experience selling solutions is essential; this is not an account management role. It’s all about new business development. You’ll need to be able to demonstrate your actual’s V’s targets and discuss your KPI formula  In return, you’ll have the one off chance to join a market leader in marketing tech and consumer insights, the opportunity to grow within a dynamic and always evolving digital first business, and gain the highly sought after skills in data driven marketing that is set to be massive now and in the coming years. The team is collaborative; close knit, they celebrate wins and love a friendly competitive banter!  They share a laugh; they love a Friday arvo drink and are all keen team sports people. If you command attention in a business meeting and are keen and eager to prove yourself in the edgy data driven marketing industry, then I’d love to hear from you! Apply NOW via the link below, marked attention; Dayna Stewart | Head of Digital & Data recruitment | dayna@bigwavedigital.com.au |www.bigwavedigital.com.au

Lead Envato’s growing Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse team of 10+ Partner with our Analytics Director, Paid Growth Director & other internal leaders to come up with innovative solutions to interesting problems Melbourne CBD with optional flexibility to work some days from home or work remotely from anywhere in Australia Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, Envato is a completely online company with an ecosystem of sites and services to help people get creative. We’ve consistently been named as one of the Best Places to Work in Australia, since 2015, in the BRW Awards, and we’ve also been awarded the title of Australia's Coolest Company for Women and Diversity by JobAdvisor. Envato was found in 2006 and, since then, we’ve helped a community of creative sellers earn more than $500 Million. Millions of people around the world choose our marketplace, studio and courses to buy files, hire freelancers, or learn the skills needed to build websites, videos, apps, graphics and more. Find out more at Envato Market, Envato Elements, Envato Sites, Envato Studio and Tuts+. You might be surprised to know that not only do we run some of the biggest websites in the world; we’re also growing really fast! We have close to 600 staff and contractors worldwide, adding more than 100 people to the business, year on year, since 2017. What you’ll be doing In this senior leadership role, you will lead Envato’s growing Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse team of 10+ whilst also developing and communicating your centralised data platform vision for Envato and maintaining the roadmap. You’ll partner with senior stakeholders and delivery teams to continue developing our centralised data platform, looking at ways to innovate and continuously improve. This platform enables multiple analytics teams to build business insights and reporting. You will also be responsible for the operational aspects of the data warehouse. What we’re looking for We’re looking for a highly motivated leader, with 5+ years experience leading, coaching and mentoring highly effective data warehouse and data platform teams. We’re going through a period of rapid growth and transformation, so it would be amazing if you had experience working in one, or multiple, fast-growing digital businesses where ongoing planning and frequent re-forecasting is the norm. We’d also love experience with Amazon Redshift. Your approach to matching work and people is outstanding; you love to focus on getting both the best out of the team and the best result for the business. Your excellent planning skills and experience mean that you’re naturally capable of seeing dependencies and driving others to deliver, while maintaining great relationships across the business at all levels. Above all else, you have high integrity and align with Envato’s values. As well as developing your team, we’re looking for an individual who is also driven to develop themselves professionally. In this role, you will be surrounded by industry leaders who are passionate about providing you with opportunities to grow your career, innovate and constantly upskill. Technology your team be working with  AWS Cloud Services (AWS Redshift, EC2, S3 etc) SQL Server Microsoft Visual Studio Gathering data via API’s from cloud based data sources Tableau Google Cloud Platform Tools (BigQuery, Google Analytics, AdWords) What we offer  A fantastic culture of creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about Envato and being part of its growth and success Flexible working conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of Envato Our preference is to hire this role in our Melbourne CBD office, with optional flexibility to work from home some days, but we are also happy to consider applications from people who would like to work remotely (Australia wide) We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination A fast paced and progressive environment where everyone has regular interaction with teammates and Envato community members from all over the world! Read more from our staff about why they love working at Envato by visiting www.jobadvisor.com.au/envato Who should apply? We care deeply about diversity at Envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. If you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we'd like to hear from you. What next? Submit a cover letter, an up to date copy of your resume and answers to the below questions. Good luck!

At MinterEllison we take pride in being our clients' best partner, and enjoy working within teams of professionals who share their knowledge, respect our values and support each other to achieve our collective goals. We welcome people who want exciting careers in high performing teams.
Purpose of the role
Due to the growth of the firm, our Program Management Office (PMO) is recruiting a Business Analyst to be responsible for the current state & future state analysis and requirements gathering, with a focus on projects in the efficiency, risk and regulatory stream of work.
Reporting to the Head of PMO, this role will identify and investigate efficiency improvements and impact of regulatory changes, prioritising activities to ensure appropriate focus on projects that deliver return on investment for the business. The Business Analyst will be a dedicated resource for the project, and will work closely with project managers, other business analysts, lawyers, systems owners and other stakeholders across the firm.
This is an initial 12 month fixed term contract with the potential to extend or become a permanent role. Occasional travel may be required to effectively collaborate with stakeholders across various locations.
Your responsibilities include:

Work across a broad range of functional areas including risk and regulatory, business operations and finance, across various locations with work spanning across business analysis, process change, technology solutions, and people's work practices.
Work with the risk and regulatory team to develop and deliver a plan for the firm's risk and regulatory program of work.
Analyse and review current processes, conduct gap analysis and present summary of findings and recommendations
Create AS-IS and TO-BE process maps
Write text requirements or User Stories complete with Acceptance Criteria; which can easily be understood by the Solution Development Team
Create business requirements documents and work with technology experts to translate into functional specifications
Create and manage requirements traceability matrix and product backlog
Support in conducting business process impact assessment and change impact assessments
Conduct workshops and technology demonstrations to seek sign-off on business requirements, new processes and technology solutions
Participate in test planning and execution

What you need
We welcome applications from people with:

3+ years' experience in a related business analyst role within a regulatory environment
Strong analytical and process improvement skills, with experience in delivering efficiency improvements from analysis phase through to implementation
Experience developing and implementing processes
Experience in completing AS-IS and TO-BE process mapping in multi stream complex business environments
Interest in performing a diverse range of work from business analysis to capturing functional specifications and data mapping with familiarity with technology solutions and functionality
Proficiency across Microsoft Office Suite and Microsoft Visio
Understanding of the Software Delivery Lifecycle
Experience working in an iterative fashion, following an agile framework
Knowledge of Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABoK)
Bonus points for someone who has:

Legal industry or professional services experience
Experience working on projects with a regulatory requirement
Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma



Who we are
We embrace flexibility and empower all our people to learn, grow and become truly extraordinary. We provide our future leaders with best practice learning and development programs to accelerate and grow their careers. We value diversity in the workplace and care about ensuring you balance your professional goals with your commitments and interests outside of work. We have a wide range of social, financial and health benefits to support your wellbeing.
How to apply
We prefer to deal with you directly, so if you would like to be considered please submit your CV and cover letter via our online portal by clicking on the 'Apply' button below. Come join a company that tackles fascinating problems and finds solutions to complex challenges. Seqirus has an exciting opportunity to join our expanding team in Parkville, a leader in egg-based influenza vaccine manufacturing, in-licensed vaccines and specialty pharmaceuticals.  Seqirus is the sole supplier of a unique range of products made in the national interest for the Australian Government.  We operate as one integrated global company, drawing together expert staff from different countries to collaborate. Together, we are working on the front line to protect communities from seasonal influenza and global pandemic threats.  When you join Seqirus, you join a team dedicated to making a difference in people's lives. It's a feeling of possibility, creativity, and purpose that inspires us every day.   An exciting new opportunity has been created in the Seqirus pharmaceutical team to lead the allergy /immunology specialty team to launch a new product and grow the existing portfolio, this is a permanent position. The role is a people leader position in charge of a team of Specialist sales representatives.   The Specialist Area Business Manager is responsible for the business performance of their sales team and their specialty products. This role is also responsible for delivery on sales and margin and control expenditure in line with the budget or set targets.   Responsibilities:  People development, training, recruitment and motivation to build and retain good performers. Achieve sales targets, gross margin and manage expenditure in line with the budget or set targets. Management of area business expense budget. Drive a ‘winning team culture’ Effective utilization of resources that support sales effectiveness (e.g. Territory planning, analysis of sales data to assist in field coaching and identifying training and development needs) Undertake the prime responsibility for the development and implementation of Area Business Plans Excellent communication on a regular basis with direct reports, peers, Business Unit Manager, Marketing and other head office staff on all appropriate matters.  Areas covered include sales/sales strategy, market conditions, competitor activity and representative performance and development. Developing and maintaining excellent communications with external professional contacts, including key customers and appropriate medical personnel and managing a small group of KOLs directly. Liaise with Key External Experts, hospitals, hospital pharmacy and 3rd party professional bodies as appropriate to build business relationships   To be successful in this role you will have a proven track record of success in leading a pharmaceutical sales team and achieving commercial goals.  You will have excellent planning and organizational skills and are a highly effective influencer. Previous experience in coaching and developing of staff and excellent analytical skills and business acumen is essential. Your strong drive for results will enable you and your team to achieve and exceed the commercial outcomes. A tertiary qualification in Medicine, Science, Pharmacy, Allied Health or related discipline is preferred. If you are looking to develop your skills and shape the health of Australians, please apply. Applications must address the selection criteria above and include a current CV, covering letter and reference number    R-090642. Applications will close on Friday 10 May 2019   CSL advises that screening including; criminal history, medical assessment, confirmation of experience, stated qualifications and other relevant checks form a part of the candidate suitability evaluation process.  Where applicable, this applies to current CSL employees. CSL employees must notify their current manager when selected for interview for any advertised internal vacancies.

Big Data Hadoop Support Specialist    Job Description:     Hewlett Packard Enterprise advances the way people live & work.  We bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions, helping our customers make their mark on the world.  Our new innovative IT services organisation is HPE PointNext. Pointnext has the expertise to advise, integrate, & accelerate our customers’ outcomes from their digital transformation.  Due to business growth, we are currently hiring for a Big Data Hadoop Support Specialist to be based in Melbourne.  This role is structured within HPE’s Global Customer Solution Centre (CSC).  Our Solution Centres are made up of teams that provide remote (offsite) service; customer access, pre-sales, post-sales, & service delivery.  The focus is to solve various business systems & applications problems for customers, onsite engineering personnel & Authorised Service Providers on standard, specialised or complex systems.  As a Big Data Hadoop Support Specialist you will support & cover the entire Big Data solution stack, consisting of servers, storage, network technologies & specific software layers (including Hadoop, Linux, VMware, Bluedata, Microsoft) to make up a solution optimised for Big Data/Analytical workloads.  Key Responsibilities: In depth technical support of Big Data solutions, including troubleshooting & problem root cause analysis & resolution Deliver proactive services to new & existing installed base, worldwide, using remote support tools & methodologies Articulate clearly, recommend & explain resolutions to clients Resolve incidents, problems & proactive notification systems to contractual service levels Adopt best in class service delivery processes & methods Utilise advanced technical expertise to improve customer experience Use proactive monitoring methods/tools to identify problem prevention & continual improvement opportunities Administrate any changes to asset information Handle customer problems promptly, escalate issues according to established procedures Develop & maintain customer, internal & third party relationships Understand & utilize ITIL  Experience, Skills & Attributes Required: A minimum of 5 years + IT experience Demonstrable work experience as a Big Data / Hortonworks / Cloudera Hadoop Administrator Advanced troubleshooting skills gained from working in a support environment Excellent analytical & problem solving skills Excellent verbal & written communication skills Superior customer service skills Ability to take full ownership for resolution with escalated customers Proficient in system & change management best practices Demonstrate coordination skills to direct the work of onsite resources as required Hadoop Administration Certification preferred Phone & remote support experience highly regarded Docker container & BlueData EPIC experience highly regarded Working knowledge of Kubernetes would be highly regarded Ability to work on a rotating weekends (no night work)  You will be part of a large global IT leader that offers competitive compensation & career progression opportunities, who is committed to the values of workforce diversity, career development, & workplace flexibility.  Join us & make your mark!  For further information, browse https://www.bluedata.com/  #LI-MM1  Job: Services Job Level: Expert      Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.     HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to the use of arrest and conviction records, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws and will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

Ayan Infotech is in urgent need of a Technical Business Analyst to take up an initial 6 month contract in Melbourne, CBD. London based Sponsorship available Truly International role    Ampersand International are partnering with a premier global law firm in London, who are looking to appoint an experienced BD and Marketing Manager to work within a high profile and truly international practice group and are even prepared to SPONSOR the successful candidate!    This highly commercial and client orientated firm, views the business development and marketing function as one of critical importance to its future success. They are poised for strong growth across all practice areas, backed by a strategic and client focused vision.    A truly international role, you will be reporting directly to the Senior Business Development and Marketing Manager and benefit from the support of an energetic BD Coordinator. Working in collaboration with the central Pitching, PR, Digital, Internal Communications and Events teams, you will be expected to implement and execute revenue generating initiatives for a very high-profile and dynamic practice group. Presenting with the gravitas and credibility to build strong internal strategic relationships with the partnership and other key stakeholders, you will support with all aspects of managing clients and pursuing new business.  Bids and tenders are relatively infrequent in this position, but what is important is that you are a highly competent project manager, who has demonstrable experience in implementing data driven marketing campaigns and the ability to think strategically, whilst at the same time being very hands on. For further information, please contact Will Dunn at Ampersand on 02 8014 5570. Alternatively, forward your application to Will directly by using the 'apply now' link.

Business Analyst will work in the Digital Services Program within this Local Government organisation  Your new company Working in this Local Government organisation the aim of the Digital Services Program is to simplify and improve the online and mobile experience for Victorian citizens. The key focus is to provide a digital platform that makes it easier for the customer to deal with government departments and agencies, simplifying their online experience.  Your new role The Business Analyst will support the relevant Project Manager by working closely with the business and IT development teams to gather, analyse and document requirements for specific projects. Duties will typically involve: Document and map the interactions between business processes, information and data (including functional and interface specifications).Develop appropriate quality documentation of: User requirements documentation throughout the requirements lifecycle; Functional specifications and technical specifications; test requirements & acceptance criteria, report specifications, feasibility & solution option papers.Analyse current and future, information and technology requirements via: Business analysis planning and monitoring; Requirements management and communication; Data investigation and analysis; Requirements elicitation and analysis; and Solution design, assessment and validation.Assist with procurement processes and documentation.Manage and lead Agile deliverables and procedures.Conduct business analysis, solution design and business process re-engineering.Lead, facilitate and present to business workshops. What you'll need to succeed The Business Analyst will use their experience to make timely decisions under tight deadlines with conflicting priorities. You will be skilled in gathering the right information from various stakeholders to make informed, appropriate decisions. This role also requires high level of verbal and written communication skills to facilitate effective and clear liaison with stakeholders, with an ability to gain cooperation, present and deliver successful outcomes. Experience working with Local Government systems and procedures would be desirable.  What you'll get in return You will be rewarded with an ongoing contract, offering an attractive daily rate and a flexible working environment. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work on a high-profile project that will have a direct benefit and impact on citizens of Victoria.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV through to Steve Wall. Alternatively, email: steve.wall@hays.com.au

The company:Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a global market leader in transfer agency and share registration, employee equity plans, proxy solicitation and stakeholder communications.  We also specialise in corporate trust, mortgage, bankruptcy, class action, utility and tax voucher administration, and a range of other diversified financial and governance services.Computershare is represented in all major financial markets and has over 12,000 employees worldwide. The role:The business Project Management Office (PMO) is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join them on a permanent full-time basis. The business Project Management Office is accountable for portfolio and investment governance (incorporating demand management and benefit realisation), the execution of strategic programs and projects, and project management methodology and disciplines for the Australia & New Zealand Region.   The Business Analyst’s role is to understand business needs (as required across the spectrum of divisions/shared services within Computershare), by defining and analysing business and system processes and changes required to deliver solutions that address these needs. Responsibilities Include:Work with the Project Manager to plan and manage requirements approval process and changes to requirements scope and/or solution. Identify and communicate risks and issues that may impact plans and/or scope. Effectively obtain information from stakeholders to form requirements. Accurately capture the information provided in elicitation sessions in formats stakeholders can understand, review and validate. Obtain the needed approvals on requirements and functional specifications. Identify and manage changes to requirements including impact assessment. Identify and define the business needs. Identify and propose possible solution approaches. Identify and communicate constraints and assumptions that may impact potential solutions. About Spotless
Spotless is a great Australian success story.
With a staff force of 30,000+, we provide integrated facility management services that create added efficiencies for businesses everywhere. You'll find us in diverse locations from airline lounges and major sporting venues, to city offices and army barracks.  We have a strong presence all around Australia and New Zealand and we are proud of our people and our achievements.
If you are looking to make a positive career move, Spotless is a great choice for you.
 
The Role

Providing commercial and financial reporting including commentary and variance analysis to the Spotless corporate finance team, Infrastructure & Construction (‘I&C’) General Manager Finance & Commercial and I&C Finance Manager
Consolidated reporting across the I&C business unit
Managing all Cash flow modelling, forecasting and reporting
Undertaking and presenting monthly results analysis and management reporting
Preparing high quality data analytics to support Business cases, including financial and non-financial costs and benefits
Assisting with the I&C budgeting and forecasting processes
Identifying areas for improvement and efficiency within the I&C business units

 
Skills and Experience 
Ideally, you will come to us with the following skills and knowledge:

You will have 2 - 5 years of experience in a similar role. Experience in providing financial support and analysis to non-financial operational teams advantageous.
Ideally a background in a large corporate in a management accountant or business analyst role
Demonstrated ability to proactively build relationships with key stakeholders/clients, peers and colleagues
Good written and oral communication skills are essential, as well as the ability to remain organised and calm under pressure.
Proven experience and adaptability in a changing environment
Experience in extracting and working with ERP systems

Understanding our clients to better solve their problems and create engaging experiences for them is a fundamental skillset required right across the organisation.The Advanced Digital Engineering team has a broad remit, from enterprise grade cloud platforms, to data visualisations, to automation work. Our clients are both internal and external, and the scope for opportunity seems endless.As Arup has a global reputation for innovation and excellence in engineering. As a new discipline in the company we have an amazing opportunity to play a key role in Arup’s future.At this stage, we a looking for a BA designer on a contract to a specific, strategic project for 6-12 months. We anticipate team growth and anticipate being able to offer a full time role to the right candidate at the end of the contract period. During this contract you will be the BA designer for a key cloud platform, working with a business analyst, stakeholders / SMEs, and a development team, with high level support from a product manager:In this role you will:  Dig into a problem in depth to validate it, and drive ideation around creative solutions Facilitate and lead workshops with internal and external clients to understand business problems, processes, workflows and pain points Understand the different requirements of bespoke one-off projects vs products in terms of scalability and risk Manage stakeholder expectations Write user stories that can be picked up easily by the design team and later developers Work with designers on creating clean user experiences that meet the needs of the user Run sprint planning sessions – helping the developers understand the requirements and work towards the most appropriate solution Support the development team through a sprint Ensure each sprint team has a clear understanding of the priorities and focus Work independently but know how and when to escalate or ask for support Carry out basic testing on stories before release The people at Arup are driven to find a better way and to deliver better solutions for our clients. Take advantage of Arup’s flexible working culture to set and drive your agenda; we are open to candidates seeking a more flexible working week, including part-time/reduced hours.We offer a competitive remuneration package commensurate with qualifications and experience to the right candidate including a global profit share scheme, excellent staff benefits and long-term career development opportunities.If you are interested in helping us shape a better world, please click “Apply Now” to submit your online application. Please note submission due date for all applications is 31st May 2019.
