IN A NUTSHELL… Help us make better decisions by getting our (many) data pipelines flowing smoothly and sensibly into a well-architected warehouse.  Bellroy loves to balance art with science; using data to inform and test our theories, and iterating towards Truth. We need your help to  build, improve and maintain the infrastructure required to extract, transform, load and enrich data from a variety of sources.  With your help we’ll be able to get the right info, infer useful things and make better decisions. Then test, and keep improving. When the warehouse is fully functional, you’ll lend your sharp logic to improve internal processes, automate systems, and optimise, well, everything.  And down the track we’d love you to get involved with some Bayesian analysis, machine learning and other interesting data team projects. If you get excited by the idea of providing the right data to inform great decisions; and you want that data to be accessible, understandable and trustworthy, then this could be the job for you. If you bring your experience, smarts and detail-oriented brain to help us, we’ll offer a world-class team to learn from, the tools you need to do your thing, and the support you need to flourish.   YOU COULD BE THE ONE, IF…  Your logic and reasoning is formidable, as is your determination. You are ordered and decisive, yet creative at the same time. You like things to end up fitting neatly in the boxes; but you don’t mind looking outside of them in the first place to find the answers. You get a kick out of getting things right, and you have the patience to do that every time. Because you present your work with pride, knowing you’ve done all you can to make sure it’s correct – and useful. Disorder makes you uncomfortable. With well ordered data in a clean schema, life is good. But you love a challenge more than most other things, so where you see inconsistency or confusion, you also see an opportunity. And you’ll follow that thread until you’re confident you’ve sorted it out.   You might have been called a “bookworm” more than once in your life, because your curiosity has you forever seeking (and absorbing) information. And nowadays, this natural thirst for knowledge has you constantly looking at ways to improve, optimize and enhance – yourself, your processes, and your data. A bit like a mechanic will with a car, you’ll break apart the whole into pieces you can check and analyse, before rebuilding an idea, process or system into something better. Sound familiar? If so, we’d love to meet you (and that brain of yours).   IF YOU WERE HERE IN THE LAST COUPLE WEEKS YOU MIGHT HAVE:  Reviewed our overall data systems (supported by very competent sysadmins) to make sure everything was in order and to look for larger scale improvements Built out a handful of new pipelines to bring more of our core business data into our data warehouse Chased a handful of data validation alerts raised by our pipelines, and taken the time to get to the root cause of each of them, then either delegated the fix to an appropriate someone else or fixed them yourself Suggested an improvement to our A/B testing infrastructure Worked outside of data team, with our developers, flexing your database and query optimisation skills to decide whether to fix a performance issue they’re having at the database level, or insist that the fix should be in the code (and, that’s fun - they’re an excellent bunch) Provided an ad-hoc analysis (working with our analysts) to someone who requested it, integrating a one-off data source Talked with our CIO about some of our mid-term plans, and how we’ll support them with data THERE ARE SOME QUALITIES YOU MUST POSSESS:  At least three years experience in data-related roles Advanced working knowledge of SQL and experience in ETL using a workflow management tool such as Apache Airflow Experience with building and optimising data pipelines Experience with collecting data from a variety of sources including APIs (good APIs, bad APIs, and ugly APIs) Strong analytical skills and an ability to perform root cause analysis Training in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another relevant quantitative field (or demonstrable skill in one of those areas and the story of how you built that skill without formal training) Very high precision – you need to know how to verify that your work is correct Bonus points for more experience with relevant programming languages (ie. Ruby on RAILS, Python, R, Scala), PostgreSQL, project management and machine learning.   LOCATION AND HOURS This is a full-time role based in our Fitzroy office.  Start Date: We're ready when you are!   IF YOU'RE READY TO APPLY... We love receiving applications directly. Please visit this website: https://grnh.se/9b4b38f31. You'll need your cover letter, resume and to answer a couple questions.

The Siemens Mobility team is looking for an individual that is aligned with our company values: excellent, innovative and responsible to carry out design, checking and testing of application data for train control systems. Diversity and inclusion helps us fully realise the potential of our people. As part of Siemens Ownership culture, Siemens also genuinely supports reasonable flexible working practices that empower our employees to best meet work and personal commitments.

job_title: Agile Business Analyst | Salesforce Marketing Cloud

job_title: Technical Lead - Data Governance / Information Architecture
job_description:
As a Technical Lead - Data Governance / Information Architecture, you will have experience with decision making capabilities on technical architecture and solution design.
You will have experience in large complex enterprise data systems (including Data Acquisition/Movement, Data Governance, Data Lakes, Compute Provisioning, Reporting, Visualization and Data Science platforms) and have proven track record in simplification through automation of asset lifecycle management and enablement. 
You are always looking ahead to ensure your solutions fit in the bigger picture and the long-term strategy.  You are a provider of viable solutions aligned with industry best practices and emerging technologies. You lead others, participate and are accountable for implementation through the project lifecycle.
Key Responsibilities will include:

Identify value opportunities to exploit the domain or technology for maximum business effectiveness.
Proactively identify and create viable proposals for technology improvements and adoption in line with Strategy.
As a Product owner in collaboration with the Platform manager, customers and other stakeholders, develop the Technology Roadmap of assets you are accountable for.
Lead the improvement of automation practices and security in the team.
Define software quality practices and improve development processes.
Upskill and mentor developers of various experience & capability.
Participate in and support the rollout of continuous improvement initiatives.
Performance measurement and tuning

Skills, experience & qualifications

Experience with Data Governance Tools, such as Collibra and Reference Data Management Solutions (required)
Extensive experience in investigating, recommending and integrating/deploying third party solutions, including Vendor/Partner collaboration in areas including Data Governance, Reporting Tools, Data Lakes, distributed Compute and Visualisation (required) 
Demonstrated ownership and delivery of solutions which provide uplift to systems, processes, standards and ways of working.
Knowledge and experience with Agile Development practices, Test Driven Development & Continuous Integration.
Knowledge of ITIL and service management practices
Demonstrated passion for Service & User enablement and delivery
Demonstrated successful influencing and working with multiple stakeholders, both Technology and Business.
Experience with Cloud environments; compute, data and security related services

 So what's on offer

Flexible working arrangements 
Up to 25% off insurance, Banking, superannuation
Employee share scheme (permanent employees only)
Competitive salary and excellent employee benefits

If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. Click to submit an application form online today.

Demonstrated high-level report writing skills and experience- able to translate complete data into digestible and simple messages in line with key business goals Able to deliver consistent and accurate reports, presenting current trends and emerging issues in simple message for consumable reports to key stakeholders Proficient in MS Excel Tertiary qualifications in mathematics, statistical, computer sciences discipline or relevant work experience  Desirable Criteria:  Experience using SAS (Base, EG), SQL, sharepoint and PANDA/PANDA Live  Cultural Criteria:  Demonstrated ability to work flexibly and collaboratively in a team with high levels of communication skills, due to some team members based nationally Supporting BI Analyst Managers (direct reports) Ability to work independently and navigate priority action items directed by the BI Analyst Manager Ability to supervise, lead, coach and develop analysts to produce quality products and services  Aus Citizens or Perm Residents with 5 years Australian working history considered!If this sounds like the opportunity for you, please apply now!For further information, please contact: Emily Walsh at emily.walsh@mtpservices.com.au

We are in the market for a business architect who has experience working with emerging technologies. This position is also open to senior business analysts with experience in applying and operationalising emerging technology. Client DetailsBe part of a proven culture of success within one of the world's most recognisable brands. With a culture of work-life balance and achieving team based success, this is the perfect place to up-skill and accelerate your career growth.As pioneers in full scale automation of businesses using machine learning, AI and innovative technologies, this is an extremely unique team to be a part of. Constant up-skilling and refinement of knowledge is paramount to the continued retention and growth of the team. DescriptionUndertake business architecture and design activities to align strategic business goals and objectives with decisions regarding products, services, partners and suppliers, functional capabilities and key business and technology initiatives.Design and deliver solutions that align the business strategy, insight needs, information flows and functional structure of the organization to provide the required outcomes encompassing analytics, process excellence and business transformation.You will proactively: Engage with senior client stakeholders to understand their vision and to define and recommend valid and pragmatic strategies and solutionsCraft compelling and innovative business strategies to solve client problems and are aligned to the solutions and present to C-level clients Define the business case to secure funding for investment in strategies and solutions Define the business capabilities, business services and information flows required to deliver the recommended strategies and solutions Prescribe the program roadmaps to deliver target state solution designs encompassing business and technology needs Partner with technical specialists on the design of new and complex insight-driven decisioning solutions Deliver new business capabilities through the implementation of strategies and solutions Contribute to the definition and enhancement of business architecture disciplines within the practice  ProfileA sound understanding of digital technologies, analytics, information management and business process based solutions and the application of such solutions to deliver new business capabilities. You will have a proven ability to: Define the value chain and competitive environment of a client’s business Develop the business case for investment in capabilities including the identification and quantification of business benefits Explore and document client needs into functional and non-functional requirements Design complex business customer journey’s, processes and workflows that incorporate analytic, process excellence and business transformation outputs Conduct complex analysis and structured problem solving, resulting in pragmatic and executable recommendations to clients Define business policies and rule associated with insight-driven decisioning solutions Ideate and validate business initiatives Bridge the gap between technology and business environments  Job OfferThe Business Architect role is a permanent position on offer in a high performing team with a competitive remuneration package.

The CompanyThis is an international organization with a powerful brand and a reputation for excellence and innovation. A membership-based business with a wide consumer base, this is a growth orientated company, with lots of forward momentum. They have built an incredible culture and place to work due to investing in quality personnel according to a comprehensive set of values.In order for the business to implement Dynamics 365, all their data from multiple legacy systems, needs to be analyzed, cleansed and migrated. This has now created a need for a Data Migration Specialist to be the conduit between the business, IT and the Solution Implementer. As the Data Migration Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in the implementation of a new Dynamics365 ERP System which includes the configuration of finance, supply chain and field operations modules. The RoleReporting directly into the Delivery Manager, the role will require the Data Migration Specialist to analyze, design, extract, cleanse, test and migrate data from multiple systems to a clean data set, ready for transformation and load into Dynamics 365 by the Solution Implementer. Specifically, the Data Migration Specialist will;Extract and cleanse data from legacy systems to target a clean dataset.Review, interpret, recommend and respond to the detailed design proposed by the Solution Implementer and align it with the business requirements.Manage data quality through identification, assessment, monitoring, and correction of issues.Manage data validation through quantitative and qualitative checks to measure the success of the migration as well as detect defects.Data Cleansing of source for data migration to ensure data validation and migration.Develop a wide range of reports and relevant lists from the database for the use in ST and UAT.Document the data migration plan, schedule, test plan and detailed conversion reports.Support the solution implementers migration team by ensuring they have the necessary resources, tools, data and access to achieve their objectives and products.Work with SME resources and assist in performing the reconciliation and data migration testing process to highlight any issues for correction.Work with SMEs to User Acceptance Test for data migration and sign off.Assist in development of cutover plans and schedules for trial migrations, dress rehearsals and go-live implementations. Your ProfileSignificant experience as a Data Migration Specialist or similar.Experience in migrating existing legacy data to an enterprise solution.Experience with Databases, T-SQL scripting, stored procedures and data models.Expertise in developing migration solutions within SQL Server, SSRS, ETL tools, Data conversion, Data De-duplication and Data Cleansing.Ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders as well as managing their expectations through a migration process.Data migration on at least one major Microsoft Dynamics implementation project or similar.Exposure to Microsoft Dynamics GP (source system), Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Microsoft Dynamics AX, Microsoft Dynamics 365 is highly desirable.Apply TodayPlease send your resume to us by clicking the “Apply Now” button. Resumes in MS Word format are preferred.Job Reference No: 06810-0010941994JR

Senior Data Migration (EOL) Specialist Glen Waverley  Who we are  We are a tech company that exists to help other businesses succeed. Our team is continually growing, inventing and disrupting conventions. To make all this happen, we are dedicated in creating an exceptional flexible employee experience for all team members and offer a culture that encourages your authenticity. We don’t want you to simply ‘fit’ into our already established culture, we want you to come and add to it, and make it even better.  The MYOB way We simplify, we collaborate, we find new ways to innovate, we set goals, we smash goals and we always make the call. It’s the way we do things around here. We are inspired, authentic, and in the know… This is the MYOB Way.  Are you ready to go boldly? The Data Services team is critical to delivering MYOB’s vision to be the number 1 online accounting solution. You will be responsible for helping migrate client’s data files into new Online database platforms, repair existing data structures, and timely support of internal and external stakeholders via email and phone.  The Role You will provide exceptional phone support service for clients and internal stakeholders looking to move online, whilst diagnosing and troubleshooting data file issues preventing a straight-forward migration, to ensure file is successfully migrated. To support online flow, we ensure that customers with issues preventing Live Service adoption are contacted and addressed quickly and deliver best-in-class service to internal and external clients by providing timely, high quality analysis, repair and upgrades on client data files. The key aim of this role is to provide quality Datafile conversion services to clients moving to or within MYOB product offering and deliver upgrades in accordance with SLA turnaround times.  What you will bringA well-developed understanding of MYOB software offeringsA foundation understanding of SQL database structure and functionDemonstrated ability to balance and priorities large workloadExcellent communication and relationship management capabilityHigh levels of drive and initiativeThe ability to converse with clients who possess varying degrees of IT and accounting knowledgeAdvanced experience in SQL databases and .NET is strongly preferredCompetency in a wide range of MYOB products and systemsFoundation understanding of common business practicesConflict resolution skills If you want to work and collaborate where opinions are valued and your ideas can make a difference, you should work at MYOB. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

Comdain Infrastructure delivers end-to-end engineering and asset management services to leading utility and energy providers across Australia.   With a focus on the gas and water sectors, our success is underpinned by our resolute commitment to excellence in safety, quality, innovation and sustainability.   A new opportunity has arisen for an ERP Business Systems Analyst to join Comdain's vibrant and passionate team at our Head Office in Epping.   Reporting to the Lead of IT Projects, this role is perfect for someone who is excited about providing technical and user support, analysis, configuration management and training   As the successful candidate, you will demonstrate the following;  The contribution to applications and overall IT strategy by meeting with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirements and systems goals; Leading design sessions in prototyping enhancements to MYOB GreenTree and new systems for the purpose of enhancing business processes, operations, and information process flow; Collaboration in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new applications, and enhancements to existing applications; Building and configuring approved changes to MYOB GreenTree and other systems as required; Coordination and perform in-depth testing, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems, and other post-implementation support configurations and documentation; The review and analyse the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems; Act as first point of contact for any/all ERP issues including (but not limited to) MYOB GreenTree, Comdain’s field services application and some integration between various business applications; Build and design queries and reports for extracting data for analysis and reporting.  What do you bring? This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to be a part of the transformation and improvement projects by managing the ERP implementations, systems, policies and change.   In addition to the above, we require an individual with;  Computer Science or Information Systems Degree or Diploma – Preferable Excellent telephone and interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate at all levels of the organisation including training provision; Proven experience in the design, development, configuration and maintenance of software systems, particularly MYOB Willingness to support the IT team in all areas, undertaking all tasks necessary within the broad scope of area of responsibility. Ability to work flexible hours, travel long distance and travel interstate to meet the demands of the role  We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you’re interested, please send your CV by clicking the "Apply Now" button.  We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We are committed to building an inclusive environment for all Comdain employees.   Please note:  Comdain Infrastructure does not accept any unsolicited resume referrals from Recruitment Agencies. Please do not submit any resumes or associated profiles to any Comdain Infrastructure employees. We will not be liable or responsible for any fees or costs associated with unsolicited resume referrals

job_title: Business Development Manager, Cloud & Data Centre
job_description: About Us Ensyst is a specialist business leading in the focus area of cloud and data centre technologies across multiple vendors such as Microsoft, AWS, Cisco, Pure Storage, NetApp and Dell EMC. This Business Development Manager role is tasked with providing deep cloud sales expertise to support the Ensyst and Optus Business sales organisations. Work collaboratively with all stakeholders (Account Managers, Solution Architects and other Specialists as needs be) to formulate appropriate solutions in consultation with and for customers that align with their needs and the Ensyst go to market strategy. The role will require a high level of internal senior stakeholder, senior sales management and client relationship skills (CXO level) with strong planning skills to build and drive a cross organisational sales teams to deliver the desired results. Demonstrable cloud and data centre experience, and a clear knowledge of the ICT marketplace are critical requirements. Understanding client buying behaviour in focus market areas will be key in this role, as will be an individual who can provide tangible evidence of character qualities such as drive, energy, passion, resilience, enthusiasm and the focus and the hunger to succeed. The role will drive revenue and gross profit. Financial performance and achievement reporting and analysis is required to forecast the success of the cloud and data centre portfolio.You’ll be responsible for:Identifying, qualifying and closing opportunitiesConsulting with customers to understand their business requirementsFinancial performance achievementSales forecastingDesign and proposalsContinuous improvementBuilding strong internal partnershipsFostering customer focus and teamworkSkills and ExperienceExperience and demonstrated capability is mandatory as well as an understanding of industry standards e.g.) ISO27000 series, specifically ISO27001/2, PCI-DSS, ISO31000.Substantial experience and a proven track record in consulting and selling complex solutions in specialist area of Cloud & Data Centre solutionsKnowledge, understanding and application of Information Security standards, methodologies and practicesUnderstanding of the Cloud & DC industry and evolution of technologiesCloud & Data Centre industry association membership and attendance; undertaken continuous professional education and knowledge improvementBusiness Development proven track record of identifying, hunting and closing new business across a number of corporate and government sectorsExperience with Customer Experience related business requirements and providing complex cloud and data centre solutions to support improved customer outcomes, reduced vulnerabilities and increased efficienciesExperience working with technology from technology vendors such as; Cisco; Microsoft, AWS, NetApp, Dell EMC, PureStorageExperience crafting consulting, professional services and managed Cloud & Data Centre services proposalsExcellent knowledge and skills in technologies, standards with appropriate technical level certificationsSound methodical approach to technical problem solving and architectural design of solutionsProven ability to identify "C level" decision makers; ability to initiate and develop successful strategic customer relationships directly tied to business and industry needs.Proven track record in the consulting and selling of complex solutions, and broad general knowledge of complex managed Cloud & Data Centre servicesStrong track record of accomplishment yet have a flexibility and willingness to try new sales methods, processes, combined with a thirst for continued learning and educationAbility to bring and develop a deep understanding of a mix of industry sectors, client profiles and the networking opportunities thereinAbility to perform under pressure and flexibility in approach to problemsWork autonomously and are well organised, disciplined and methodicalAbility to quickly develop strong customer and vendor relationshipsStrong team orientation (collaboration)Strong presentation skills coupled with superior interpersonal articulation and listening skillsExceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, combined with strong presenceHeads Up!! Due to the fast paced nature of the Optus business, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change. Don’t delay, make sure you apply as soon as possible. We will assess applications as they are received.One last thing, Optus operates a direct sourcing model so no agency introductions, sorry folks.

job_title: Sessional Lecturers/Tutors - IT and Business Courses
job_description: ATMC is seeking a number of professional and experienced Sessional Lecturers/Tutors to deliver Information Technology,Business Management, Marketing,Business Analysis and Statistics, Auditing, Law and Accounting units for our courses based in our Sydney CBD campus. ABOUT ATMC  Australian Technical and Management College (ATMC) is a nationally recognised educational institute with campuses in Melbourne and Sydney. ATMC is associated with  Federation University Australia (FedUni) & University of the Sunshine Coast (USC). ATMC, in association with the partner universities, delivers both Bachelors and Masters Programs in the areas of Information Technology, Information Systems, Business, Management and Accounting. ATMC constantly strives to deliver a high quality student experience, by delivering quality academic instructions and providing a range of support services to our international and domestic students in order to ensure that their time in Australia is both successful and enjoyable. About the Positions   We require a number of Sessional Lecturers/Tutors to deliver courses in the following discipline areas for  Semester 2, 2019 year at our Melbourne campuses:  Information Technology  Non-Relational Database Systems Network, Management and Security Gaming development and Fundamentals Mobile Development Fundamentals Business process Analytics and Change Software Engineering Methodologies Programming   Business Analysis and Statistics   Business Analytics and Statistics   Finance  Trade and Finance in a Global Economy   Auditing  Auditing and Professional Practice Issues in Auditing Practice   Law  Commercial Law Taxation Law and Practices Business Law   Accounting  Issues in Auditing Practice Auditing and Professional Practice   Unit materials for delivery will be provided to Lecturers. Successful candidates will be expected to make themselves available for student consultations and staff meetings, as required. Selection Criteria Essential:  Masters' qualification or higher in the relevant discipline area Minimum of two years teaching experience at a tertiary level Copies of student evaluations at the previous and/ or current workplace Microsoft Office suite proficiency A demonstrated commitment to delivering quality education Punctuality and professionalism Respect for people from diverse cultural backgrounds Desirable:  Industry experience Publications Experience in dealing with Moodle, Blackboard, Learnline and other eLearning platforms To apply, please upload your resume, along with copies of your student evaluations and a brief covering letter including the disciplines you have taught by clicking the button below. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Proven skills in financial, audit & business acumen & analysis, along with effective communication.
Strong retail background & extensive experience with budgeting & forecasting activities and financial analysis.

Ongoing development opportunities & the potential to grow

Let’s talk about MEWe’re not like other banks. ME was created by the industry super funds to be different from the pack ­– and we’re passionate about staying that way as we head into an exciting and progressive future. We are building a bank, a company and a brand that we can be proud of – but to achieve that, we need the best people. To help ME get there, you’ll challenge the status quo and share extraordinary ideas – and our size guarantees you’ll have the opportunity, support, and environment to be heard. ME’s core purpose is helping all Australians get ahead – no conditions, asterisks or exceptions. We believe everyone deserves the same opportunities in life, regardless of gender or identity, sexuality, ethnicity, disability or religion. This is why we’re so committed to an equal opportunity workplace – because we know our success won’t come from focusing on similarities, but by embracing and celebrating our diversity.   Let’s talk about the JOB: Mentoring and leading a team of down to earth and engaged BI and reporting professionals, ME’s BI and Reporting Manager is at the forefront of all matters data and most importantly, the use of data with cutting edge technologies and methodologies. As a key leader within ME’s Enterprise Data function and reporting to the General Manager, you will be responsible for developing and leading the Company’s Business Intelligence function to provide timely, accurate and meaningful business information to various stakeholders. You will act as a bank-wide advocate for structured data across the data lifecycle, from screen to use, in all parts of ME's business. You will be responsible for conducting awareness and training initiatives to create a measurable uplift in data literacy and data handling skills across the bank, as well as ensuring ME’s data management practices are demonstrably conducted in line with Statutory, Regulator, Audit and Risk expectations. You will also identify and pro-actively drive efficiency gains across the entire reporting suite Engendering strong working relationships with Business and Technology stakeholders, you will foster a strong data community between various business lines, acting as a driving force and strong advocate of the Data strategy and BI roadmap at Australia’s fastest growing Bank.   Let's talk about YOU: An Enterprise Data Platform expert who lives and breathes BI & Reporting, you have extensive experience working in Enterprise Data Platforms with advanced skills utilising SQL and the Microsoft Business Intelligence Reporting suite. You have a flair for design. In fact, you’re a thought leader with a keen interest in functional design across the data, analytics and decision systems domain. You empower your team to utilise emerging technologies to build out infrastructure that can be utilised and leveraged across the organisation. Additionally, you have the innate ability to see the ‘bigger picture’ around aligning reporting requirements to business outcomes. A problem solver and strong communicator, you have the gravitas to build relationships and influence cross functionally which will see you drive positive engagement in ME’s Data culture. Experience in Agile project management methodology will be highly regarded.   About the Perks At ME, we believe that work should be a place that you can make the most of – and these are just some of the many reasons why people love it here:  Popular culture – that’s not a claim, we’ve got the data to prove it. We genuinely care about each other and work in an encouraging and collaborative environment. The whole package – sure, we’re going to reward you well with your salary package – but there are also lots of other perks – including free health support, conveniently-located offices, plus much more. Not afraid to fail? We embrace action-oriented people like you. That’s right, you can make mistakes here and it’s ok – so long as you learn from them. To be ME, we need you – we’re building something really cool and you get to directly influence what that is. ProudlyME – our internal pride network – has a swag of initiatives that show support, education, and passion toward our team and customers, demonstrating that ME is a strong advocate on equal rights for the LGBTIQ+ community. Meet the Execs – our Executive team is fun and full of passion because we know great managers mean happy staff. Oh, and did we mention you get your very own ME branded Converse High-top shoes? Now that’s a reason to get your foot in the door.   I was born to play this role Can’t see a closing date on the advert? That’s because we’re pretty efficient here at ME and we may start looking at applications sooner rather than later, so if this role sounds like your jam, be sure to apply today.   Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including police checks, reference checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates; however will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the job.

Overview
We are looking for a Supply SAP Specialist - Cataloguing, to manage the MDM process and maintain the material master data for our mine site in Lihir.
As the Supply SAP Specialist - Cataloguing, you will also be responsible for:

Updating SAP with correct and accurate information in relation to cataloguing requirements
Creating, updating and maintaining material master data in line with the Master Data Standard and site requests and requirements via ANCI workflows
Monthly monitoring of OAS for inventory optimisation opportunities and action as required
Providing support and development in technical Inventory and SAP Master Data skills to PNG national on site Inventory Officers

This is a permanent role operating on a 5/2 roster based in our Melbourne office.
Lifestyle
At Newcrest, you'll be part of a diverse team of business professionals committed to our people and the communities in which we operate. We value diversity of thought, style and working arrangements.
Based on St Kilda Road, our Melbourne Head Office is easily accessible by public transport or car, with discounted parking available.
About You
To succeed in this role, you will have experience cataloguing new materials into SAP, according to a defined Master Data standard, and using Auslang cataloguing.  Along with your impeccable approach to safety, you will have sound decision making and problems solving skills with well-developed written and oral communication.
You will also have:

Ability to engage stakeholders at all levels of the organisation
Ability to prioritise work and work independently
Experience of SAP MM module more broadly
Commercial analysis and evaluation
An understanding of total cost and life cycle costing
Mining Industry experience (preferred)

About Us
Newcrest is the largest gold producer listed on the Australian Securities Exchange and one of the world’s largest gold mining companies.
Our people work together across locations in Australia, Papua New Guinea, Fiji, Indonesia and Canada and in every location, our people live our values and share our vision of being the Miner of Choice™. We’re committed to supporting a safe, diverse and inclusive culture where our talents and differences are valued. If you’re looking for a rewarding career that offers world-class opportunities, talk with us.
It’s an exciting time to be a part of Newcrest.
Please note we may consider applications on an ongoing basis and therefore encourage you to apply at your earliest opportunity.

The role
David Jones is on the search for a Project Manager who will manage the design and construction of business & external vendor initiatives to achieve the company strategy.
For success in this role you will positively influence the delivery of these projects by:

Managing the annual programme of business and vendor initiatives across the existing store network
Work closely with the Store Operations teams to ensure store disruption is minimised if not eliminated
Manage project budgets and provide accurate design construction cost estimates
Maintain weekly project development
Tender and award building contracts managing the construction phase
Maintain and grow key relationships with internal and external stakeholders

The successful candidate will possess the following:

Demonstrated experience in tenancy coordination, project management or a similar role
Strong initiative and project management skills
Demonstrated ability manage complex, time-dependent deliverables and work within a fast paced environment whilst balancing competing interests
Strong contract negotiation skills
Ability to work alongside a range of key stakeholders in order to achieve business outcomes
Possess excellent communication skills, both written and spoken
Ability to read and understand plans and technical data

Why work for us?

A competitive remuneration package, including incentives
Generous discounts for you and your immediate family across David Jones with further discounts within our sister brands, Country Road, POLITIX, Trenery, Witchery and MIMCO products.
Excellent career opportunities given upcoming change/transformation projects
A genuine, open and high performing culture
Opportunity to become involved in our Corporate Social Responsibility program, by supporting our community partnerships

About Us
David Jones and the Country Road Group is Australasia’s largest department store and fashion retail group comprising of iconic brands such as David Jones, Country Road, POLITIX, Trenery, Witchery and MIMCO. Part of Woolworths Holding (SA) our values include being Customer Obsessed, Collaborative, Inspirational, Responsible and Dedicated to Quality. We are looking for highly motivated and passionate individuals to be part of the Group’s evolution and support each brand to realise their full potential.

Ideally, candidates will also have been successful in a role where you will have had an activity-based approach to sales, extensive experience in phone-based sales, a “total gun” at prospecting and a proven ability in achieving your sales targets. At least 2 years of SaaS (or related) sales experience is an advantage Impeccable communication skills and highly driven to succeed Cold calling is part of your DNA - you love it! POSITION SUMMARY SPS Commerce has an exciting opportunity for you in our  Fulfillment group in a permanent capacity. This is an opportunity to join a fun, dynamic, global, and rapidly growing company. As a Project Manager, you will work within a team of professionals responsible for designing, developing and testing solutions with SPS customers.  You will manage the delivery of our services with customers and will act as the primary technical and non-technical contact until the customer is successfully flowing electronic data.  Core responsibilities also include managing testing and configuration of a system that supports electronic data flow between business retailers and their network of suppliers.   POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES  Create and maintain project work schedules, track customer requirements and translate customer requests into project deliverables Consistent engagement of team members, demonstrating delivery excellence Manage day to day project tasks for implementing SPS Commerce Products and Services from close of sale through handoff to customer support Act as information broker by directing communication to/from team and customers Demonstrate proficiency in service delivery managing multiple projects Coordinate other functional interaction to support implementations of projects Monitor work-flow requirements to meet timelines and quality expectations Ensure quality standards and metrics are being consistently applied in the implementation of projects Demonstrate the ability to proactively prioritize needs and effectively manage resources Perform other projects and responsibilities, as assigned. Be an advocate for positive change and improvement within the organization by identifying and communicating the compelling needs for change/improvement   EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED  Tertiary qualifications are preferred, but not essential 2+ years project management experience Demonstrated understanding of Project Management methodologies Strong problem solving & analytic ability Quality focused; detail oriented; ability to prioritize and multi task Proven ability to handle multiple projects Excellent organizational skills and written/oral communication skills Experience developing processes and managing projects in a technology based service organization desired Demonstrated ability to lead teams and drive external consultants to achieve goals Demonstrated ability to work with minimal supervision while taking initiative and setting priorities in a demanding, fast-paced environment   WHO WE ARE SPS is a rapidly growing, publicly traded company that is reshaping the retail supply chain. We are seeking passionate, hard-working team players interested in working in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. As a winner of multiple Best Place to Work awards, we embrace the work-hard, play-hard company culture. SPS Commerce offers competitive salaries and a complete benefit package along with great company perks.  With quarterly company-wide events, a casual work environment and over 60 consecutive quarters of growth, SPS is a fun, vibrant place to work that offers dynamic/challenging work in a friendly, team-oriented atmosphere.

Our Company:Secure Meters is a market leader in the development, manufacture, and supply of electronic energy meters and associated data services to the Australian energy retail market. We have an excellent reputation globally and nationally we are seeking an additional Business Development Manager to further cultivate our market presence in the energy sector. The Role:As the Business Development Manager(BDM), you will be responsible for engaging with Energy Retailers, through our appointed Meter Providers(MP),  to develop and win business. This is to be achieved through continuous professional contact with existing and/or new clientele at multi levels. The primary BD responsibility is to target and develop new clients resulting in proposal and contracts to drive profitable business. In addition, the BDM will manage an existing customer portfolio to deliver outstanding service and work with these customers to develop ongoing value propositions delivered through the technology. Working with our MP Partners you will be selling a complete metering and data service in a market that has seen Secure attain an excellent reputation and brand within a highly competitive market.  Your key focus will be to expand market share within the Energy Market by identifying opportunities, and securing contracts where our solutions can improve operational efficiency, enable unique value propositions and reduce cost for energy retailers   As part of your role you will also undertake market research in the region to steer product development and competitor intelligence. You will continue to place the Secure brand of products and services in the forefront of retailers by your dealings with key decision makers. You will be required to travel domestically and at times overseas. What's On Offer:A great opportunity to join a strong and expanding business, selling a leading solution with a competitive price point that clients will require long term. A long- term career with growth opportunities and training internally with competitive salary package comprising of base salary, bonus scheme, superannuation, vehicle allowance, phone, laptop   Key Requirements:   Demonstrated 5+ years-experience within the Australian Energy Retail Market   Solid understand of the Australian energy market and statutory frame works. Should possess good techno-commercial acumen and should thoroughly understand the business processes and technologies in order to reduce cost to serve. A keen interest and passion in energy efficiency and the environment Well-presented and confident building relationships with clients Excellent written and verbal communication skills   If you have the drive,  demonstrated experience and desire to achieve APPLY NOW!  Forward you resume to Michelle with a brief covering letter stating why this role is for you ?   Australian permanent residents need only apply.   We thank you for your interest in SECURE METERS (Australia) Pty Ltd.

job_title: Manager, Business Enablement Asia Pacific (Sales Operations)
job_description: Who We Are At SOTI, we are committed to delivering best in class mobile and IoT device management solutions. We are looking for out of the box thinkers that appreciate the art of creating great software. To us, being visionary is more important than doing things the way they’ve always been done.     What We’re Looking ForOur people are our most important resource. The Manager, Business Enablement Asia Pacific is responsible for creation and execution of a sales & marketing operations plan and road map improving the processes and tools available to the sales & marketing teams today, and creating new processes and tools as required to drive the success of our high-growth business. Reporting to the Senior Director, Business Enablement this multi-disciplinary role calls for a technically savvy person that is equal parts: sales & marketing representative, behavioral and business process analyst, change agent, information architect, and cross-functional collaborator. They will work closely with marketing, product, service, legal, and finance teams to ensure improved commercial performance across all business units.   What’s in it for you? The People - From our humble origins in our founder’s basement, to our industry leading position today, SOTI has worked hard to foster a company culture that we can all believe in. A culture that emphasizes personal growth, continuous innovation and fun.   The Growth - Our environment fosters new ideas, fresh perspectives, and the ability to take them over the goal line. SOTI is a fast-paced environment with a global reach that encourages you to make your mark and be part of something big!   The Technology - You’ll get the chance to work with leading edge technologies and take on complex and interesting projects, as part of highly collaborative and agile teams. You will work alongside SOTI’s partners which include leading tech giants that will keep you on the cusp of emerging technologies.   What You’ll Do  Own the weekly Drive Plans designed to help the Sales & Marketing organization deliver to target. Develop ad-hoc and region wide commercial offerings. Help drive accurate forecasting within Asia Pacific, develop methodology and best practices and implement. Act as the single point of accountability for the deal desk for Asia Pacific. Provide input to the annual and quarterly target setting process for Asia Pacific. Deliver best-practice business processes for sales & marketing, and integration of sales & marketing with other functions at SOTI. Provide strategy, data, and analysis linking marketing, sales and lead generation Work with regional Sales Leaders to improve sales effectiveness by understanding the local needs and mapping them to global programs Design programs and tools to increase prospect conversion and new customer acquisition, increase customer retention and improve sales efficiency. Ensure marketing and sales strategies are aligned, eliminate overlap, and are optimized Facilitate a steady flow of communications and feedback between Sales and Marketing. Deliver ad-Hoc reporting   Experience You’ll Bring  3-5 years Sales Enablement or Sales Operations experience within a commercial tech industry including forecasting & reporting Have a strong commitment to excellence and is customer service driven. Experience in a dynamic sales and marketing environment with cross-regional exposure. Has previous experience of (S&OP) Sales & Operations Planning or (IBP) Integrated Business Planning methodology. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy   About SOTI SOTI is the world's most trusted provider of mobile and IoT management solutions, with more than 17,000 enterprise customers and millions of devices managed worldwide. SOTI's innovative portfolio of solutions and services provide the tools organizations need to truly mobilize their operations and optimize their mobility investments. SOTI extends secure mobility management to provide a total, flexible solution for comprehensive management and security of all mobile devices and connected peripherals deployed in an organization.  At SOTI, we celebrate the uniqueness of our global teams and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are curious problem solvers who are committed to bringing the best mobile and IoT management solutions to market. We offer careers with #EndlessPossibilities. What are you waiting for? Apply today: https://www.soti.net/careers

Founded in 1996, Melbourne Institute of Technology (MIT) has grown dynamically as one of the leading private, higher education providers in Australia that strives to be forward thinking, innovative and having an impact in everything that they do.  With a network of campuses in Melbourne and Sydney, they provide Business, Accounting, IT, Engineering (Telecommunications) and Networking programs, at Bachelor and Master Degree levels to Australian and International students.  MIT has built a culture based on leadership, excellence in teaching and learning, integrity, accountability, commitment to quality services and teamwork.    The School of Business offers a range of degrees at undergraduate and post graduate levels. The School has three disciplines: Accounting, Management and Marketing and has Digital Marketing and Business Analytics as strategic priority areas. Reporting to the Academic Director, The Head of School, Business is a key leadership position responsible for the performance of the School including teaching and learning outcomes, strategic planning, the school’s plan, external engagement, staffing and quality assurance of all School of Business courses.   The School seeks an energetic academic leader to provide strong strategic insights in education with a vision that will take MIT to higher levels coupled with operational management experience to oversee the delivery of quality teaching programs and foster a culture of collaboration and innovation. The Head of School will also teach and make a significant contribution to teaching and learning leadership with the aim of improving learning outcomes for students and to produce outstanding graduates. To be successful, you will have a Doctorate (mandatory) and have a National and International record of achievement in teaching and research in higher education and a demonstrated capacity to play a leading role in academic administration and its management.  You will possess excellent people management skills which bring out the best qualities of staff in a multicultural environment supported by personal integrity, passion and a commitment to quality and service. To apply or to request a copy of the Candidate Information Booklet, please email at apply@kurasleadershipsearch.com    Applications should include a covering letter, CV and a statement addressing the selection criteria.  Applications close 10th May 2019.

About Nextt Nextt Health is a dynamic and fast-growing organisation at the forefront of the provision of support to a range of people in the community with a disability that are seeking to improve their quality of life, personal well-being and social inclusion. A clear vision, investment in technology and development of effective processes have created exciting opportunities to develop new ways of working and for our teams to focus on supporting the wider business and driving commercial outcomes. There continues to be a strong customer focus, both internal and external.  Owing to continued growth we are looking for an experienced Business Development Manager to expand our business in Victoria. About the Role: Reporting to the National, Business Development Manager; this role is responsible for driving business development activities across our three VIC sites – Geelong, Ballarat and Melbourne Metro and can be based out of our office in Camberwell or Geelong. Key accountabilities of the role include:  Driving revenue growth through the establishment of value-adding relationships with external referral pathways Manages quoting to maintain established Gross Margin targets and achieve revenue growth for the Victorian region Collaborate with the National Business Development Manager and General Manager, Service Delivery in forecasting growth and setting and monitoring revenue targets Maintain and communicate an extensive knowledge of market conditions and trends, opportunities and competitor activity Ensure internal processes of lead generation, qualification and conversion are aligned and functioning effectively – including the efficacy of CRM data Monitor and influence client retention through direct intervention, management of client satisfaction and development of retention strategies where relevant  What we offer:  Workplace diversity is highly valued at Nextt and we recognise a diverse workforce is beneficial for our employees and those who utilise our services Our Geelong office is in a distinctive heritage building, conveniently located in Gheringhap St and the trendy Camberwell office provides easy accessibility to transport and cafes Confidential Employee Assistance Program (EAP) is available to all employees at Nextt Be a part of a fun and dynamic team of people who are passionate about providing quality services Great perks and discounts on products and services that enhance life at home and at work through Hero Shop exclusively for our employees!  About you: To be successful in this role, you will possess:  Passionate about working in the Mental Health/Disability sector Highly driven and motivated by success 3 to 5 years experience in sales or business development within the Disability sector/NDIS Previous sales experience with the ability to manage a healthy lead generation and opportunity management Demonstrated ability in identifying opportunities for campaigns, services, and distribution channels  Furthermore the successful candidate will be required to have a satisfactory National Police Check clearance. Since travel is part of this role, it would be advantageous if you have a driver's licence and your own transport. Please contact Ms Bhumika Joseph, People and Culture Manager, Melbourne for a confidential discussion on 03 9829 9142 or email on bjoseph@nextt.com.au   The Nextt Group of Companies values diversity and is an equal opportunity Employer.
