About the business  VicTrack owns Victoria's transport land, assets and infrastructure and works to protect and grow the value of the portfolio, to support a thriving transport system, and make travel and living better for Victorians. With much of the asset portfolio dedicated to transport – our lands, infrastructure, trams and trains, and telecommunication networks – our focus is strategic asset management and supporting the delivery of better transport solutions. With a strong commercial focus we invest back into transport and communities, and support other non-commercial activities like community projects and environmental and heritage preservation. Our core functions Victoria's Transport Integration Act 2010 sets out the objectives for each transport sector agency, and as the asset owners, our role is to manage the assets consistent with transport system objectives. Our core functions include: Telecommunication services and network infrastructure that supports public transportManagers of land set aside for transport purposes, including the development and sale of land no longer required for transportProject management and civil engineering services for rail infrastructure upgradesTransport facilities and asset management, including the open access Dynon Rail Freight Terminal and heritage, buildings and environmental preservation  About the role  An integral member of the People & Culture team, the Business Partner provides day to day people related advice, coaching and support to the whole of VicTrack. This is a 12 month limited tenure position. Key accountabilities/functions Partner with the people leaders across the business to provide responsive, accurate and timely advice, support and coaching on all manner of people related matters.Manage and participate in the recruitment process of staff across the organisation, in line with VicTrack and VPSC policies and procedures.Take an active role in the management of Employee Relations cases including performance management, disciplinary action, grievances and termination.Report on and provide analysis of key HR metrics (including absenteeism, turnover, training, workforce profile).  Identify trends in the HR metrics and liaise with leaders on potential education programs and solutions as appropriate.Contribute to the development, review and monitoring of People & Culture policies and procedures to ensure they are relevant and up to date.Provide advice to managers on employment conditions and the interpretation and application of the Enterprise Agreement and organisational policies and procedures.Assist in the coordination and delivery of People & Culture cyclical activities such as Annual and Interim Performance Management, salary reviews etc.Deliver and participate in programs and tools developed by the Centre of Excellence to improve the capability and capacity of the VicTrack workforce.Assist the Senior Business Partner and other Centre of Excellence Leads with various People & Culture projects.Manage the on boarding of new staff, including face to face induction and on-line inductions.Populate and update the data management systems to support the collection of meaningful and accurate metrics.Support the administration of the HR system, e.g. entering new staff, managing contractors etc.Liaise with Payroll to ensure the necessary documentation is completed for accurate and timely processing of employee pay such as confirmation documentation for exiting staff, staff increases, new starters etc.Collate data and complete surveys as requested by external government departments.Other duties as required from time to time.  Skills and experience  Qualifications Tertiary qualifications in Business Management, Commerce or Human Resources or similar, is desirable Knowledge & Experience Proven generalist Human Resources experience ideally within a multi-functional complex organisation providing support, coaching and advice at all levelsKnowledge of industrial relations legislation and government policies as it relates to enterprise agreements and managing performance, grievances and terminationsExperience in managing the administration and reporting within a HRIS Skills Ability to develop effective working relationships across all levels within the businessHigh level analytical and conceptual skillsStrong ability to influence stakeholders to support the delivery of outcomesProven ability to deliver programs and tools and facilitate information to groupsHighly developed written communication skills including the ability to prepare clear and comprehensive documentation and reportingHighly organised and able to prioritise conflicting deadlines and manage the expectations of others   To apply:Please download a full position description from our website: www.victrack.com.au.Applications for this career opportunity are invited from Australian Citizens or residents with the right to work in Australia by using the "apply for this job" button below. Please attach a copy of your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant skills and experience for this position.Offer of employment is strictly subject to successful background (pre-employment screening) and criminal records checksClosing Date: 8th May 2019 VicTrack is an equal opportunity and human rights employer. Please note recruitment agencies will not be engaged in this process.

About the role  The position of Business Development Manager for Victoria will require sourcing and securing new clients and managing existing customers. Use your expertise to form relationships and make your mark in a successful, growing business.    Responsibilities:  Identify customers and devise selling strategy Promote company USP`s, TLD and products Follow up visits to potential customers as needed Introduce new product lines to existing accounts Engage in sales & product training as needed Provide Sales Coordinator with data for reporting purposes Attend and participate in relevant meetings Analyse reports and spend for all customers Prepare quotations for key customers  Skills and Experience:  Able to plan and implement sales strategies Proven track record in achieving KPI's Effective negotiation and problem-solving skills Proven experience in a similar BDM role, ideally B2B Industrial/Parts/Distribution Able to identify potential customers; form, develop and maintain strong relationships  Benefits:   Competitive base salary + car + petrol + commission Highly autonomous role on the road with great work life balance A market leading business with huge growth mindset   About the Company  An Australian owned and operating wholesaler with a national distribution footprint and well-established quality brands. They distribute from 9 strategically placed warehouses in Australia and a further 5 in New Zealand with plans to keep growing.   Culture The company operates according to a strong values system, so you must be comfortable working in an organisation where respect, integrity and honesty are fundamental to everything they do. They pride themselves on being visionary and their dynamic management team drive a culture of continuous improvement at every service level.To apply hit the link below or email scust@sharpandcarter.com.au

job_title: New Business Manager | Promotions & Rewards - Marketing Services
job_description: iGoDirect is a promotional marketing company that provides marketing, promotions, cashbacks and rewards & loyalty solutions. It's a place where work sometimes feels like play, and where you'll meet some of the most motivated and forward-thinking professionals who like to describe themselves as "fun, energetic, and customer service savvy".We're looking for a Business Development Manager, ideally come from a recruitment background and with a HUNTER MENTALITY and the ability to build long term relationships. You are definitely not shy of picking up the phone  and "You thrive on getting to meet new people and able to build rapport with ease. This is a position where innovative ideas are valued, efforts applauded, and achievements recognized. What do we want in this SUPERSTAR SALES person:A winning personality and desire to connect with clients, assertive sales skills and closing ability. You are hungry and passionate and love getting on the phone and connecting with contact.   A team player with a sense of humour, consultative and a responsive business style. You have probably been in recruitment and really love the sales aspect. Responsibilities You will be seeking the rare opportunity to grow the business and bringing in new ideas for both our Rewards & Direct marketing business through the following:  Identify opportunities to expand the business, including through partnerships, mergers and new markets Analyse sales, marketing, finance and other reports to gain insights into how to improve performance and maximize growth Maintain sustainable and productive relationships with existing clients Manage daily operations, including employee training and development, contract negotiations and production planning Assess risks involved with new initiatives, ensure deadlines are met and be ready to handle unexpected situations You will combine creative thinking and data-led strategy in order to create successful and effective marketing campaigns for our clients leveraging from our established services and blue chip clients. Offering tailored marketing solutions to business today demands a quick response – the flexibility to create solutions to problems and invent ways to capitalise on and maximise opportunities. That’s why we’ve made sure that a lack of bureaucracy is refreshingly evident with us. You will be renowned for the following:  New Business & Account Management Great Networker Strategic Marketer Commercial Mind Customer Service Centric Project Management Skills  This position will include developing new business from your vast network, enhancing and developing Marketing solutions for our existing clients, managing client marketing campaigns with the client service team, client relationships and requests. You will need to demonstrate effective project management skills, with the experience of working on many projects at once.  Qualified candidates will also have strong verbal and written communication skills, good computer skills and the ability to multi-task and problem solve Experience required: Has a good understanding of the Data Driven Rewards and Loyalty Industry, and a desire to learn more. Has experience of the below:  New Business Development Account Management Project Managing Integrated Campaigns Advertising Promotional Marketing Attention to detail and strong organisation skills are key requirements for this role, as are the ability to work as part of a team and the desire to further develop knowledge and experience in marketing. Interaction: This role will work closely with key departmental and project stakeholders across the organisation.  Therefore, the ability to work collaboratively and effectively with all levels of management and staff within the organization is a key priority in this role.   Communication and cognitive abilities:  Cooperate with matrixed team members to meet goals or complete tasks. Comfortable working in ambiguous and/or stressful situations. Self-motivated and know when to seek guidance; detail-orientation is a must. Flexible, ability to change priorities quickly, and capacity to handle multiple tasks. Effective collaborator with proven process improvement skills. Exceptional organization and time management skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to consistently learn new technologies and apply those concepts to customer’s needs. Ability to work as part of a geographically dispersed team. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Keep up-to-date on technology trends, developments & best practices. Ability to communicate effectively to both technical & non-technical audiences. Does this sound like you? Email your CV today

About Us  Dentsu Aegis Network is a global marketing and communications agency of some 33,000 people. Using a distinctive and creative range of products and services, we help clients build consumer relationships by communicating their products and brands effectively. This range includes marketing and communications strategies through digital creative execution, media planning and buying, mobile applications, content creation, brand tracking and marketing analytics.  The Role     Our high performing Finance team are seeking an experienced and motivated Finance Business Partner to join the business Permanent basis. Supporting the Commercial Finance Director and relevant cluster leadership, this role is responsible for testing compliance across all client contracts while providing strategic commercial compliance advice and guidance to the relevant brand leaders. This is a commercially-focused role, working with leadership teams in achieving business strategy and meeting revenue and profit targets.    Responsibilities include:  Work closely with the Legal team in identifying key contract compliance issues, acting as the conduit between the Legal, Finance and brand teams Ongoing audit and review of all existing and new client contracts to ensure key terms and conditions are met by all parties Provide sound advice to brands on contract compliance issues and client contractual commitments Oversee the production of monthly compliance commentary for local, regional and group reporting, giving a clear understanding of key business trends and scorecard Work with business leaders to understand short, medium and long-term compliance requirements and impact on forecast Provide regular updates and reports around contract compliance for the relevant businesses  Partner with the Commercial Finance Director providing high quality commercial finance support Proactively advise the Commercial Finance Director and Senior Management on proposed key business decisions as they relate to compliance through sound commercial judgement, highlighting options, trade-offs, risks and opportunities Actively partner with the team and Commercial Finance Director to support and assist day to day delivery of objectives and commercial strategies  About you:  The ideal candidate will bring over 8 years of experience in financial management or commercial finance, ideally with a background in audit. You will possess expert knowledge in financial analysis, with a solid understanding of commercial contracts and you will have advanced Excel and PowerPoint capability. Proven success in the media/advertising industry will be highly desirable along with experience in successful collaboration with non-finance stakeholders. Qualifications in Accounting/Finance or an internationally recognized qualification (e.g. CA/CPA) are essential.    Critical to this role is the ability to communicate and form working relationships with stakeholders at all levels. You will have exceptional interpersonal and influencing skills, and not be afraid to challenge existing thinking. Most importantly you will be aligned to the Dentsu Aegis Network core values of being Agile, Pioneering, Ambitions, Responsible and Collaborative! In exchange for your hard work, you will be set up for success with excellent career opportunities. You will also be a part of a truly dynamic organisation which is currently seeing significant transformation and growth.    What's on Offer: Dentsu Aegis Network has unique benefits including discount on health care, free fruit, free monthly themed lunches, health and wellbeing offers, additional annual leave with tenure and much more.  At DAN, a diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work, and be proud of doing so.  For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.

At NEPEAN™ we’re proud to be Australia’s leading privately owned engineering, mining services and industrial manufacturing organisation. We have unique capabilities to deliver high value, innovative and sustainable solutions for the world’s leading mining, construction and transport companies.   NEPEAN Building and Infrastructure – Weldlok® (a division of NEPEAN™) manufactures metal products for the architectural, civil, construction, industrial and mining industries including steel grating, balltube handrails and drainage.   We currently have a unique opportunity for a Business Development Manager to join our Weldlok team in Derrimut Victoria. The primary purpose of this position is to build and maintain new/ existing relationships with NEPEAN customers to generate more profitable revenue for the organisation.   The BDM will be responsible for:  Managing a range of substantial customers and identifying new sales opportunities Developing sales strategies, draft proposals, manage the decision-making process and finalise the sale. Building and maintaining relationships with new and existing customers and going on regular site visits Provide your customers and the company with current market trends and buyer activities Provide exceptional customer service to external and internal customers Negotiate and manage sales contracts with customers, manage accurate records of Sales, Revenue and other important data relating to customer’s portfolio.   This role includes sales of a one-off nature as well as contracted Sales and Projects so to be considered for this role, you must:    Have minimum 2 years’ experience in a similar Account Management/ BDM position Have a Construction/ Industrial background (not essential) Experience working in a results-driven/ KPI environment Be goal-oriented, team player and have a willingness to learn Ability to build and maintain relationships Have excellent verbal and written communication skills   If this role sounds like it is a good fit for you, please send your application via Seek or get in contact with Farha Mirza on Farha.mirza@nepean.com to find out more. This is a permanent position and applicants must have unrestricted work rights in Australia to apply.

About ATMC Education Group Australian Technical and Management College (ATMC) is a nationally recognised educational institute with campuses in Melbourne and Sydney. ATMC is associated with Federation University Australia (FedUni) & University of the Sunshine Coast (USC). ATMC, in association with the partner universities, delivers both Bachelors and Masters Programs in the areas of Information Technology, Information Systems, Business, Management and Accounting, and Professional Year (PY) programs to students. Also delivers VET programs. ATMC constantly strives to deliver a high quality student experience, by delivering quality academic instructions and providing a range of support services to our international and domestic students in order to ensure that their time in Australia is both successful and enjoyable.   About the Role A full time opportunity for  an experienced and qualified candidate who have experience in sales recruiting domestic, international and Skills First learners and have a passion about adult learning. Position Overview The role of the Business Development Representative is flexible and semi-autonomous. You will act as the liaison between potential and existing clients, the role will be to seek new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential and existing customers and generate enrolments of new and existing students. The Business Development Representative demonstrates experience in developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas, has effective communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from first contact until you close the deal, which may require liaison with our training support staff. The role must also ensure proper after-sales service. KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Review daily requests each day from the web site or email enquiries, follow up in person or by telephone and email with clients as appropriate. Provide management with weekly report of sales activities for the past week. Research target market and organizations to identify users, determine training course needs. Concentrate efforts each week on effective prospecting and sales methodologies (cold calling, canvassing, telemarketing, client/associate/newspaper/Internet referrals, etc.) in identifying and "connecting" with prospective clients that need training courses. Target business development activity will include: Daily/Weekly sales & marketing calls; new prospect appointments; telemarketing calls; client development appointments; follow-up calls; customer satisfaction surveys; cold calls; general business development activities and follow-up letters. Partner with student support and admission teams on business development, market and client account penetration, student service/satisfaction strategies and issues. Deliver key business literature and appropriate promotional items to clients and prospects on an ongoing basis. Meet frequently with key client decision-makers and referral sources to generate enrolment/sales. Meet weekly with Management to share success stories and discuss effective sales/business development strategies and methodologies. Continually develop key competencies (sales, computer skills, business analysis, etc.) Carry out all responsibilities in an honest, ethical and professional manner. KEY SELECTION CRITERIA  Suitable Diploma and Degree is preferable but not essential; Proven work experience as a Business Development Representative, Sales Account Executive or similar role;  Demonstrated knowledge and experience of:      (a) Domestic student enrolment sales strategies;  (b) Skills First student enrolment sales strategies and procedures; International onshore student enrolment sales strategies and procedures. Ability to assimilate information quickly, e.g. range of client staffing services; strong systems orientation; Good computer skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) preferred. Skills/Abilities; Ability to think strategically; Synthesize complex business/financial data and develop innovative solutions; Excellent planning, organizing and leadership skills; Excellent verbal, written, sales and executive presentation skills; Strong customer, entrepreneurial, quality and results orientation; Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at all levels and across diverse cultures; Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls); Track record of achieving sales quotas; Familiarity with MS Excel (analysing spreadsheets and charts); Understanding of sales performance metrics; Excellent communication and negotiation skills; Ability to deliver engaging presentations Closing Date: Friday 17 May 2019  How to Apply For your application to be considered, you must submit;  A covering letter responding to the targeted questions below (max 300 words per question) Current resume Key Application Responses Response to the following questions will be required as part of the application. Please prepare your responses in a word document and copy and paste as required. Please limit your responses to a max 300 words per response. Targeted Questions:  Why do you want sell education services? This role can be repetitive (presenting the company and our products/services to multiple clients every day.) What keeps you motivated? You will be required to undertake a national criminal history check and obtain a Working with Children Check (WWCC) clearance as a condition of employment. For more information, visit Office of the Children’s Guardian website. Australian Technical & Management College is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to fostering a diverse workforce. Please note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

1. About Risen Energy Risen Energy is a multinational solar energy company supplying, investing, constructing and operating large scale solar projects. With around 6,500 employees, Risen completed 1GW of projects and have a 2GW development pipeline worldwide. Risen has invested total solar projects over 1000MW in Europe, America, Asia-pacific and Africa. Risen Energy Australia started investments in Utility Scale Solar in 2018 and its Australian operation is growing rapidly.  Currently two large Solar Farms (More than 100 MW each) are being constructed anticipating energisation in 2019. Further, Risen Energy Board has proposed a target of 2 GW of Utility Scale Solar in the Australia by 2022. Risen Energy Australia is a high-achieving organisation experiencing a steady growth in the Australian Business and Our teams are comprised of some of the most talented professionals within the industry. Risen made some major achievements in 2018, and 2019 will build on this success. Therefore it is really a perfect time to join the team. 2. Description Due to continuing growth of the Australian Operation, we are now seeking an experienced Modelling Specialist to join the Project Development and Investment (PDI) team to undertake a leading role in building inhouse modelling expertise in meeting NER/WPR grid connection requirements. The position is based in Brisbane/Melbourne and an attractive remuneration package will be offered based on relevant experience. 3. About the role In this role, you will  support the Grid Connection Manager and the team regarding technical grid connection requirements providing modelling and study expertise; play a pivotal role in setting up the Risen’s internal capability for conducting grid connection studies and establishing Grid connection related processes and procedures for efficient achieving outcomes from project conception through to energisation; also work closely with consultants to ensure GPS studies are conducted in an efficient manner providing modelling insight and expertise. work closely with all stakeholders including NSPs and AEMO in all matters related to grid connections in the NEM and WEM. 4. Key responsibilities include but not limited to:  Build the internal capability to perform PSSE and PSCAD modelling to assess system faults, load flow and dynamic analysis in distribution and transmission systems for preparing connection application model study reports for NSPs and AEMO.  Develop/enhance existing skills and expertise in modelling techniques using PSSE, DigSilent, PSCAD and Python. Work closely with consultants sharing technical expertise (for certain projects) in delivering grid connection studies to ensure the successful completion of S,D, R1 , commissioning and R2 stages of grid connection as required. Play an integral role in Power systems solution development activities Lead generation license and registration applications delivering AEMO Registration requirements such as VCS, ECM, R1 GPS and Generator data sheets Play a leading role in the development of Generator Performance Standards, commissioning plans and R2 testing requirements. Prepare submissions to grid authority in response to grid code and rules changes.  Maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including AEMO, NSPs, consultants and Risen counterparts.  Develop trusted working relationships with head-office, internal and external stakeholders. Provide technical support to EPC team in relevant electrical engineering matters during design and construction Undertake other technical tasks as directed by the grid connection manager from 5. Skills and Experience  Degree in Electrical Engineering or comparable qualifications. Ideal Chartered Engineer or Equivalent (/Registered Professional Engineer/RPEQ) Thorough understanding of power systems theory Advanced skills and experience in power system modelling tools (PSSe, PSCAD, DigSilent) Experience in a technical role in the renewable power generation, transmission or distribution industries within Australia, including experience in power systems studies, Grid connection studies and project implementation. Experience in grid connection procedures with AEMO, DNSP's & TNSP's. Advanced knowledge of DNSP Connection Standards Advanced Knowledge of AEMO and National Electricity Rules Good track record of performing both static and dynamic power system studies Good understanding of the Transmission and Distribution grids in the NEM, NERs and industry accepted practices. Proven experience in power system analysis and planning Proven experience and knowledge of transmission system planning, power system modelling and dynamic analysis Proven experience and knowledge of transient stability studies, load flow studies, fault studies, transmission system planning, generator connection studies and renewable integrati Experience in common simulation software, PSS/E, DigSIlent Power factory, Matlab, Python Fortran, C/C++, PSCAD Experience with onsite generator testing (R2 testing) for compliance and power system model validation Experience in Generator Commissioning that include R2/hold point testings 6. What is in it for you  With a growing business, you are in an excellent position to see your own development excel at a fast pace You will experience in commercial aspects of the renewable generation development Gain experience or exposure to all aspects of Solar Generation Development from conceptual stage to project commissioning and energisation while closely interacting with Multidisciplinary teams, Consultants, Contractors and all other stakeholders including NSPs and AEMO 7. Requirements  While the position is office based, you will occasionally travel to interstate Solar project sites to oversee R2 commissioning or NSPs for meetings Must be an Australian Citizen / Permanent Resident Australian Drivers’ Licence A full time role is preferred (38 hours per week) but could be negotiated. The company endorses flexible working practices for all staff. This is a key role during a period of unprecedented growth for Risen Energy. If you possess the required skills and experience then please submit your CV and Cover letter (preferred) to sandrine.he@risenenergy.com before the 22 May 2019.

job_title: Head of Human Resources - Global Business
job_description: We are looking for a Head of HR to join this dynamic, fast paced and customer focused global retail organisation. Reporting into the CEO, this role will play a critical part in building a high performing organisation.   Alongside the day to day running of the people function and team management, you will establish best practice HR processes, systems and programmes to achieve strategic objectives. You will also develop and implement initiatives that will focus on talent, development, building capability and wellness to support the fact that people are your greatest asset.   Your Skills: With previous extensive success driving HR strategy and continuous improvement, you are more than just a people person. Your empowering and inclusive leadership is a beacon to the broader business, winning engagement and positivity from all levels. You have an uncanny ability of identifying opportunities and leveraging them to influence positive change outcomes. Being able to drive culture and bring people on the journey, is what sets you apart. In addition, the successful candidate will bring to the role;  A relevant tertiary qualification, or equivalent work experience, combined with significant, successful change management Demonstrable experience delivering senior level HR strategy and services to a large and complex business with a unionised workforce Sound working knowledge of AUS employment and IR laws and best practice A commercially astute, strategic thinker with strong intellectual rigour and a demonstrated track record of successfully leading an HR function, ideally gained in the RETAIL sector.  You bring strong operational and generalist proficiency, combined with your ability to think and act strategically. You are a strong influencer who gets results by being credible and socialising ideas.  Your exceptional relationship skills and commercial acumen will allow you to partner with the business, influence stakeholders and establish a credible reputation for HR through the provision of quality service to your customers.   On offer is a genuine opportunity to grow and develop your career within a collaborative, passionate and driven team environment in a business that recognises and rewards results. If you thrive on building long-term and mutually rewarding business relationships and have a passion analytics, explore this opportunity further by submitting your WORD formatted CV via the Apply link.   At Metropol Recruitment we make every effort to respond to all applications, however sometimes the volume we receive is so large it is not possible. If you do not receive a response from us, please don't take it personally as we really value the effort you made to apply.

If the above sounds like you and what you are looking for in another phase in your career, please apply with your resume (including references) and a covering letter, explaining what you would bring to the role.   Please note that short-listed candidates will be required to undergo a pre-employment medical that includes drug and alcohol screening.  PremiAir Hire is an Equal Opportunity Employer who believes diversity can deliver advantages to our business and workplace.

Associated Retailers Limited is a growing retail and wholesale service group which specialises in buying and marketing a range of products across a variety of retail businesses under well-known brand names; including Sportspower, Toyworld, Camping World, Compleat Angler and Mensland. Reporting to the Member Operational Support Team Manager, the Business Coach role can work from anywhere to service our existing member base of stores nationally. The Business Coach  will  work closely with our member businesses to assess the current state of their retail business and  develop recommendations to improve their operations with a focus on revenue growth, store experience, inventory management, local business environment, marketing activity and exit plans. Key activities for this role will include:  Consulting with our members to really understand their business at both a macro and micro level including identification of the constraints and opportunities; Evaluating data from the business diagnosis and developing a list of priorities that align with member goals and ARL business objectives; Engaging with divisional GMs and other ARL stakeholders to action the priorities; Developing strong relationships with members and providing ongoing business guidance, mentoring and coaching; and Ensuring that members have a high level of awareness of the services offered by ARL and that they are continually optimising their membership. About you You will be a commercially savvy, adept relationship builder and problem solver with very strong business acumen and in-depth knowledge of the way in which economic and market conditions impact small businesses. Ideally you will be a previous small business owner or have experience consulting to small businesses, preferably in the retail space.  Further skills we will be looking for include:  Well developed analytical and problem-solving skills Project management and project leadership skills Exceptional relationship building skills, quickly able to build trust and rapport Excellent communication skills – both written and verbal This role can be performed from anywhere, as our members businesses are located around Australia.  Some travel may be required. If you are looking for a rewarding role where you can really make an impact on small businesses and be part of a fast paced and dynamic business, this opportunity could be just what you have been waiting for.

job_title: Ed Support Level 1-Range 2 Reporting Coordinator and Daily Org.
job_description:
Location Profile








Hoppers Crossing Secondary College opened in 1984 and is a single campus,
Co-educational school with an enrolment of approximately 1,500 students.
Situated in an urban growth corridor, approximately 20 minutes west of Melbourne, the College welcomes students from Years 7 to 12, from Hoppers Crossing and the surrounding district. 
 Innovative and challenging educational programs
The College places great importance on developing innovative and challenging educational
programs, through which young people recognise the value of growth through learning. This is
being achieved through a close working partnership of staff, students, parents and the wider
community. Hoppers Crossing Secondary College aims to achieve the extra-ordinary by providing an
education which has a focus on each individual student and developing their potential. Academic
rigour is valued at all stages of learning and the classroom focus is on challenge, engagement and
achievement. All staff focus on the delivery of a Common Instructional Teaching Model centred on the 9 High Yield Teaching Strategies that produce significant learning gains for every student. The time and effort that teachers put into their classes ensures the best educational outcomes for our students
which has most recently been reflected in our improved VCE Results.
We take pride in offering our students guided support throughout their chosen pathway of VCE,
VCAL or VET studies and prepare them for post-secondary options, including tertiary entry and
further training or employment. In recent years our rate of Year 12 students entering further
education, training or full time employment has been maintained at over 90%.
Co-curricular & Enrichment Programs
Hoppers Crossing Secondary College offers a diverse range of innovative educational co-curricula
and enrichment programs across Years 7 to 12. These programs include international exchange
programs such as: Estancia High School California Cultural Exchange Program, Chinese Overseas Learning Experience and Italy Language Immersion Program. Other co-curricula programs include
- High Resolves Student Leadership Program, Year 9 High Achievers Preparation Program, Year 7 &
8 Numeracy and Literacy Support Programs, School For Student Leadership, Wakakirri Secondary
Schools Challenge, Inter-House & Inter-School Sports, Year 7 and 10 Scholarship Programs, Student
Representative Council, Junior and Senior Music Programs and Group Performances, Work
Experience Programs, Managed Individual Pathways for all students from Years 10 — 12 and Parent
Information Sessions across all levels. Through University Enhancement Studies and TAFE articulation pathway programs, it is possible to incorporate TAFE certificates and University degree studies within the students’ VCE/VCAL years.
ICT facilities
The College prioritises ICT across the curriculum with the inclusion of interactive whiteboards
in selected classrooms and media projectors in every classroom, as well as two Apple Mac
laboratories and two Microsoft laboratories as well as  a BYOD/1 to 1 Netbook Program, aimed toward preparing students with the skills required for them to take their place as 21st century learners and citizens.







Selection Criteria








SC1    Demonstrated experience and skills in coordinating a specific education support function. 
SC2    Demonstrated capacity to supervise the work of other support staff and to develop procedures and guidelines relating to the work area. 
SC3    Demonstrated high level oral and written communication skills. 
SC4    Possess the technical knowledge and expertise relevant to the position. 
SC5    Demonstrated capacity to provide advice and support to management in respect to the work area. 
SC6    Demonstrated commitment to professional learning and growth for both self and others.







Role








Performs and/or supervises tasks that are carried out in accordance with guidelines, accepted practice and school policy.  This may include the supervision and coordination of other education support class staff within the work area or educational program.  Supervision and coordination would be limited to ensuring routine tasks are performed to required standards.  Input into identifying training needs and development of education support class staff within the work area or educational program becomes an important feature at range 2.
Specialised support to achieve specific outcomes is a feature of range 2.  Typically this will involve accountability for a single function, (e.g. ensuring data is properly maintained) or the operation of a work area (e.g. managing the day to day operation of a school office) under the direction of the principal or another senior manager.
Provides support to teachers and students that is beyond the routine support provided at education support class Level 1, range 1.  Within an educational program assists teachers with the coordination of the support function, such as directing/organising the work of other support staff or providing a specialist support role. 
Undertakes medical intervention support tasks or other specialised student/teacher support roles that require specific training that must be updated from time to time.  The role is for a specific purpose for which there will be direct accountability as opposed to support roles that are carried out by a range of staff performing routine tasks under direction.
Performs technical tasks that require a sound knowledge of basic technical and/or scientific principles that are used to develop and adapt work methods and make judgements where there are clear guidelines and limited options.  Routine technical support in libraries, science and information technology laboratories would be typical examples.
An education support class position supports the educational services being provided to students, but must not include duties of teaching as defined in clause 2.6.1 of the Education and Training Reform Act 2006 (Vic) or its successor.  Supervision of students cannot be required except where it is an integral part of the employee's position or involves supervision of students individually or in small groups, in controlled circumstances, where the responsibility for students remains clearly with a teacher.







Responsibilities








-    Provides coordination support to teachers through rostering and the organisation of the work of a team of aides, including supervision and guidance. -    Conducts routine presentations to parents to assist teachers in communicating objectives and outcomes relating to educational programs and/or students. -    Liaise with external providers of support services. -    Provide medical intervention support that involves a specific medical condition approved by the Department, requires specialised training/instruction that requires regular updating and has clearly defined responsibility for the administration of such support.







Who May Apply








Individuals with the aptitude, experience and/or qualifications to fulfill the specific requirements of the position.







EEO AND OHS Commitment








The Department values diversity and is committed to workforce diversity and equal opportunity in schools and all education workplaces. The Department recognises that the provision of family friendly, supportive, safe and harassment free workplaces is essential to high performance and promotes flexible work, diversity and safety across all schools and Department workplaces.







Child Safe Standards








Victorian government schools are child safe environments. Our schools actively promote the safety and wellbeing of all students, and all school staff are committed to protecting students from abuse or harm in the school environment, in accordance with their legal obligations including child safe standards. All schools have a Child Safety Code of Conduct consistent with the Department’s exemplar available at http://www.education.vic.gov.au/about/programs/health/protect/Pages/childsafestandards.aspx







DET Values








The Department’s employees commit to upholding DET’s Values: Responsiveness, Integrity, Impartiality, Accountability, Respect, Leadership and Human Rights. DET’s Values complement each school’s own values and underpin the behaviours the community expects of Victorian public sector employees, including those who work in Victorian Government Schools. Information on the DET values is available at http://www.education.vic.gov.au/hrweb/workm/Pages/Public-Sector-Values.aspx







Other Information








-Specific information in relation to this position can be found on the College website under the ‘contact’ link. (www.hopcross.vic.edu.au)
-The Selection Panel reserves the right to seek referees other than those nominated on your application.
- All applicants need to be aware that with regard to the Child Safety Standards, information may be collected in order to establish their suitability for child-connected work.
- All staff employed by the Department of Education and Training and schools have access to a broad range of employment conditions and working arrangements. 
- Appointment of successful applicants will be made subject to the satisfaction of pre-employment conditions. 
-  A probationary period may apply during the first year of employment and induction and support programs provided. 
- Detailed information on all terms and conditions of employment is available online at the Department's Human Resources website at:- 







Conditions of Employment















Program Benefits














 Please note that all applications must go through the application steps described on the original position description.

job_title: HR Systems - Data Manager, Success Factors
job_description: Fantastic opportunity for an HR Systems Administrator to join our team in Sydney on a 6-month contract.  As part of our Group Operations team, reporting to the HR Systems Manager and actively contributing to HR team activities, your responsibilities will include:  Maintaining the integrity and accuracy of information in Stockland's HR system; Working through Data Governance items; Create and maintain reports in SuccessFactors to address any data management inconsistencies; Analyse the reports to identify areas of focus and where additional training and support is required in the business; Ensure that the data being held in SuccessFactors is of a suitable quality and standard; Establish a BAU way of working with SuccessFactors data so that inconsistencies are managed effectively and the number of errors is reduced.  About you  Two or more years’ experience in data administration or systems implementation; Ideally have a degree in an IT or HR related field; SuccessFactors experience; Solid computer and database management skills coupled with the ability to understand technical documentation; Ability to work independently as well as in a group; Excellent attention to detail and a proven ability to deliver with accuracy and thoroughness.  Ready for new challenges, a new environment and a new system to dig into? With SuccessFactors, the opportunities for input, ideas and 'your time to shine' are endless!   At Stockland we are a company delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career.  Stockland has a strong commitment to achieving the best outcomes through an inclusive and collaborative culture. Our customers come from diverse backgrounds and we want our teams to reflect this.  We offer competitive remuneration and benefits. Benefits include free to access or subsidised lifestyle, health, well-being and financial services products.  Agencies should note that unsolicited resumes will not be accepted for this position and Stockland will not pay any fees related to resumes that are submitted directly to hiring managers and not through our approved process. Where appropriate, the Careers @ Stockland Team will work with our preferred panel of agencies to source candidates for roles. Please submit any queries relating to the approved process of submitting candidate resumes or Stockland’s preferred agency panel to careers@stockland.com.au
